loans.name: Flor De Viento Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE VIENTO” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Noemi es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chantilin, venta de fruta, ayudante de transporte, venta de comida, venta de chompas, servicio de odontología.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Noemi es integrante, ella indica que  hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por necesidad de generar una fuente de generación de ingresos y al observar el alto comercio de este producto decide emprenderlo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo, aceite) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializa en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella  es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrecen en la institución.
texts.en:
The "FLOR DE VIENTO" [Wind Flower] communal bank consists of eight members and is about to start its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer. This organization is part of the Santiago II Regional Office. A board of directors, led by Señora Noemi, manages Flor de Viento. The bank members run varied businesses that include sales of foods such as pastries, fruits, and other items; serving as a conductor on a bus; and a dental practice. 
 
The Flor de Viento members are applying for a loan that will help small business owners such as Señora Noemi, a married mother of three children. Señora Noemi has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, having joined the organization at the invitation of a friend who was a Pro Mujer partner. Señora Noemi saw great potential in food sales, and needing a source of income, learned how to run a business preparing and selling food. 

Señora Noemi is applying for a loan to increase her capital so she can purchase rice, noodles, and oil at markets in El Alto. She will then use these supplies to prepare food that she sells from her stall. This work allows Señora Noemi to generate income she needs to meet her household expenses  and support her husband and three children. 

Asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Señora Noemi replies that the organization offers health care.

loans.use: to purchase rice, noodles, and oil.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would now like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better! More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Madelyn dreams that her business will last a long time, and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge, a sus 55 años de edad, es un hombre creativo y trabajador, dedicado a su familia y a su labor.
Desde hace aproximadamente 20 años se dedica a elaborar artesanías en madera, tallando diversas figuras decorativas, especialmente con los personajes de Disney, las cuales son enviadas al extranjero y a diferentes ciudades del país para ser comercializadas; el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica por medio de la observación y, poco a poco fue perfeccionando las técnicas; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar y dar sustento a su esposa y a su hijo.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de materia prima al por mayor (madera, vinilos, pegante), esto le dará la posibilidad de cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendientes y así dar paso para obtener nuevos contratos, logrando aumentar sus ventas e ingresos.
Jorge manifiesta que cada día se levanta con el firme propósito de luchar por sus sueños, entre los que cuenta tener una vivienda propia, exportar sus productos en grandes cantidades y abrir un almacén para comercializar de manera directa sus productos, dentro de la ciudad; así podrá dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 55 years old and is a creative and hardworking man, dedicated to his family and his work.  He has been making crafts out of wood for 20 years, carving different decorative figures, specifically Disney characters which are shipped to foreign countries and different cities in the country.  He learned this by watching and little by little he perfected his technique.  He generates sufficient resources to pay the household expenses and support his wife and son.

He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies (lumber, vinyl, glue).  This will provide the possibility to fill his pending orders and obtain new contracts to increase his sales and income.

Jorge says that he rises each day with the firm purpose of working toward his dreams.  Among them are having a home of his own, exporting his products in larger quantities, and opening a store to sell his products directly within the city.  This will allow him to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Nary, 61, is married with seven children residing in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district, Cambodia. For the last 41 years, she has been growing tobacco. She and her husband can earn about 40,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to meet the family’s needs.
  
Nary just began with VisionFund this loan cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Nary is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crops so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Zarmeen

texts.en: Zarmeen is a 34-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters and one son. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building making. In this regard, her husband needs raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work so that he can generate more income for the financial support of his family. Zarmeen is applying for loan from a Kiva field partner for her husband's work. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories.

loans.name: Yaritas Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YARITAS DEL ROSARIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maribel es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de costura de polleras, servicio de construcción, venta de fruta, venta de ropa, venta de frescos, venta de chuño.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maribel es integrante, ella indica que  es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus tíos que comercializan este producto hace años, cuando se casó decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializa en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella  es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrecen en la institución.
texts.en:
The Yaritas Del Rosario community group will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board where Maribel is the president. The businesses that the members of the community association manage are varied. Among them are: skirt sewing shop, construction service, fruit sales, clothing sales, beverage sales, chuño sales ( a dehydrated potato).

The loan they are taking will benefit the small businesses where Maribel is a member. She indicates that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer, joining on the invitation of her friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling fruit. She disclosed that she learned this business from her uncles who have sold this product for years. When she married, she decided to start her own business.

The loan that she will now take is to expand capital to buy fruit that she will acquire from the markets in the city of El Alto and later sell from her stall. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family since she is married and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Sokhoern's Group

texts.en:
Sokhoern is aged 54 years and married with two dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Kang Meas district, earning a living through farming rice and selling grocery items. Her husband works as a worker to help earn income to support the family. Together, they can earn about 107,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day from the current business and can save about 40,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

This is Sokhoern’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she and her group member have been members of VisionFund for one loan cycle. She successfully used the loan to better her living conditions. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sokhoern will use her portion to buy a decent motorbike for her to commute to work. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a proper vehicle to commute.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to commute to work

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, an honest and resilient farmer in rural southwestern Uganda, wants to thank Kiva lenders for having funded his previous loan. His agriculture output increased after mulching his banana plantation.

John was motivated to start up a retail shop because it was profitable and he wanted to develop his household and village. He hopes to use the loan to add capital into his retail business. He usually sells his products to local residents. He faces a challenge of clients who take goods on credit and refuse to pay their debts.

He is committed to repay his loans in time and thanks Ugafode for supporting his business growth.

loans.use: To buy retail stock

loans.name: Wipala Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WIPALA” iniciará el décimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Daría es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesano en cuero, chiflería (material de servicios ceremoniales andinos), venta de comida, tejido de mantas de vicuña, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Daria es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de chiflería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de su madre, ya que era un negocio familiar, después de haberse casado decidió realizar su trabajo independientemente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de material ceremonial) que adquirirá en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en ese espacio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “WIPALA” community association will begin it’s nineteenth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center. It has 8 members led by a board of directors where Daría is the president. The members of this communal bank engage in different businesses such as leather handicraft, medicinal herbs (materials for Andean ceremonial services), food sales, handmade vicuña blankets and neighbourhood store. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit small microenterprises where Daría is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is also a member in the institution. She currently has a business selling medicinal herbs. She gained knowledge about this business on recommendation from her mother, as it was a family business, after getting married she decided to do this work independently.      

The loan she will now receive is to increase capital (purchase of ceremonial materials) that she will get from the markets in the city of El Alto and later will sell it in this space.   Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as she is in a common-law relationship.  
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase ceremonial materials.

loans.name: Chojña Pampita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHOJÑA PAMPITA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eusebia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de manta, trenzado de manta, comerciante, tienda de barrio, venta de queso, tienda de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eusebia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de manta; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, que tenía el mismo negocio y ella le ayudo desde niña, cuando ella se casó y tuvo un pequeño capital inicio su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Chojna Pampita community group will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Copacabana. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board where Eusebia is the president. The businesses that the members of the community association manage are varied. Among them are: blanket sales, rug braiding, sales, neighborhood shop, cheese sales, a grocery store.

The loan they are taking will benefit the small businesses where Eusebia is a member. She indicates that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, joining on the invitation of a promoter of the institution who visited her at home. Currently, she has a business sewing and selling blankets. She disclosed that she learned this business from her mother who had the same business and she helped her since she was young. When she married and had a small amount of capital, she started her business.

The loan that she will now take is to expand capital to buy wool that she will acquire from the markets in the city of El Alto and later use for production and sales from her stall. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family since she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loan and training the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wool.

loans.name: M. Ali

texts.en:
M. Ali is a 42-year-old married man. He lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan, with his spouse and three children. 

He has been in the business of selling milk since childhood. He learned all the techniques regarding milk production from his father. This is the only source of income for the family; he has to devote his full time and energy to his dairy farm alone. He delivers milk in the market and door-to-door as well. For delivery purposes, he uses his bicycle. He loads milk cans on his bicycle and delivers it early in the morning. His customers like the fresh and delicious milk he delivers. 

His monthly savings has become too low due to a rapid increase in household expenses; the excess utility bills, school fees, uniforms and expensive books has greatly affected his savings. He wants to buy an additional buffalo so that he can cope with the household expenses. However, he finds it difficult due to financial constraints.

Therefore, M. Ali planned to purchase one more buffalo to increase his sales, so that he can generate more income and savings as well. M. Ali has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. He hopes to provide a quality education for his children and to buy a motorbike to deliver the milk. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milk production.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa de 58 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos de 19, 21 y 9 años de edad. Ella es costurera, además de eso se dedica al comercio y crianza de pollos desde hace más de 10 años con su esposo, el cual además de ayudarle con el negocio se dedica a la agricultura.

Teresa no sabe mucho leer ni escribir,  ya que estudio muy poco. El trabajo ha sido su vida ya que ha luchado para salir a delante con sus hijos y su esposo trabaja todos los días en el campo, en la crianza de pollos lo cual tiene cerca de su casa; porque no camina mucho para llegar a realizar dicha actividad, la señora esta muy pendiente de su negocio, ya que es la fuente que le provee la mayor parte sus ingresos.

Su negocio necesita crecer por lo que necesita financiamiento, ya que el negocio no rinde lo suficiente para cubrir la demanda y necesita capital para poder comprar  más pollos, ya que aumentara sus ingresos y su estado de vida mejorara grandemente.

Su visión como madre es ver que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y verlos como unos verdaderos profesionales, su nivel de vida cambiara y su estado económico, con respecto a las ganancias que surjan del negocio las empleara en educación de sus hijos,  sueña con poseer una granja fuerte y rentable que mejore su estado de vida y calidad de la misma.
texts.en:
Teresa is 58 years old, married and the mother of three children aged 9, 19 and 21 years old. She is a seamstress and has also been raising chickens with her husband for the past 10 years. Her husband besides helping her with the chickens is a farmer.

Teresa cannot read much or write. Work has been her life as she struggles to get ahead with her children. Her husband works every day in the fields. The chickens are kept close to the house so they don't have to walk very far to take care of them. Teresa is very dependent on this business as it is the source of most of her income. 

Teresa needs a loan to expand her business as it does produce enough to meet the current demand. She needs capital to buy more chickens and her income will increase and her standard of living will improve greatly. Her vision as a mother is to see her children finish their studies and become true professionals. She wants her living standard  and economic situation to change, As regards to the profits generated by her business she will use them for the education of her children. She dreams of having a large and profitable farm that will improve the quality of her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase CDs and movies to stock his businesses at one time.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is 33 years old and married with a daughter and two sons. He and other members of his family are refugees and have lived in an IDP (Internationally Displaced Persons) settlement for a long time. He is a farmer and has nine years of experience in this industry. He harvests and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables. His monthly income is 160 AZN.

Azerbaijan cuisine is very rich and various. People cook different delicious national dishes using vegetables, such as badimjan dolmasi and yarpagh dolmasi. They use fruits to prepare different kinds of fresh juices and jams. They like to eat jam while drinking tea.

Samir’s income isn’t enough to cover his family’s expenses. He needs to pay for his children's education and utility costs, as well as covering other expenses. He applied for 2,000 AZN loan in order to supply new kinds of fruits and vegetables and to make his green grocery’s assortment wider. He hopes that this will increase his income somehow.

loans.use: to supply new kinds of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pigs and livestock to slaughter.

loans.name: Mangalashakti Group

texts.en:
Bisakha, aged about 40 years, is the leader of a group that hails from Muniguda of the Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She has two sons, aged 3 and 1, and two daughters, aged about 12 and 6. The member standing second from the right with her hand raised is Bisakha. 

Bisakha is running a fancy store, which has cosmetic items for ladies, and stationery items, in her locality for the last six years. In 2011, Bisakha, along with three other members of her village, formed a group and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses. This is the second-cycle loan.  

At the time of availing her first loan, her sales were not sufficient to meet her daily needs. Out of their small income, they are maintaining their family in a low profile. Now, she is very much confident in running her business and has developed her shop significantly. At present, her monthly income is about Rs. 6,500. 

Bisakha wants to take a further loan to purchase face creams, soaps, detergents, bangles, beauty creams, etc., as a big stock of cosmetic items and stationery items in a lump sum to avail a cash discount.  

She has a dream to construct a shop and buy an iron rack to keep her fancy items.

The three other members of the group are named Santilata, Jayanti and Susila, and are doing leaf plate-making, a pan shop and a daily home-needs shop respectively.

loans.use: to purchase face creams, soaps, detergents, bangles, beauty creams, stationery items, etc.

loans.name: Cuyauris De San Roque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CUYAURIS DE SAN ROQUE” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juliana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de transporte, tejido de mantas, elaboración de muebles, venta de carne de cordero, tienda de llantería, venta de comida, ayudante de mecánica.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juliana es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de carne; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar que este producto era muy comercializado en el mercado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne) que adquirirá en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en ese espacio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene trece hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “CUYAURIS DE SAN ROQUE” communal bank is starting their 3rd cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional office. It has 8 members and is lead by a board of directors with Juliana as President. The businesses that the members have are varied: transportation services, weaving blankets, making furniture, selling sheep meat, a tire shop, food sales and a mechanic's assistant. 

The loan will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs, Juliana being one of them. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago on the invitation of a friend who is a member. Juliana has a butcher's shop. She told us that she started this business observing that a lot of meat was sold in the market. The loan she is requesting is to invest in her working capital (buying meat) that she will buy in the markets of the city of El Alto and later sell in her shop. This work allows her to generate the resources she needs to support her family as she is married and has 13 children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the Health services and training offered by the institution

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is married with four children. She is 37 years old and lives in Sta.Cruz, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Leila sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns 1,500 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities.

Leila has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Leila hopes to improve and expand her business and other profits will be used for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy, 46, is married with four children and lives in a rural village of the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. To support her family, she has been growing tobacco for 26 years. Together, they can earn about $8 per day and can save about $3 each day for future needs.

Sophy is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan. She is going to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Carlos Marío

texts.es:
Carlos de 47 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado,  la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos tiene 6 hijos y 5 de ellos están en la escuela.

Carlos es pastor evangélico de una iglesia del cantón de donde vive,  él se ha dedicado a esto desde ya hace 4 años. Antes estuvo en el cuartel, fue ahí donde un amigo le vendió una biblia y él todas  las noches la leía y ahí el sintió el llamado de Dios  y decido que donde él anduviera le iba hablar a las personas de la palabra de Dios. Entonces se vino para el cantón y vio la necesidad de poner una iglesia de construir una champa y reunir personas y hablarle de las cosas de Dios y es ahí donde la administración de la iglesia deciden darle una ofrenda pero que es decisión de los que administran la iglesia, ya que también es motorista de un bus que hace un recorrido del Municipio a la ciudad y esa es una fuente de ingresos que tiene para la familia este negocio de manejar el bus le queda a una distancia de 20 minutos y viaja a pie y lo hace de un horario de las 5 de la mañana a las 5 de la tarde que hace el último viaje esto lo hace 4 días de la semana.

Don Carlos con el préstamo solicitado,  comprara un poste para el tendido eléctrico y pagara la bajada de la luz electrónica a al templo,  ya que solo tienen las instalaciones y los cables para la iglesia esto mejorara el templo porque la energía se las presta una vecina y cuando invitan a grupos de alabanzas y traen demasiados aparatos esa energía no la levanta por lo débil que es, pero ya poniendo la energía directo será mejor ya podrán llegar  mas grupos y así poder gozarse en las cosas de Dios y los jóvenes y todas las personas que vengan , ya que las cosas de Dios son muy buenas mas hoy en día como está la situación, es para que los jóvenes vengan y los padres puedan enviar los hijos. 

Los sueños para el futuro es poder tener una iglesia muy grande,  con paredes de ladrillo ya que por el momento son  de láminas pero tiene fe que en un tiempo lo realizara  y que así sus hijos puedan crecer en los caminos de Dios, ya que otro camino como ese no hay.
texts.en:
Carlos is 47 years old. He finished sixth grade. His wife is dedicated to domestic work. He has six children and five of them are in school.

Carlos is an evangelical pastor in a church in the area where he lives. He has been dedicated to this for four years. Before he was in the quarter and there a friend sold him a Bible  which he read every night and felt called by God and decided that wherever he walked he would talk to people about the word of God. Then he came to the area and saw the need to start a church in a hut and gather people and talk about Godly things and there the church administration decided to give him a gift but it is up to those who run the church since he is also a bus driver who does a route in the city and is the source of income for his family. This business driving a bus is 20 minutes away and he travels on foot and works from 5AM until 5PM when the last trip is and he does this four days per week.

With the loan requested, Carlos will be a pole for wiring and pay for the electric light installation to the temple since they have only the facilities and cables for the church. This will improve the temple because they borrow electricity from a neighbor and when they invite praise groups who bring too many devices, the electricity doesn't come on due to weakness. But installing direct electricity will be better since they will be able to bring more groups and enjoy the things of God and the young people and all of the people who come since the things of God are very good but today as it stands is for young parents to come and send their children.

The dreams for the future are to be able to have a large church with brick walls since, at the moment, they are made of sheets but he has faith that in time he will accomplish this. Also that his children can grown in the ways of God since there is now way like this one.

loans.use: to buy a pole for wiring and to pay for electricity connection to the temple.

loans.name: Perlitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PERLITAS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por once  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Antonia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de manta, venta de ropa, venta de calzados, venta de chicharrones, elaboración de asientos de fierros, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Antonia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con el préstamo que saco de Pro Mujer y con el concejo de su tía abrió un espacio de venta de comida.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras y abarrotes) que adquirirá en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente al elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The "PERLITAS" communal association is beginning a sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes focal center.  It is made up of eleven members, and is headed by an executive committee of which Antonia is the secretary.  The businesses that the members of the communal association operate are varied, and include the following: selling blankets, selling clothing, selling shoes, selling pork cracklings, making iron chairs, and selling food.  The loan they will be taking will help small microbusiness owners such as Antonia.  She says that she has belonged to Pro Mujer for two years, after being invited to join by her sister-in-law who is a member.  She now has a business selling food, and says that this business was started with a previous loan that she received through Pro Mujer.  On the advice of her aunt, she opened a stall where she sells food.  The loan that she is now taking is to add to her capital (by buying vegetables and groceries).  She will buy these items in markets in the city of El Alto, and then use them to make the products that she sells in her food stall.  This work will allow her to earn income to support her family, as she is married and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health care that is offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and groceries.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man, and he has eight children. He describes himself as creative. He operates a retail business where he makes jikos, a type of cooking stove that uses charcoal, to sell. He has been involved in this business for twelve years. 

Francis' business is located in a highly populated area, and his primary customers are local consumers. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy a stock of metal sheets and other materials to make jikos and pay the school fees for his children. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life.

loans.use: to buy a stock of metal sheets and other materials to make jikos and pay for school fees.

loans.name: Caryl

texts.en:
Caryl previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase greater quantities and more variety of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in higher profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Caryl hopes to have more loyal customers and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and it's where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Heculano

texts.en:
Heculano, 64 years old, lives in Helen, Larena, Siquijor. He was gifted with four children. 

He has experienced hardships, especially in raising his family. This industrious man finds himself in a poultry business and a variety of other agricultural activities.
 
In need of additional working capital, Heculano decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. He has received several loans already and recently requested 50,000 PHP for buying chickens, feed and to build a new chicken cage.

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, he has been able to manage his income. He is able to provide for the daily needs of his family. Heculano is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, he might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in his finances.

loans.use: to purchase additional chicks and feed, and to build a new chicken cage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for her shop.

loans.name: Akalu Group

texts.en:
“A woman can take care of the family. It takes a man to provide structure, to provide stability.” says Ranithoilu, and she also shares about her grief when she lost her husband two years back. Family structures and stability without the father, who is the head of the family, is deterred and weaker.

Ranithoilu is pictured with her hand raised as she is the featured borrower for Akalu Group. Akalu's literal meaning is united; she and the other four members support each other and stood as one to form the group. The village in which they live is about 30 kms from Imphal town and the village is located about 5 kms away from the national highway.

Left with no other means to support her two sons, Ranithoilu brews wine and sells it for a profit. Brewing wine is a traditional practice for the tribe and Ranithoilu learnt her brewing skills from her parents' home. She usually purchase rice, yeast and other requisite materials from the main market and brews wine. She also sells the left-over fermented solid rice for pig food. She utilises everything she produces in generating income. 

Most of the customers come to her house and purchase the wine; sometimes she also serves them on the spot and charges them an extra service charge. Bigger clay pots are required to brew a good quality wine, but she could not afford to get one and produce a bigger quantity. The generated income is mainly used for her kid’s education and other basic needs like food and clothes. With the help of the Kiva loan, she will purchase a bigger pot, rice and yeast and produce more wine. The neighbouring villages will be sufficiently supplied and in return get paid.

With the assistance of the Kiva loan, she wants to purchase materials and expand her business. Her dream is to provide higher education to her sons and let them be successful. She will work very hard to support her kids and will also repay the loan amount. Grateful and delighted, Ranituilu says, “ Thank you so much, Kiva, for the wonderful experience.” She will always remain grateful for helping her expand her brewing business.

The rest of the group members are also engaged in brewing wine.

loans.use: to purchase materials like rice, yeast and bigger pots to brew local wine, generate more income and support the family and kids' education.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is smart woman. She is married and has two children. She lives with her family in the south part of Tajikistan. Jamila’s husband is a doctor, and she has a pedagogical education. 

Jamila has worked in a school for over ten years. She always tries to develop her knowledge. Now, she is studying at the university to get a second higher education. Jamila is asking for a loan of 2,000 Tajikistani somoni to pay for tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Marath

texts.en: Marath is 22 years old. He is single and lives with his mother in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has been running a tailoring shop for more than a year, earning approximately $8 daily. To improve his business, Marath is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase cloth to resell and make more clothes to sell. By doing so, he would be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, he would like to expand his shop and build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to resell and make more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa previously accessed a PHP 40,000 loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. She also has a variety store for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 40,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products, to add in her current inventory. She will also use her loan to buy merchandise products for her direct selling business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell should result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Luisa hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams that her family is always in good health. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
Shahodat was born in 1974. She is an industrious woman. Shahodat is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Shahodat began her business, selling milk, three years ago, but she had a small income. So, she rejected this business. 

She is going to organize a new business now because she needs money. She is going to organize a business with sewing. She is asking for a loan of TJS 500 (somoni) to buy a sewing machine to organize her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her new business.

loans.name: Tursunjon

texts.en: Tursunjon was born in 1966 year. She is widow. Tursunjon is bringing up a son. She has been busy with sewing national women dresses more than 12 years. She also sews national mattresses. She has a great experience and manages with business successfully. She always wanted to have a higher degree but she has not had the opportunity to get a higher education. Her son studies in a school. She must to pay for her son’s tuition. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to pay for tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her son

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 36-year-old married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. He describes himself to be disciplined and determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that operating the business during the rainy season is difficult. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts to repair his bicycle and also buy a new bicycle. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and also improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: buy spare parts to repair his bicycle and also buy a new bicycle

loans.name: Eva Isabel

texts.es:
Eva de 40 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado, se casó a la edad de los veinte años, procreo tres hijos con su pareja. La mayor tiene diecinueve años, está haciendo su segundo año en la universidad, la segunda hace noveno grado y la última séptimo, su pareja se marchó hacia los estados unidos, para darles a todos una mejor estabilidad.


Ella no tiene ningún tipo de negocio, por lo que solo se dedica al cuido del hogar y de sus hijas, es la que se encarga de todos los quehaceres del que le corresponde como mamá.


El proyecto que realizara, es para instalar la energía eléctrica a su casa, ya que no cuentan con tal servicio que es de tata utilidad hoy en día, con esta sus hijos podrán estudiar por las noches después que vienen de clases.

Su sueño es que sus hijas sean profesionales, poderlas sacar adelante por medio del sacrificio  que incurre tener hijos estudiando, espera que sus hijas se preparen para que un día, sean ellas las que la mantenga en su vejez, todo esto lo logra con la bendición de Dios y su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Eva is 40 years old. She studied up to Grade 6 and got married at 20. She has 3 children with her partner. The oldest is 19 and is in their second year of university. The second child is in Grade 9 and the other is in Grade 7. Her husband went to the United States to provide them with more stability. She has no type of business, she takes care of the house and the children, doing all the things that a mother does. 

The project she wants to undertake is to install electricity in their home. They do not enjoy this utility which is so useful today, in their house. Then her children can study in the evening when they come home from classes. Her dream is for her children to become professionals, to get them ahead through the sacrifice that is required having children studying. She hopes that her children study so that they can support her when she is old. Everything is achieved with the blessing of God and their effort.

loans.use: to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco thanks Kiva lenders for lending to his previous loan which he repaid well. He is looking forward to another one.

He also has a vehicle where he earns extra income. He deals mainly with people around Kyotera and the neighboring trading centers.

He hopes to use the loan to buy supplies for his studio which will boost his business. He is described as an honest and hard-working man.

loans.use: To buy toner  for the printer

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 52-year-old single mother of eight children, with only three children attending school. She has one dependent who is her niece. Rosemary owns bar at a trading center, where she works for seven days a week and 18 hours a day.

She is also a farmer, where she earns additional income for her family. She was motivated to start a bar business by the high level of profits in the business and she hopes to use the loan to buy more stock and also renovate the bar premises to increase her clientele.

She usually sells products like beer and local brews to local people in the local area and other fellow business people.

She faces a challenge of untrustworthy customers who buy goods on credit and refuse to pay, and limited capital, which has slowed her business operations. 

She is a hard working woman.

loans.use: To buy stock of local brews for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment for harvesting sugarcane.

loans.name: Ziarat Ali

texts.en:
Ziarat Ali is a 36-year-old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with his spouse and three children. He has been running a small printing press for three years. Flex is a sheet of polythene widely used to deliver high quality digital print for outdoor hoardings and banners mainly printed by large color plotters. These prints are used instead of handwritten banners due to their low cost and durability. He prints advertisement banners and logos on order.

Ziarat belongs to a poor family and is the single responsible person for his children, and elderly parents as well. His parents most of the time remain sick; he has to spend a large part of his income on medical care. He wants to grow his business so he can easily generate additional income than in the past so he can cherish his children and can bear the medical expenses of his parents.  

Therefore, Ziarat Ali has requested a Kiva loan so he can buy polythene sheets and colors plotters to print more flex. In this way; he can easily generate additional income for his family. He deserves Kiva support; he hopes that the Kiva lenders will support him. 

Ziarat Ali is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy polythene sheets and colors plotters to produce more prints.

loans.name: Sokhon's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district, Sokhom is 32 years old and married with one child. She earns a living through weaving mats and working for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about KHR 26,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 14,000 each day for future needs. 
This is the second loan for Sokhon with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for weaving mats. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy materials for weaving mats

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Yahshigul

texts.en:
Yahshigul is a young woman; she is 20 years old. Yahshigul is not married. She lives with her parents. She is an ambitious woman. 

Yahshigul since childhood has had a dream to be a successful businesswoman. She took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ through a women's organization and got a certificate. She is going to start a sewing business. She will service to her clients in her house. She is asking for a loan of 850 TJS to buy a sewing machine. This loan will help her to start her business in this way to get ahead. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine in order to start a new business.

loans.name: Ahmed Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ahmed and it is made up of five women who are natives of Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER. One of the members of this group is Balqis, who is 51 years old. She has a business selling incense and perfumes. She is divorced and has three children who live in Hodeida, Yemen. 
This business allows her to meet her needs without much difficulty. She obtains her supplies at a market in the city. She requested a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy more incense and perfumes for resale. The extra income generated as a result of this loan will help in easing payment of school fees. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more incense and perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Kaiyrkul

texts.ru: Кайыркул 47 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа одна воспитывает 4 детей. У Кайыркул - высшее образование, 12 лет работала учителем математики в местной школе, но после смерти мужа занимается откормом и перепродажей скота стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 25,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кайыркул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова с теленком, 2 бычка, 2 овцы, 2 козы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кайыркул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Кайыркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на оплату контракта за учебу сына.
texts.en: Kaiyrkul is 47 years old, widowed, and after the death of her husband, is raising four children alone. Kaiyrkul has a higher education. For 12 years, she worked as a math teacher at a local school but after the death of her husband, she took up fattening up and reselling cattle. She started this business 15 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kaiyrkul's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow with a calf, 2 bulls, 2 sheep and 2 goats on her farm. Her monthly income is 17,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Kaiyrkul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan to buy bulls to fatten up for future resale on the market for a high price. Kaiyrkul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to pay for her son's tuition.

loans.use: to buy bulls.

loans.name: Carlos Aristides

texts.es:
Carlos de 50 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, estuvo felizmente casado; pero su esposa falleció cuando su único hijo tenía apenas seis meses de nacido, se crio trabajando la tierra, eran 4 hermanos en total, pero por desgracias de la vida, los otros 3 han fallecido. Sin embargo,  Carlos es un hombre soñador y ha logrado salir adelante con el sudor de su frente solo vive con su único hijo en su casa de barro que tantos recuerdos tiene.

Carlos creció en el campo, practica la agricultura y la ganadería, pero principalmente le gustan los animales, tiene dos yuntas de bueyes con los que trabaja transportando leña para todo aquel que lo necesita, de esta manera obtiene suficientes ingresos para vivir, a la vez es un hombre muy astuto y siempre está atento a hacer negocios en los en la compra de animales para luego venderlos en los famosos “tiangues”. 

El préstamo lo necesita precisamente, para la compra y venta de ganado, puesto que es en este negocio que es habilidoso y tiene la entera confianza que obtendrá ganancias.
Su hijo ya está por finalizar la carrera universitaria de licenciatura en contaduría pública y Carlos se siente muy contento por eso y orgulloso con su hijo. Él sueña con ver que su hijo llegue a triunfar y sea un buen hombre profesional que sirva a la comunidad y a su futura familia, por lo tanto también desea mejorar la casa para así entregarle una digna vivienda a su hijo.
texts.en: Carlos is 50 years old and is a hard-working man.  He was happily married, but his wife died when their only child was just six months old.  He grew up working the land, one of a total of 4 brothers, but due to the misfortunes of life the other 3 have died.  Nonetheless, Carlos is a man with dreams, who has succeeded in getting ahead by the sweat of his brow alone.  He lives with his only son in the mud house that holds so many memories.  Carlos grew up in the country, practicing agriculture and livestock-raising, but he likes animals best.  He has two teams of oxen, with which he works transporting wood for anyone who needs it.  In this way he earns enough income to live.  However, he is a very astute man and is always looking for animals that he can sell later at the famous markets known as "tiangues".  He needs this loan to buy and sell cattle, as he is accomplished in this business and he has complete confidence that he will make a profit.  His son has almost completed his university degree in accounting, and Carlos feels very happy about this and proud of his son.  He dreams of seeing his son succeed at being a good professional man who serves his community and his future family.  He also wants to improve his house, so that he can provide a good home to his son.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle, because he is accomplished in this business and has complete confidence that he will make a profit.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel, a married, hardworking man with seven children, will use the loan advanced to him to buy mulch to cover the surface of his coffee plantation to protect it from loss of moisture, this being the dry season. He hopes with the mulch, his coffee will grow and he will be able to harvest high yields in the near future. He is grateful to UGAFODE for the financial services advanced to him and the other members of the community. In the picture is Samuel with his wife in the coffee plantation.

loans.use: to buy mulch in order to protect his coffee plants from losing moisture in the dry season.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a beauty salon, where she offers hairdressing services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of a spacious business premise. She will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy more hair chemicals and hair dryers, and to rent more space for her business. 

Joyce's business goal is to have several salons within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a piece of land. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 50,000 KES was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more hair chemicals and hair dryers, and to rent more space for her business.

loans.name: Buoysha

texts.en: Buoysha was born in 1965. She is married and is also a caring mother of four children. She always focuses on the well-being of her children. Buoysha's husband is a farmer. His income is not enough to improve the family's living conditions. That’s why Buoysha wants to start a new business, with sewing. She took part in a course, ‘To Get Ahead’, through a women's organization. She is going to open her workshop in her house. Her neighbors were glad when they heard her idea to provide services as a seamstress and they will be her first clients. She is asking for a loan of 500 TJS to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine in order to start a new business.

loans.name: Husniya

texts.en: Husniya is a married parent of five children. Her husband is a teacher in a school. She began her business with growing agricultural products some years ago. Nowadays her children's demands are greater than before. That’s why she is going to organize a new sewing business in order to get more income. She took part in a course called "Get Ahead," as part of a women's organization. Husniya is going to open her own workshop in the center of her region and in this way, she will attract more clients. She is asking for a loan of 500 TJS to buy a sewing machine, and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for starting a new business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a Kiva borrower, and he describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells onions, and he has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a highly populated area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the low seasons, which affect sales. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of onions. His business goal is to expand and sell a variety of products within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be self-reliant. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM and his previous loan of 40,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of onions.

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en:
Marwa is a 27-year-old single lady who has been working as a hairdresser for ten years. In 2003, she started to work on her own by replying to customers' requests and providing her services directly at customers' houses since most of them prefer to get this kind of service at home.

Marwa is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary tools and beauty needs to develop her business and attract new customers. Marwa is working hard to open her own beauty salon in the future, and to expand her services and number of customers.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools and beauty needs to develop her business and attract new customers.

loans.name: Saboat

texts.en:
Saboat was born in 1982. She is a responsible woman. Saboat is married and has 4 children. 

Her husband is a woodworker. He produces plates and spoons from wood and sells them in a local market. Saboat has her own business. She produces different kinds of furniture. She works with wood. Saboat’s husband helps her manage the business. Saboat has great experience in this field. She has been with this business more than 10 years. 

Saboat needs to buy wood for making more furniture, but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy wood. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy wood for making more furniture

loans.name: Pricillah

texts.en:
Pricillah is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a viable location and has a variety of primary customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds to buy more stock. 

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more onions, bananas, lemons, and tomatoes for resale. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.  Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more onions, bananas, lemons, and tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is from Malishka village. She works at the local school and her husband is a policeman. They have a 9-year-old son who attends school. The couple has also been involved in agriculture for 11 years. They keep a livestock of cows, calves, chickens and also 34 colonies of bees. Due to hard and tireless work over years, Anna harvests high quality honey and sells it locally. Because the agricultural income is very important for covering the family's daily needs and it provides some stability for them, Anna and her husband would like to expand their business. 

Anna has applied for this loan to purchase two oxen as well as wheat seeds for cultivation. The loan will greatly assist this family. Anna has already taken out a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it on time. She had some overdue payment dates because she was facing financial hardship. However, thanks to her family’s hard work during recent years, Anna and her family were able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative, between Kiva and SEF international, which provides a second-chance loan to people who have bad credit history and no access to credit. Let's help this family to continue the expansion of their farm.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen as well as wheat seeds for cultivation in order to expand her agribusiness.

loans.name: Janatay

texts.ru: Жанатай 47 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Старшая дочь замужем, младшая дочь школьница, а сын находится в России на заработках. С 2000 года Жанатай начала заниматься торговлей тканей, платков, полотенец, салфеток, стартовав с суммой в 3,000 сом (KGS), Жанатай сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях расширения ассортимента товаров, Жанатай обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом. Жанатай планирует вложить доходы от бизнеса в дальнейшее увеличение ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Janatay is 47 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her older daughter is married, her younger daughter is in elementary school and her son works in Russia. In 2000, she started selling fabric, scarves, towels and napkins. She started this business with 3,000 som (KGS). Janatay has been able to develop her business, earning a monthly income of around 20,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of expanding her assortment of merchandise, Janatay turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan. Janatay plans to invest the earnings from her business to further increase her assortment of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy fabric, scarves, towels and napkins for retail sale.

loans.name: Rihab

texts.en:
Rihab is a 27-year-old married mother of three children. She has been selling shoes for four years. Rihab started this business to support her husband in their living and to make sure that her beloved children will have a more secure future with special acquired education.

Rihab is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business merchandise by offering a spring and summer special collection. This loan will attract new customers and increase Rihab's income. 

Rihab is very excited about this loan and hopes that one day she will turn her business into a large wholesale trade business that can cover the whole region with special collections and encouraging prices.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise by offering a spring and summer special collection.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse and purchase a polyethylene cover for it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food she sells and also to buy drinks.

loans.name: Ilyn-Gay

texts.en:
Ilyn-Gay engages in retailing electronic load within her community. She is 27 years old and has four children. 

Having no competitors in the area, she aims to continue to strengthen her retailing electronic load business, but she doesn't have enough capital. That's why she's requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more load wallet for her to retail. 

She believes that someday she will improve her loading business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more load wallet to retail.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
This is Francisca, 54, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is a widow and she has children. Together with her children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
 
Francisca operates a meat stall. They buy meat from suppliers that deliver the meat to respective market stalls. Her products are pork, beef meat and processed meat products. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. She also sells peanut butter for additional income.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of pork and chicken needed in her business. 

Francisca hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of pork and chicken needed in her business

loans.name: Soerng's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Soerng is 44 years old and married. She has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 45,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Soerng has been with VisionFund for three cycles and successfully paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to seek a new loan. Soerng, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco de 51 años de edad, estudio solo cuarto grado,  su esposa se dedica a la venta de tamales y pan para ayudar a apalear la situación economía, ya que tiene una hija que este año estudiara 2do año de licenciatura en ciencias jurídicas en la universidad, con él solo vive su hija y su esposa. 

Francisco realiza oficios varios siempre y cuando encuentra trabajo. Pero su fuerte es la siembra de maíz, frijol y sorgo. Él aprendió esta actividad productiva de sus padres que desde pequeño lo llevaban al campo,  poco a poco creció y pudo ejercer el trabajo por sus propios medios. Él tiene ya 30 años de ser agricultor, también tiene un carro con el que hace viajes cuando se lo solicitan para obtener más ingresos que le ayuden a su familia. Antes se dedicaba a la elaboración de teja de barro, ladrillo, artesanías como matates, hamacas, pita para lazos. Dejo de hacerlo por la falta de materia prima. Para llegar hasta donde trabaja como jornalero se tarde de 15 a 20 minutos  caminando a pie. El horario de trabajo varía en función de la actividad que realice en sus plantaciones, generalmente trabaja de 6 am a 1: pm.


 El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 500 tejas para mejorar el techo de su vivienda, además comprara la vara para sostenerla, 5 pliegos de lámina para colocar bajo la teja para evitar que el agua filtre con facilidad. El préstamo mejorara su salud y la de su familia, vivirá más confiado sin pensar que se mojara en época lluviosa. La necesidad de tener  una vivienda adecuada para vivir feliz con su familia.

Pretende ampliar más su vivienda, construyéndose una habitación  más, por otra parte piensa hacer su servicio sanitario para que la familia goce de una mejor salud. Otro de sus sueños es ayudar con todo sacrificio  a su hija a que termine su carrera universitaria, que se convierta en una profesional, para que en un futuro tengan una vida diferente.
texts.en:
Francisco is 51 years old. He finished fourth grade only. His wife is dedicated to selling tamales and bread to help beat their economic situation since they have a daughter who this year will study the second year of her degree in legal sciences at university. Only his wife and daughter live with him.

Francisco always performs various jobs and always finds work. However, his strength is planting maize, beans and sorghum. He learned this work from his parents who took him to the countryside when he was young. Gradually, he grew and could do the work on his own. He has 30 years experience of being a farmer. He also has a car with which he does trips when he's asked in order to earn more income that helps his family. Previously he was dedicated to making clay tile, brick and crafts like mortars, hammocks and ties. He stopped doing this due to lack of the basic materials. To get to where he works as a laborer, it takes 15-20 minutes walking on foot. His working day varies in the function he's performing in his fields. Generally, he works from 6AM to 1PM.

The loan he is requesting is to buy 500 tiles to improve the roof of his house, as well as to buy the rod to support it, and 5 metal sheets to put under the tiles to prevent water seeping through easily. The loan will improve his health and that of his family. He will live more confidently without worrying he'll get wet during the rainy season. The need to have an adequate house to live happily with his family.

He intends to expand his house more, building one more room. He is also thinking of building a bathroom so his family can enjoy better health. His other dreams are to help, with all sacrifice, his daughter who is finishing her university career, and that she becomes a professional so that in the future she can have a different life.

loans.use: to buy 500 tiles to improve the roof of his house as well as buy a rod to support it, 5 metal sheets to place under the tile to prevent water for seeping easily.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as honest and friendly. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a strategic area that is busy and her primary customers are local residents. 

Susan describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds to buy more stock. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy stocks of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to expand the business and have more branches and home delivery via internet shopping within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Safargul

texts.en:
Safargul is 64 years old. She is married and has 5 children. Safargul has worked in her own land for more than 20 years. She grows wheat, bean, watermelon and other types of produce.  Safargul has 20 hectares of land. She always worked hard because her business is the main source of her family's income. Safargul’s sons help her to manage the business. She earns additional income from animal husbandry. 

She is going to make a new sowing of beans and watermelon but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 12,500 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Norn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district, Norn is 53 years old, married, and has seven children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 35 years, she manages to earn about 50,000 KHR per day and can save about 25,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Norn has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Norn is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ruendy Benedicto

texts.es:
Ruendy es un Joven muy emprendedor de 22 años de edad, está estudiando teología en la capital del país, espera graduarse para luego dedicarse a la Enseñanza de Dios. Por el momento está soltero, pero tiene una linda novia con la que espera formar un hogar, ella trabaja en una gasolinera cercana a su casa y como a 5km de donde vive Ruendy. 

Ruendy vive en la casa de una tía, pero el terreno donde viven es de tipo familiar y enfrente vive su madre con su esposo, todos son muy unidos y se ayudan en todo lo que puedan.

El tipo de negocio que Ruendy tiene es el del comercio de huevos; él ya tiene sus clientes que lo llaman para hacerles pedidos, inmediatamente los compra a un amigo que es mayorista y posteriormente los va a dejar a su lugar de destino. El vehículo que utiliza es un nissan frontier que le alquila a su suegra, para el momento de dejar los pedidos.

El préstamo lo necesita para 2 cosas, una para arreglar un carrito viejo que tiene y de esta manera ya no necesitaría estar alquilando ahorrándose mucho dinero, y lo otro sería para comprar mayor cantidad de huevos y de esta manera mantener embodegados unas cajas y así ya no recurrir a su amigo mayorista tan seguido.

Ruendy sueña ser un distribuidor de huevos, reconocido no solo en la comunidad, sino también en toda la ciudad y así establecerse económicamente para pensar en formar un hogar.
texts.en: Ruendy is a very enterprising 22-year-old man.  He is studying theology in the capital of the country, and hopes to graduate and then dedicate himself to God's teachings.  He is single for the time being, but has a lovely girlfriend with whom he hopes to start a family.  She works in a gas station close to her house and about 5 km from where Ruendy lives.  Ruendy lives in the house of an aunt, but the property on which they live is family-owned, and his mother lives across from them with her husband.  They are all very close, and help each other as much as they can.  Ruendy's business is selling eggs.  He has clients who call him to place orders.  He then immediately buys them from a friend who is a wholesaler and delivers them to their destination.  The vehicle that he uses to make his deliveries is a Nissan Frontier that he rents from his mother-in-law.  He needs a loan for two things.  One is to repair an old car that he owns,  so that he will save a lot of money by not renting one.  The other is to buy a larger quantity of eggs that he can store in cases, so that he won't have to go and see his wholesaler friend so often.  Ruendy dreams of being an egg distributor who is known not only in his community but throughout the city.  In this way he can establish himself economically and think about starting a family.

loans.use: to repair an old car that he owns, so that he will save a lot of money by not renting one, and to buy a larger quantity of eggs.

loans.name: María Consuelo

texts.es:
María de 36 años de edad,  es una señora muy emprendedora, a pesar de no haber estudiado maneja su pequeño negocio de donde obtiene sus ingresos para su familia. Actualmente, vive con sus 5 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian y 2 no, su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura desde pequeño y también le ayuda con los oficios domésticos.

María tiene 8 años de tener una pequeña tienda, de donde obtiene sus ingresos para los gastos de la familia, en alimentación, estudios de sus 3 hijos y servicios públicos agua y luz. La idea del negocio surgió gracias a la necesidad de subsistir, ya que están caros los productos de la canasta básica.

Con el crédito se  le estará ayudando al cliente, para que pueda  invertir en la tienda y tener mas productos como: pollo faenado, golosinas, bebidas y otros productos que se demandan en la comunidad.


María quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos y seguir ayudando con sus estudios para que en un futuro se puedan valer por si mismos.
texts.en:
