Maria, 36 years old, is a very enterprising woman. Despite the fact that she did not go to school, she manages her own small business, which generates income for her family. Currently she lives with her 5 children, 3 of whom study and 2 who do not. Her domestic partner has worked in agriculture since he was young, and he also helps her with the domestic chores.
Maria has had her small shop for 8 years, from where she earns the income for her family's expenses in food, schooling for her 3 children and utilities such as water and electricity. Her business idea was born thanks to her need to survive, since the basic consumer goods have gotten more expensive. With this loan she will be able to invest in the store and in products such as: ready to sell chicken, sweets, drinks and other products requested in the community. Maria wants to bring up her children and continue supporting their schooling, so that they can stand for themselves in the future.

loans.use: to buy ready to sell chicken, sweets, drinks and other products requested in the community.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a repeat borrower, aged 36 years old. He is married with 2 children, and he deals clothing and sells matoke (cooking bananas) from his plantations. Vicent has applied for a loan of UGX 2,500,000 to invest in his clothing business and also improve his banana plantation. His business challenges are low turnover from his business and low matoke sales. Therefore, he decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to increase his stock of clothes to hopefully improve his profits in the long run.

In the photo is the UGAFODE credit staff, Vicent, and his wife.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
A 31-year-old widow residing in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Sophy has 3 children to take care of and earns a living through selling grocery items. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day and she can save about 28,000 KHR each day for the future needs.

Sophy is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Sophy is going to use her portion to buy grocery items to resell. She hopes to earns more income so as to make a better living.  .

loans.use: to buy grocery items to resell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is a 29-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be talented. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a strategic area and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be power outages. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy hair weaves and other beauty products for use in the salon. Her business goal is to earn more profits within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: buy hair weaves and other beauty products

loans.name: Yesenia Marilu

texts.es:
Yesenia de 35 años de edad, a pesar que nunca fue a la escuela, porque se dedicó al negocio con su mamá creció y se caso tiene, tiene  6 hijos de 16, 15, 14, 12, 5 y 3 años respectivamente;  4 de ellos estudian y también le ayudan en el negocio su esposo trabaja como ayudante de albañil, ella madruga mucho.

Se va muy temprano para la escuela con su venta de merienda,  tiene 8 años de hacer tipo de negocio y dice que le va bien, ella aprendió el negocio con su mamá y después de casarse decidió seguirlo poniendo en práctica.

También compra ropa para vender la cual en su tiempo libre tiene que salir en su comunidad, para poder venderla y obtener sus ganancias. Por ese motivo, necesita el financiamiento para comprar màs variedad y en mayor cantidad de ropa.


Ella sueña con que sus hijos estudien y lleguen a ser profesionales y también aprendan el negocio para que sino encuentran trabajo no tengan que desesperarse por encontrarlos.
texts.en: Yesenia is 35 years old.  She never went to school, because she worked in her mother's business.  She grew up and got married, and has 6 children who are 16, 15, 14, 12, 5 and 3 years old.  Four of them are in school, and they also help her with her business.  Her husband works as a bricklayer's assistant.  She often gets up very early.  She goes to the school very early to sell snacks.  She has been doing this for 8 years, and says that it is going well.  She learned this business from her mother, and after she married she decided to continue doing it.  She also buys clothing to sell in her free time and earn more income, which she does by going out into her community.  For this reason, she needs a loan in order to buy a greater variety and quantity of clothing.  She dreams of her children studying and becoming professionals, and also that they will learn a business so that if they can't find jobs they won't become desperate while looking for them.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of clothing.

loans.name: María Carmela

texts.es:
María de 52 años de edad,  madre de 5 hijos y 3 hijas es una mujer muy luchadora que a pesar de haber estudiado hasta cuarto grado de educación  básica, se decidió ahorrar e invertir en la compra una vaca, con mucho esfuerzo hasta el momento tiene 3 vacas y 4 terneras las que cuida con la ayuda de su esposo, un hombre muy luchador que se dedica a la agricultura, un trabajo muy duro, en el que le apoyan sus hijos.  María, además de dedicarse al cuido de sus vaquitas también se dedica a la venta de pupusas, en la cual le apoyan sus hijas en su tiempo libre, esta actividad es muy importante para ella, dado que es de donde obtiene sus ingresos.

María sabe hacer pupusas desde mucho tiempo, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre y lo pone en práctica para obtener algunos ingresos y poder  sacar adelante a su familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  bebidas refrescantes y materia prima para poder hacer  y vender sus pupusas, ella es muy conocida por las personas del lugar, quienes la ven como una persona líder con muchos valores. Doña María tiene muchos deseos de invertir en  su negocio, pero por el momento le hace falta el dinero con el que piensa hacer crecer su negocio. 

María en un futuro sueña con tener un negocio grande que le pueda generar muy buenos  ingresos, para darles a sus hijos las condiciones que ella no pudo tener por  la difícil situación económica en la que sus padres vivían, además de eso ella quiere poder dejarles más vaquitas de las que hasta ahorita tiene y un negocio muy generador de ingresos,  para que ellos puedan seguir superándose y puedan ser  futuros profesionales, lo que lograran con mucho esfuerzo mediante el estudio de una carrera universitaria, el préstamo le ayudara a cumplir su sueño a María y a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, 52 years old, mother of 5 sons and 3 daughters is a very hardworking woman, who despite having studied only up to fourth grade, saved money to invest in buying a cow. With a lot of effort, she now has 3 cows and 4 calves, which she takes care of with the help of her husband. He is a hardworking man, who works in agriculture, a very hard job, done with the help of his children. Besides taking care of her cows, Maria also works selling pupusas. Her daughters help her with this activity in their free time. This is very important for her since it is where she earns her income.   
Maria knows how to make pupusas. She learned this activity from her mother and does it in order to get some income and support her family.
She is requesting a loan to buy refreshing drinks and basic supplies to be able to make and sell her pupusas. She is well known by the people in her town, who see her as a leading person with many qualities. Maria wishes to invest in her business, but at the moment she is lacking the money to increase her business.
In the future, Maria dreams of having a big business that can produce a good income to give her children better conditions than those she had, because of the difficult financial situation of her parents. Also she wants to be able to leave them more cows than what she has now, and a business that can produce income. That way they will be able to continue advancing and be future professionals, with hard work and through a college education. The loan will help Maria and her family fulfill their dream.

loans.use: to buy refreshing drinks and basic supplies to prepare and sell her "pupusas" (corn tortillas)

loans.name: María Cruz

texts.es:
María de 55 años de edad, ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar se casó, la mayor parte de su vida ha trabajado sirviendo en casa, su esposo es  agricultor dice también que le ha gustado mucho el negocio, ya que tuvo una panadería por 4 años y es bastante rentable, también ha negociado con ropa y zapatos.

Ella ve que es más rentable el negocio del pan, su hermano tiene una panadería y él será quien surtirá su negocio

Algunos de sus hijos ayudaran a vender el pan distribuyendo en su motocicleta. Ella dice, que  es pan muy buena calidad y sabe que le ira muy bien. El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar el pan, ya que este negocio le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos.

A ella le gustaría ampliar el negocio e involucrar a toda su familia en el negocio.
texts.en: Maria is 55 years old.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school, and got married.  She has spent most of her life working in the home.  Her husband works in agriculture.  She says that she also enjoyed the business that she had, when she had a bakery for 4 years that was quite profitable.  She has also sold clothing and shoes.  She sees that the bread business is more profitable.  Her brother has a bakery, and he will supply her business.  Some of her children will help her to sell her bread, distributing it by motorcycle.  She says that the bread is of good quality, and knows that the business will do well.  The loan that she is requesting is to buy bread, because this business will help her to increase her income.  She would like to expand her business and involve all of her family in the business.

loans.use: to buy bread, because this business will help her to increase her income.

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Orn is 52-years-old and married with seven children, three of whom are still in school. To make a living, she has been growing rubber and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the first loan for Orn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group seeking a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more rubbers to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
This is Ma. Bella, 49, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Roberto and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ma. Bella operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during the evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings and frozen food products. 

Ma. Bella dreams to have additional branches for her food stall and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Khatichakhon

texts.en: Khatichakhon is a clever woman. She was born in 1964 and she is married with three children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Khatichakhon lives with her husband and children in a rural area. She works in a local school. She is a teacher of English. Khatichakhon has been working in a school since 1985. She has great experience but her salary is small. That’s why she lives poorly with her family. Her son is going to go to Russia to find a job, since he has no job in Tajikistan. Khatichakhon is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy an air ticket for her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an air ticket for her son

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
A 35-year-old married mother of three children, Yin resides in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Cambodia. To support her living, she has been growing cassava and working for others for a fee for 15 years. Together, they can earn about KHR 22,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 12,000 each day for their future needs.

This is the third loan for Yin with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Yin completely paid back the past loan. Now she is applying for a loan. Yin is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s business and gain more income to build on some savings to increase her family’s business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina, a 36-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are currently in school, lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past five years, she has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells all types of clothes. 

To help expand her business and increase her profits, Amina has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda in order to buy more clothes. Amina hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Tukhtakhon

texts.ru: Эту одинокую женщину зовут Тухтахон. Ей 56 лет. Ее муж скончался, и она осталась одна с детьми. Но она не считает себя одинокой, потому что у нее есть дочка, взрослый сын и невестка. 10 лет Тухтахон помогала сыну в его деятельности. Он занимается животноводством. Но теперь она хочет самостоятельно начать новую деятельность в сфере торговли фруктов и овощей. Тухтахон хочет продавать импортные фрукты (мандарины, бананы, яблоки, груши, виноград и т.д.) из Республики Киргизии на центральном рынке Исфары. Но для купли первого товара у нее не хватает средств и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Тухтахон очень надеется, что ей удастся начать новую деятельность и у нее появиться новые экономические возможности.
texts.en: This single woman's name is Tukhtakhon. She is 56 years old. Her husband died, and she is left to raise her children. But she doesn't think of herself as alone, because she has a daughter and grown up son and daughter. For ten years Tukhtakhon helped her son with his activities. He works in the livestock business. But now she wants, on her own, to start a new business in the field of trading fruits and vegetables. Tukhtakhon wants to sell imported fruits (mandarins, bananas, apples, pears, grapes etc.) from the Republic of Kyrgyzstan in the central market of Isfara. But she doesn't have enough cash to purchase the first goods and for this reason she is requesting a loan. Tukhtakhon very much hopes that she will succeed in starting a new business and rise to new economic opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase first inventory, to start a new activity in the business of fruit trade.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 42 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her veterinary shop. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more veterinary items and will help Joyce to generate greater profits. Joyce hopes that in the future, she will be able to have more buildings to rent. 




"

loans.use: to buy more farm and animal supplies

loans.name: Sopheang

texts.en:
Sopheang is 38 years old, living with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Koh Sotin district. Weaving mats is the main source of her family’s income and her husband has been fishing to better support her family. The current business earns her about USD 10 per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
This is Sopheang's first loan with VisionFund Cambodia. Sopheang is applying for a loan to buy cotton and fabrics to support her business. She hopes to earn more income from her current business, so as to improve her living.

loans.use: to buy cotton and fabrics to support her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for machinery to level part of the land that she owns, in order to create a building site for a house.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 50 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her drug shop, which sells drugs and treats people. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs for the shop and will help Rose to generate greater profits and expand on her capital. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to establish a big clinic and hospital.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for the shop.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 28 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 3 years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for babies and women and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and have a bigger business. Jackline hopes that in the future she will be able to increase on her capital.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for babies and women.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 42 years old and he lives in the town of Bungokho, in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past six years, David has been working hard to manage his retail shop, in which he sells sugar, soap, cooking oil, and rice. 

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of UGX 2,500,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, soap, cooking oil, and rice and it will help David to generate greater profits and boost the business. 

David hopes that, in the future, he will be able to have a second shop.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, cooking oil, and rice.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nakalole in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 14 years, Kassim has worked hard to manage his produce business. 

To help expand his business, Kassim requests 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce and will help Kassim to generate greater profits and boost the business. Kassim hopes that in the future he will be able to have higher profits.

loans.use: to buy more produce.

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en: Zakayo is a 22-year-old single man. He describes himself to be dedicated. He operates a barber shop where he shaves men's hair. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a reliable place and his primary customers are males. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy hair cutting equipment and other items for use in the barber shop. He hopes that, in the future, he will have a better life. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy hair cutting equipment and other items for use in the barber shop.

loans.name: Begaiim

texts.ru: Бегайим 50 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа одна воспитывает 4 детей. Старшая дочь-замужем, сын помогает по хозяйству, в свободное время занимается частым извозом пассажиров, младшие дети учатся в школе. У Бегайим - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бегайим занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бегайим, на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, также арендует 1,75 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает помидоры, огурцы, болгарский перец, арбузы, кукурузу и клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бегайим обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупа высококачественных помидоров, огурцов, болгарского перца, арбузов, кукурузы и клевера для посевных работ, а также закупит удобрения для обработки земли. Бегайим намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Бегайим планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее образование детей.
texts.en: Begaiim is 50 years old, widowed and after the death of her husband, is raising four children alone. Her oldest daughter is married; her son helps with the farming and in his spare time provides taxi services. Her younger children study in school. Begaiim has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Begaiim practices crop farming and livestock breeding. She started this business 30 years ago with 2,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Begaiim's hard work, she currently has one dairy cow. She also rents a 1.75 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows tomatoes, cucumbers, bell peppers, watermelons, corn and clover for personal consumption and sales. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her farming business, Begaiim turned to Microcredit Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan to buy high quality tomato, cucumber, bell pepper, watermelon, corn and clover plants for sowing as well as fertilizer for tilling the land. Begaiim is determined to receive a good harvest to be sure to increase her family's capital. Begaiim plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also plans to save money for for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy tomato, cucumber, bell pepper, watermelon, corn and clover plants for sowing, as well as fertilizer.

loans.name: Robiya

texts.en: Robiya is a hardworking woman from the capital of Tajikistan. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a pensioner. Robiya is also a grandmother. She has two grandchildren. Robiya has her own business selling food items in a food shop. Robiya sells candies, pasta, sugar, milk product, etc. She also makes salads from vegetables which she grows in her orchard and sells in her food shop. She has her regular customers. She is going to increase her working capital and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 6000 Somoni (TJS) to buy food items to increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy food items to increase working capital

loans.name: Gavharoy

texts.en:
Gavharoy is a hardworking woman. She lives in a village which is located in the Southern part of Tajikistan. She is 40 years old. Gavharoy is divorced and has 4 children between the ages of 8 and 20.

Gavharoy is the main food provider for her family. She has her own business to bake rolls and biscuits. Gavharoy has her regular customers and her elder son helps to manage the business. Gavharoy is going to increase her business by baking and selling bread. She asks for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy an oven to cook bread. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy an oven to cook bread.

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en:
Sarun, 36, is married and lives with her husband and three children in a village of the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. She has sold sugar cane juice for six years. The current business earns her 33,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

Sarun is a first cycle client with VisionFund and leads her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sarun is going to use her portion to buy sugarcane and materials to support her business. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy sugarcane and materials to support her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a calf and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: José Trinidad

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, no pudo estudiar por motivo de que la escuela quedaba muy lejos y no le era fácil transportarse, él se acompañó y con su esposa han procreado 2 hijas,  las cuales son gemelas y tienen 2 años de edad. Su compañera de vida,  se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos, mientras que él se dedica al cuido y comercio de ganado y también a la agricultura, al cultivo de granos básicos y el pasto para sus animales.

Él se dedica al cuido de ganado contando con 4 años de experiencia,  decidio dedicarse a esto, porque vio la rentabilidad que dejaba  y también tiene el equipo necesario para poderlo realizar y eso le ayuda realizarlo por menos costo y obtener mayores ganancias.

El cliente utilizara el crédito, para comprar ganado; ya que en esta época está a bajo costo.  Desea comprar 3 de un costo de $350 cada una y posteriormente cuando aumente el precio de estos, venderlos a mejor precio y obtener la ganancia. 

Él a futuro desea tener ganado suficiente y poder tener ingresos de sus derivados,  tales como la leche ya que podría venderla y además tener ganado para venderlo y generar más ingresos y mantener una estabilidad en el negocio.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old.  He was not able to attend school because the school was too far away and it was difficult to find transportation to get there.  He is married, and has two daughters with his wife.  The daughters are two-year-old twins.  His wife dedicates herself to house work, while he works raising and selling cattle, as well as in agriculture.  He grows basic grains and grass for his animals.  

He has four years of experience raising cattle.  He decided to enter this business because he saw that it was very profitable and he also had the equipment needed to perform the work.  This allowed him to start the business with few expenses, and gain greater revenues.  

The client will use the loan to purchase cattle because during this season they are inexpensive.  He hopes to purchase three at about $350 each.  Then, when the prices go back up, he will sell them at a higher price and make a profit.

In the future, he hopes to have earned enough and be able to earn an income from the cows' by-products.  He will be able to sell their milk, and will also have cattle to sell, allowing him to earn more and keep his business stable.

loans.use: to purchase three cows.

loans.name: Lavender Group

texts.en:
Gina is the featured borrower of Lavendar group. She joined other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they came from the Philippines to work as housekeepers to support their beloved families. 

Gina is a 41-year-old single mother, who is working as a housekeeper to provide for her beloved only child the necessary standard of living. She is working hard to make sure that her child can get the best education to make sure he can acquire a better future. 

Today, Gina is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to send it to her beloved child to cover his educational and living needs and improve his living. 

Gina is the first lady from the right. As for the other group members, Clarissa is the second from the right, Gorgonia is the second from the left, and Welhimina is the first from the left.

loans.use: to send it to her beloved child to cover his educational and living needs and improve his living.

loans.name: Fazila

texts.en:
Fazila is 47 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Fazila has been working hard to manage her egg business, where she sells eggs. 

To help expand her business, Fazila has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more eggs in bulk and will help Fazila generate greater profits. Fazila hopes that in the future she will be able to become rich.

loans.use: to buy more eggs in bulk.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is a 24-year-old married woman who has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, maize flour, milk, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of products. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more sugar, bread, soap and other items she sells. Her business goal is to ope a wholesale business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more sugar, bread, soap and other items

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more merchandise products for her business. Her loan helped not just her business but also to educate her children. Her income from business helps with her daily household expenditures. She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also has a variety store and a computer shop to earn additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She will also use the loan in her RTW business and computer shop. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help meet her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elisa hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams that her family will always be in good condition. She meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stock items such as belts,clothes, cutex, perfume, and necklaces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of cabbages, tomatoes, onions and to pay school fees

loans.name: Nazarina

texts.en:
This is Nazarina, 55, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Nazarina operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines like bananas, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells papaya and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 24,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruit to expand her product inventory.

Nazarina hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of fruit to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es:
Ana de 37 años de edad, es madre soltera,vive solo con su hija y su tío,su hija estudia 3 º grado el cual solo ella le apoya en el estudio y los gastos del hogar.


Ella es empleada ya tiene varios años de trabajar en la empresa, le queda retirado su trabajo de su casa el horario de entrada es de 8.A.M  a 4.PM .


 El préstamo lo utilizara, para pagar impuestos y financiar una computadora con  facilidades de pago.

El sueño u  objetivo de la cliente, es seguir trabajando para mantener a su hija, ya que ella es menor de edad, brindarle el estudio para que en el futuro sea una profesional y seguir trabando con credicampo.
texts.en:
Ana is 37 years old.  She is a single mother and lives with her daughter and her uncle.  Her daughter is in third grade, and she supports her daughter with her studies and the household expenses.  She is an employee in a business where she has worked for many years.  Her work is outside of her house and her hours are from 8 am to 4 pm.

She will use the loan to pay taxes and finance a computer with easy payments.  

Her dreams and goals are to continue to work so that she can support her daughter since she is still a child, provide her with an education so that in the future she can be a professional, and to continue working with Credicampo.

loans.use: to pay taxes, and finance a computer with easy payments.

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en:
Nagina is a 36-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 2 daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession. He has been providing this service for the past 15 years. He is responsible in fulfilling his family's needs and managing the household.

Nagina's husband needs help to buy a new taxi for his business, therefore Nagina has applied for a Kiva group loan with another member from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will provide assistance to her husband to purchase a new taxi so that he can provide better transport service and earn more income to manage his household and fulfill the needs of all family members.

Nagina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new taxi to provide better transport services.

loans.name: Kimsroen

texts.en:
Kimsroen, who is 40 and has four children, lives in a rural village in the Koh Sotin district of Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers who have grown cassava for the past twenty years. To supplement their income, they also work for others for a fee. Her current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the first micro-loan for Kimsroen through VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to buy pesticide and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
This is Elena, she is 58, and lives in Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Eutemio, a security guard, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their retail business. Elena is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Elena earns money by getting bulk supplies at wholesale prices and then selling them individually. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP500 in sales every day. Elena is requesting a PHP8,000 loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Elena dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to make a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger stock of ingredients for preparing food for her restaurant.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells cosmetics and other beauty products. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are ladies. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough business premise space and the lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics. His business goal is to own a supermarket within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to open another business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Heriqnaz

texts.en:
Heriqnaz is from Lernantsq village of Lori region. She lives there with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren who are 8 and 6 years old. 

Heriqnaz and her family have raised animals and farmed for over 10 years. This agri-business is the only source of  income, so they work hard to have a good harvest and run the farm in a sustainable way. The farm includes cows, calves, chickens and also a plot of arable land where wheat, barley and potatoes are cultivated. 

Heriqnaz applied for this loan for financial support in order to  purchase seeds, fertilizer, and feed for  the livestock. This is vital for further growth of her farm and she will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, and feed for the livestock.

loans.name: Cocuriga G4 Group

texts.en:
Joseline is 30 years old. She is married with one child aged two years old.  Joseline is the group leader. The group has focused on improving the quality of their production for better output. She will use her Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer during her rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farm, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is only 19 years old and he is a beginning farmer. Artur lives with his parents in Gavar city in Gegharkunik region. He has graduated from Gavar Agricultural College. His father works as a builder. For several years Artur also worked as a builder, but lover the ast three years he has been actively engaged in farming. His parents greatly help him both by giving useful advice about farming and helping him with the care of farm cattle. On his farm he has two cows, two calves and 10 chickens. He buys hay for his farm cattle from local villagers but sometimes he greatly lacks fodder. Artur manages to sell milk and eggs to their neighbors from his farm. This young farmer has a plan to increase the number of his farm cattle but his finances are too low for that purchase. 
So he asks a loan of 800.000 Armenian drams to buy a cow and a lot of fodder for his farm cattle, which will allow him to earn good profit from his farming business .

loans.use: to buy a cow and  fodder for his farm cattle, which allows him to earn good profit from his farming business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es un hombre  de 48 años de edad, es padre de tres niños de 11, 10 y 6   años de edad, se acompañó hace 13 años aproximados con su esposa, quien trabaja en los oficios del hogar y cuidando de sus hijos cuando él está trabajando ya sea en la agricultura o en el destazo de cerdos.
Estudio hasta  5º grado en la comunidad, ya no siguió debido al conflicto armado que se dio en el país hace ya 35 años aproximados, pues tenía que caminar por una hora para llegar al centro escolar, lo cual se le hacía demasiado peligro en ese momento.
Tres de sus hijos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad el nivel básico, de don Carmen dependen sus tres  hijos y dos niños más que viven en el hogar.
Trabaja desde que tenía 10 años de edad, sus padres le enseñaron los trabajos de la agricultura (siembra de maíz, frijoles y maicillo), los cuales son los cultivos más comunes en la zona.
Hace 10 años emprendió el destazo de cerdos, con el cual obtiene pequeñas ganancias que le ayudan para obtener ingresos económicos y así darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, le enseño su hermano mayor.
Destaza aproximadamente 6 cerdos en el mes, los cuales los compra en las comunidades aledañas y los comercializa en el lugar donde vive, pues ya tiene sus clientes quienes siempre le compran sus productos. 
Solicita un crédito en credicampo, para la compra de 500 adobes valorados en $450.00, $400 dólares en la compra de la madera, el resto lo necesita para cancelar los trabajadores quienes le ayudaran a construir la vivienda. Es importante para él, pues con ello tendrá una vivienda más digna y segura para sus hijos.
Don Carmen sueña con darles lo necesario a sus hijos,  para que estudien se preparen académicamente, pues él no tuvo la oportunidad de hacerlo, el préstamo le ayudara para cumplir uno de sus propósitos en la vida de poseer su propia casa donde compartir con la familia.
En el futuro espera crecer en el negocio del destazo ya que le es rentable.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 48 year old man.  He is a father of three children ages 11, 10 and 6.  He married his wife about 13 years ago.  His wife does house work and takes care of their children when he is working: farming or butchering pigs.  He studied until fifth grade, but was not able to continue because of the war that broke out in the country about 35 years ago.  He had to walk about one hour to get to school, and during that time it was much too dangerous.  Three of his children attend the elementary school in their community.  His three children, as well as the two other children that live in his house, depend on him.  

He has worked since the age of ten.  His parents taught him how to farm, planting corn, beans and sorghum, as they are the most common crops in the region.  Ten years ago, his brother taught him how to butcher pigs, which allows him to earn a little money to help provide better living conditions for his family.  He butchers about six pigs a month.  He buys them in neighboring communities and sells them where he lives; he has customers that always buy his products.  

He is seeking a loan from Credicampo to purchase 500 bricks valued at $450, $400 worth of wood, and the rest to pay the workers that will help him build his home.  It is important for him, because with this, he will have a decent and safe house for his children.  Carmen dreams of providing his kids with the necessities, so that they can study and prepare themselves academically since he did not have the opportunity to do so.  The loan will help him to fulfill one of his life goals of owning his own house that he can share with his family.  In the future, he hopes to expand his butchering business as it is profitable.

loans.use: purchase 500 bricks valued at $450, $400 of wood, and the rest is needed to pay the workers who will help him build his home.

loans.name: Sadiq Ali

texts.en:
Sadiq Ali is a 36-year-old man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with his family. He works hard to provide better living standards for his family by selling laces of various types and colors. He purchases laces in bulk from the market and then sells it to the general public. Most of his sales are for festivals, special occasions and ceremonies. He has become famous in the market due to the various types of laces and has retained many customers. Most of his customers are tailors and the ladies from town. 

HIs experience has shown that most of his female customers ask for beauty products and gift hampers as well. This is the reason he decided to offer cosmetics products and gift hampers so he can meet the demand. 

Therefore, he requests a loan from Kiva’s field partner so he can buy beauty products, gift hampers and laces. He is very experienced in his business and confident that his business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

He is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and gift hampers to sell.

loans.name: Fredis Antonio

texts.es:
Fredis es un joven de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es casado, aunque aún no tiene hijos; su esposa se dedica  a realizar los oficios domésticos. Actualmente él y su esposa viven en casa de sus padres y hermanos de Fredis.
Fredi presta sus servicio militar desde hace dos años, decisión que tomo a raíz de adquirir la responsabilidad de una esposa. En sus tiempo libres también, trabaja en la agricultura, para desplazarse a su lugar de trabajo debe levantarse muy temprano ya que está retirado viaja en autobús y luego camina alrededor de 45 minutos a pie. 
En este momento, está por iniciar la construcción de su casa, debido a eso necesita el préstamo para comprar 2 fletes de madera acerrada y pago de mano de mano de obra, él ya cuenta con el adobe y la teja.  Sus metas son terminar de construir su casa, amueblarla y tenerla bien bonita, para cuando tenga sus hijos y brindarles a ellos una buena educación.
texts.en:
Fredis is a young man of 22 years of age. He finished the 9th grade in school. Fredis is married and does not yet have children. His wife stays home and takes care of the house. Currently, Fredis and his wife live in his parents house, along with Fredis's siblings. Fredis decided to work in the military when he became responsible for taking care of his wife. In his free time, he also works in agriculture. Fredis gets up early in the morning to catch the bus to go to work. After the bus ride, he makes a 45-minute walk on foot. 

At this time, Fredis is starting to begin to build his house. For this he needs a loan in order to buy two loads of cut wood and to pay the laborers. He already has adobe and the roof. Fredis's goals are to finish building his house, furnish it, and make it look nice for when he has children. Fredis hopes to provide a good education for his future children.

loans.use: to buy two loads of cut wood and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Kolya

texts.en:
Kolya is a farmer with 10 years of experience. He lives with his parents who greatly assist him with his farming activities. Kolya keeps sheep, cows, chickens, and calves. Near the house where they live, he also owns arable land where wheat, barley and potato are cultivated. 

Kolya feels responsible for gathering enough income to sustain his parent's normal living conditions. He has applied for this loan to purchase two more oxen and forage for the livestock. The grass that he cultivates as forage is not enough to feeding all the livestock, so the loan will be a great help to Kolya.
 
He has already taken out a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to his hard work in recent years, Kolya was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international that provides a second-chance loan to people who have a bad credit history and no access to credit. The loan is important for Kolya and he would be very grateful to lenders for their support and their goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 34 years old and from Kakamega town, in the western part of Kenya. She supports two people in her family and is married to Bonface. She has one child who is 8 years old.

She has operated a money transfer business (M-PESA) for the last three years. She makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is applying for her second loan to increase the volume of her float to serve many more clients. She will use the anticipated profit to reinvest in the business.

She has a dream of improving her business so that she can support her family well, provide better education for her child and be a good member of society.

loans.use: To increase her working capital for her money transfer business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking mother who lives in a rural community. She is 54 years old and has three adult children. Due to financial hardships, she started cooking and selling snack foods within her community. 

To increase her income, Nenita aims to prepare more kinds of snack food to sell. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes, flour, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients to be cooked and sold in her community. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes, flour, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients needed for her business.

loans.name: Mirian Yaneth

texts.es:
Mirian es una persona de  30 años de edad, madre de dos niños quienes estudian en el centro escolar de la comunidad el nivel básico.
Ella procede de una familia de nueve hermanos, con quienes han trabajado la agricultura y en los trabajos del hogar, su esposo trabaja todos los días de la semana en la ciudad y tiene que quedarse en el lugar de trabajo, ya que sale tarde del trabajo; ella cuida de sus hijos mientras él trabaja en construcción de viviendas en la ciudad.
Mirian Trabaja desde hace cuatro años en la venta de productos de lencerías (lociones, cremas y otros productos), se decidió emprender esta actividad, debido a la demanda que tiene en la comunidad y en otros sectores donde ella comercializa los productos.
Compra los productos en la ciudad que está a una hora y media viajando en transporte urbano.
Desde pequeña ella ha trabajado con la familia en la agricultura y en los oficios domésticos ayudando a su madre para atender a la familia.
Solicita un crédito en credicampo, para la compra más productos de lencería (lociones, pulseras, y ropa) para tener más variedades de productos a sus clientes.
También comprara ladrillo para ponerle al piso de tierra que posee en la vivienda, esto le permitirá tener una casa más cómoda para su familia, habrá más higiene y menos peligros de contraer enfermedades en los pies.
Sueña con darle la educación necesaria a sus hijos, para que logren crecer profesionalmente y construir de manera progresiva su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mirian is thirty years old.  She is the mother of two children who attend the local elementary school.  She comes from a family of nine siblings with whom she has worked in agriculture and doing house work.  Her husband works every weekday in the city, and has to sleep there because he gets out of work late.  She takes care of their children while he works building houses in the city.  For the past four years, Mirian has worked selling linen goods (lotions, creams and other products).  She decided to enter this field based on the demand in the community and other areas where she sells her products.  She purchases her products in the city that is about an hour and a half away.  She travels there using public transportation.  From a young age, she worked with her family in agriculture and doing house work, helping her mother to take care of the family.  

She is seeking a loan from Credicampo to purchase more linen goods (lotions, bracelets and clothing) to offer a greater variety of products to her customers.  She will also purchase bricks to lay down on the dirt floor that she currently has in her home.  This will allow her to have a more comfortable and hygienic home for her family, with less risk of contracting a disease in their feet.  She dreams of giving her children the necessary education so that they can grow up to be professionals and gradually build their home.

loans.use: purchase more linen goods (lotions, bracelets and clothing) to have a greater variety of products for her customers, and bricks to lay a floor in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the business he owns with his wife and supplies for the silkscreen printing business he owns in his home.

loans.name: Blanca Lydia

texts.es:
Blanca de 52 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno año de estudios secundarios, estuvo casada pero actualmente es madre soltera, vive con 3 de sus hijas, pues los dos mayores ya han formado su propio hogar. Sus hijas están estudiando pero también le ayudan en el negocio.

Desde pequeña Blanca se ha dedicado al negocio, inició vendiendo quesadillas y carne en la comunidad, pero poco a poco fue variando de productos y cuando su exesposo se fue para los Estados Unidos, decidió irse al centro de la ciudad y caminando con un “huacal” en sus brazos dedicarse al comercio de frutas y verduras; pero también actualmente se dedica a la venta de “enchape” (joyería) y con la ayuda de Dios las cosas les están resultando bien.

Blanca necesita el préstamo, para la compra de más enchape, pues ya se viene la fecha de San Valentín y ella sabe por experiencia propia que en esta fecha aumentan las ventas.
Los sueños que Blanca tiene son los de tener un puesto fijo en el mercado, para ya no tener que maltratarse tanto físicamente y también aumentarían sus ganancias pues incrementaría la cantidad de producto a vender. Aspira con establecerse económicamente, para darles a sus hijas una vida digna como se lo merecen.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 52, completed the ninth grade in high school.  She was married, but she is now a single mother.  She lives with three of her daughters.  However, the two oldest have established their own households.  Her daughters go to school, but they also help her in the business.

Ever since she was little, Blanca has devoted herself to the business.  She started selling quesadillas and meat at the market.  However, little by little she was varying the products.  When her husband left for the United States, she decided to go to the center of the city.  Walking with a “huacal” [basket] in her arms, she sells fruits and vegetables.  However, she also now sells jewelry.  With God’s help, things are turning out well for her.

Blanca needs the loan to buy more jewelry.  Valentine’s Day is coming, and she knows from personal experience that sales increase on this date.

Blanca’s dream is to have a fixed stand at the market so that her work will not be so hard on her physically.  She also dreams of increasing her earnings, and she would increase the quantity of products for sale.  She hopes to establish herself financially in order to give her daughters a decent life like they deserve.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en:
Muhayo is 36 years old and married with four children. Being a responsible mother, Muhayo works hard every day to generate income so that she can cover her daily costs and send some of her children to school.  

She is dedicated to her farming business, growing potatoes and onions on her own land. She has been busy with this business for over ten years. She manages her business alone. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Muhayo earns a small income. She must buy winter clothes for her children, which is why she is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,200 Tajikistani somoni. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes for her children.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel de 37 años de edad, no estudio aunque una vecina le enseño a firmar. Es acompañada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y en cafetales, tienen cuatro hijos, 3 de sus ellos van a la escuela y el mayor de sus hijos en sus tiempos libres les ayuda en el trabajo. 

Ella se dedica a trabajos en la finca (poda de árboles, peina, abonar hollar etc.), este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres y se dedica a eso debido a que en la zona es lo más accesible, ella puede hacer pan, bolsones de manila; pero manifiesta que no se dedica de lleno a eso porque no tiene el dinero para comprar los productos, la cliente a su trabajo se desplaza caminando, hace 45 minutos de lunes a sábado, en horario de 4:30 am a 3:00 pm. 

Isabel solicito un crédito anteriormente, para hacer la casa donde vive de bahareque, en esta ocasión solicita uno nuevo crédito, que es para construir la cocina, debido a que la cocina actualmente la tiene dentro de la casa de habitación y prepara los alimentos con leña, lo que genera incomodidad por el humo que se esparce por toda la casa.

sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, ella luchara por lograrlo, ella cree que con el préstamo le van ayudando a crear mejores condiciones para ella y su familia y cree que poco a poco, mejorara la casa con el apoyo de los créditos, pues ella cree que es la única manera de poder hacer realidad sus sueños,  pues no cuenta con nadie más que le apoye económicamente.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 37-year old woman who did not attend school. However, a neighbor taught her to write her signature. She works with her husband in agriculture and coffee plantations, and they have four children, three of them in school. The oldest one helps at work when he is free. She works in the field (pruning, cultivating, tracking, etc.), something that she learned from her parents and that is very accessible in the area. She also makes bread and Manila bags, but she does not commit to it full time because she does not have enough money to buy the products. She walks 45 minutes to work every day and works Monday through Saturday from 4.30am to 3pm. 

Isabel had requested a loan before to make the mud wall house where they live. She now requests a new loan to build the kitchen, given that the current one is inside the bedroom and needs firewood, filling the whole house with smoke. 

Her dream is to see her children becoming professionals and she will fight to make that possible. She believes this loan will help her to provide better life conditions to her family and, little by little, to improve their house. This is the only way to make her dreams come true, as she does not have any other financial support.

loans.use: to build the kitchen.

loans.name: Zulma Oneyda

texts.es:
Zulma de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato es viuda, se dedica a las oficios domésticos sus hijos están pequeños y aun no van a la escuela.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para mejorar la habitación, ya que vive en casa de sus padres comprara lamina, teja, cerámica.

De esta manera, poder darle a sus hijos una educación adecuada que estudien y puedan sacar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Zulma, age 30, has a high school education.  She is a widow.  She devotes herself to the household chores.  Her children are little, and they still do not go to school.

The loan that she is requesting is to improve the room.  She lives in her parents’ house.  She will buy galvanized metal sheeting, tiles for the roof, and tiles for the floor.

This way she will be able to give her children an adequate education, they will study, and they will be able to get a college degree.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, tiles for the roof, and tiles for the floor.

loans.name: Dora María

texts.es:
Dora de 44 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, uno esta en estados unidos y dos viven con ella. Dora estudio bachillerato general y es madre soltera.

Ella trabaja desde los 20 años de edad a la sastreria, aprendió el oficio ayudando a sus padres y que su maáa también se dedicaba a la misma actividad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una máquina de coser, ya que es bastante el trabajo que realiza ya que le hace los uniformes a varios centros escolares. 

Con el préstamo, cubrirá la demanda que tiene. Su sueño es que sus hijos estudian una carrera universitaria, aspira crecer mucho con su negocio.
texts.en:
Dora is a 44-year old woman who has three children, one of them living in USA and two living with her. Dora attended high-school and became a single mother. She has worked in tailoring since she was 20 and learned the job by helping her parents. Her mother also worked in that same activity. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine. She makes the uniforms for several schools, which involves a lot of work. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to meet the demand. 

Her dream is for her children to attend university. She expects her business to grow a lot.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase flour, oil, corn, rice and other products to continue making artisanal bread.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is 47 years old, and he lives in Sevan City in the Gegharkunik region of Armenia. He is married and has two sons. His younger son is now serving in the army. His elder son is a student of Gavar State University at the Faculty of Jurisprudence in the paid division. 

Gagik’s wife works at the kindergarten as a tutor, and he works at the Sevan Police Station as an officer. Despite the fact that both Gagik and his wife are employed, they have financial difficulties and cannot pay their son’s tuition fee. 

Gagik is requesting a loan of 140,000 Armenian drams in order to pay his son’s tuition fee for his second semester.

loans.use: to pay his son’s tuition fee for his second semester.

loans.name: Cocuriga G 5 Group

texts.en:
Etienne is 30 years old. He is married with one child. He has spent fourteen years in rice production. He is a group leader for the whole group, and they all practice the same farming of rice. He will use the Kiva loan to support labour costs and fertilizer during rice production. They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance their farming capacity. Etienne holds an envelope in the photo, as a symbol of identification from other group members.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labour costs during rice production.

loans.name: Evelyn Xiomara

texts.es:
Evelyn de 39 años de edad, terminó sus estudios de bachillerato con éxito, posteriormente decidió dedicarse al trabajo, fue ganando experiencia y posteriormente decidió contraer matrimonio, está felizmente casada, su esposo trabaja en una empresa que vende repuestos para automóviles. Actualmente, están viviendo donde sus suegros de forma temporal, pues uno de ellos enfermó y decidieron estar cerca para apoyarlos y cuidarlos.

Evelyn ha abierto una pequeña ferretería, negocio que comenzó porque un cuñado de ella que se dedica al sacerdocio, la incentivo a abrir un negocio propio y como ella ya tenía experiencia como empleada en una ferretería se motivó a abrirla. Ya lleva 3 años de tenerla y poco a poco con ayuda de Dios sus ganancias han aumentado. 

El préstamo solicitado, es para comprar material de construcción como lo son bloques, hierro, cemento, entre otros.
De esta manera daría más abasto con la demanda de la clientela que visita constantemente el negocio y así dar un salto en cuanto a diversificación de productos y crecimiento en ingresos.

Evelyn sueña con que su ferretería sea muy grande y que tenga toda cantidad de producto, para que así cualquier cliente que llegue, se pueda ir satisfecho con su compra.
También desea que sus hijos crezcan sanos y darles buena educación para que lleguen a ser personas de bien y que formen buenos hogares.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old. She successfully finished her high school education and then decided to enter the workforce. She gained experience and later on she decided to get married. She's happily married and her husband works for a company that sells spare car parts. They're currently living with her in-laws on a temporary arrangement, since one of them became ill and they decided to be near them in order to support and care for them.

Evelyn has opened a small hardware store. She started this business because her brother-in-law who's a clergyman encouraged her to open her own business. Since she had experience as a hardware store employee, she was prompted to open a store. She has owned this business for 3 years and with God's help, her profits have gradually increased.

The requested loan is to purchase construction supplies such as bricks, iron, cement, etc.
That way she'll stock up and meet the demand from her customers who often come into her store. Thus she'll take a large step towards diversifying the merchandise and increasing her profits.

Evelyn dreams of having her hardware store become very large and contain every type of product. That way any customer who comes in can leave satisfied with their purchase.
She also wishes that her chldren grow up healthy and that she provides them with a good education so that they can become decent people and start good families.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as bricks, iron, cement, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Esperanza de 31 años de edad, es bachiller, está acompañada tiene dos hijos ellos están  pequeños de edad  y aun no estudias su esposos es empleado.

Ella es Auxiliar de nutricios ya tiene 6 años de trabajar, sus ingresos depende de su trabajo y de su esposo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para mejorar una habitación que tiene en su casa, ya que le falta el techo y el piso.

Su deseo es que su familia tenga una casa propia y que sus hijos puedan estudiar y algún día ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Esperanza, age 31, has a bachelor’s degree.  She has a life partner and two children.  They are young and do not yet go to school.  Her husband is employed.

She is a nutrition assistant.  She has been doing this work for six years.  Their income depends upon her work and that of her husband.

The loan that she is requesting is to improve a room in her house.  It needs a roof and flooring.

Her wish is for her family to have their own house and that her children are able to go to school and someday become professionals.

loans.use: to improve a room in her house that needs a roof and a floor.

loans.name: Nexi Idalia

texts.es:
Nexi de 28 años de edad, es casada, estudio hasta 1 año de bachillerato, tiene 2 hijos uno estudia 8 grado y el otro tercer grado. 

La cliente ha tenido una tienda productos básicos,  ahora también se dedica a la costureria desde hace un año fue a un taller a aprender oficio que siempre le ha gustado.

El crédito lo utilizara para ampliar su tienda y comprar una maquina nueva de cocer el cual aumentara sus ingresos familiares.

Su deseo es trabajar fuerte surtir mucho la tienda, para que sus hijos puedan seguir el negocio y que ellos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nexi is a 28-year old woman, who is married and has two children, in 8th and 3rd grades. She studied one year of high-school. She has a store with basic products and now also works in dressmaking. One year ago she started to go to a studio where she could learn this job that she has always liked. 

She will use the loan to expand her store and to buy a new sewing machine, which will help to increase their family income. Her dream is to work hard and expand the store so that her children will be able to keep the business as well as to become professionals.

loans.use: to expand her store and to buy a new sewing machine, which will help to increase her family income.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, una hija acaba de salir de bachillerato.

Rosa tiene una venta de queso desde  hace 10 años, su hija le ayuda en el negocio, se dedica a este trabajo porque vio que el negocio del queso le da bastantes ganancias.
El cliente utilizara el crédito,  para comprar más queso para vender,  ya que la demanda es bastante y no tiene el dinero para comprar mas producto.

Su deseo es hacer que su negocio crezca de tal manera y obtener  mejores ingresos y que algún día sus hijos sigan con el negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, who is 48-years old, went to school through 9th grade.  She is the single mother of three children, one of whom just graduated from high school. 

Rosa has been selling cheese for ten years.  Her daughter helps her with the business.  Rosa makes her living with this work because it gives pretty good profits.   
Rosa will use the loan to purchase more cheese for resale, as the demand is great but she doesn't have the money to purchase more product. 

Rosa's hope is for her business to grow in such a way, and to earn enough income that, one day her children will be able to take over the business.

loans.use: to purchase more cheese for resale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen iene la edad de 59 años, una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora quien lucha por sacar adelante a sus 2 pequeñas hijas que aun tiene a cargo, ella es madre de 4 hijos mas, lucha cada día por ver a sus pequeñas triunfar. 
Se siente muy orgullosa al ver que sus demás hijos han salido adelante y formado ya su propia familia, ella ha sabido darles la educación y lo básico que ellos necesitaban. 
Desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de tortillas, el cual es un factor que le permite tener ingresos diarios para la alimentación de sus pequeñas. 
El préstamo lo utilizara con el fin de comprar mas productos maíz y leña, lo demás del préstamo lo invertirá en remodelar su casa, que también es uno de sus sueños anhelados. Una casa que reuna las condiciones para su familia.
A futuro quiere que sus hijas también salgan adelante y culminen sus estudios y puedan formar su propia familia. Pues anhela lo mejor para sus pequeñas.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 59-year old entrepreneurial and hard-working woman, who fights to support her two young daughters under her responsibility. She has four more children and fights every day to see her two youngest succeed. She is very proud of her other children, who have been able to get ahead and now have their own families. She has given them education and everything they needed. 

She has been selling tortillas since she was very young. This activity gives her daily income to support her daughters. She will use the loan to buy corn products and firewood, and will also invest a portion in renovating her house. Having a house with good life conditions for her family is one of her big dreams. She wants her daughters to get ahead, to finish her studies and to form families. She wants the best for them.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood, and to renovate her house.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena is a 24-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children and her husband is a butcher by trade. He has been running a butcher shop for the past five years. He is the guardian of his family and responsible for feeding them.

Sakeena's husband wants to buy meat in bulk for reselling purposes and he needs some new tools for his business purposes. Due to financial constraints, he is not in a position to buy all these items. Therefore Sakeena has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to buy these items for business purposes. After getting this opportunity, Sakeena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To expand her husband's business of meat selling.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel is 32, married and has two kids. He aims to uplift their status of living in order to educate his kids and give them a better life. To have an additional source of income, he engages himself in buying and selling smoked fish, which he offers within his village. 

He plans to continue and improve this business, but he has doesn't have enough capital. So, he is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more stock of smoked fish to sell. 

He hopes that someday, he will be able to improve his business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stock of smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: M. Aslam

texts.en:
M. Aslam is a 26-year old religious and energetic man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of two children. He belongs to middle standard families; his father has grown old and stays idle at home. He is the only income-earner who has to bear all household expenses regarding his elderly parents, young children and sibling. His younger brother is a student still studying in 12th standard. 
 
M. Aslam owns an corporation store in which he offers televisions, washing machines, almira, sewing machines, juicers, grinders and ovens on installments. He also offers a one-year warranty for each product. This is the only source of income for the entire family and his present stock is insufficient to meet household expenses. 

He wants to grow his business and wants to buy more electronics to sell but he does not have enough capital for further investment. Therefore, M. Aslam has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is the field partner of Kiva. Using this loan he will buy more stock to offer on installments. He is very happy after taking out this loan; he is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy washing machines, sewing machines, TV, foam mattresses. almira, ovens, juicers, grinders, etc.

loans.name: María Josefina

texts.es:
María de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, luego ingreso a estudiar en el nivel superior; pero por falta de recursos económicos desistió, esta acompañada, su esposo trabaja en la ciudad en una tienda de materiales de construcción, su única hija vive con ella, aun no estudia porque esta pequeña. Solo ella, una hermana y su hija viven en su casa, su esposo la visita solo los fines de semana.
   
María se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de pasteles, enchiladas, pupusas, frescos, tiene 2 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, en años anteriores trabajo en la capital en un comedor donde vendían esos típicos también, fue así que le gusto y encontró un fondo para invertir en materia prima, hasta que tiene su propio negocio. Antes de dedicarse a ello, trabajaba como banderillera en un proyecto de construcción de la carretera longitudinal del norte. El pequeño negocio que ahora tiene prácticamente lo tiene a unos 75 metros de su casa, no paga transporte  para llegar. Al trabajo solo le ayuda su hermana y el horario de trabajar es por las tardes.


Lo que va hacer con el financiamiento, es para terminar de pagar una vivienda que junto a su hermana están comprando, pero deben la mitad del dinero. El crédito ayudara a que tengan una mejor salud, que vivan más felices y que sus hijos vivan cómodamente. La necesidad de tenerte una casa digna donde puedan sentirse más confiados ante lo que pueda ocurrir.
Pretende ampliar su negocio, que haya más clientela, ayudar a su pequeña hija a que sea una profesional, darle todo lo básico.
texts.en:
María is 25-years old.  She finished high school and then started her higher education, but due to a lack of money, she dropped out.  María is married.  Her husband works in the city in a construction supply store.  Her only daughter lives with her and doesn't go to school, as she is still young.  Just María, one of her sisters and her daughter live together; her husband visits on the weekends. 
   
María makes her living making and selling pastries, enchiladas, "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) and beverages.  She has had her business for two years.  In previous years, she worked in the capital in an eatery where they sold these type of local dishes as well.  That was where she found what she liked to do and a way to invest in raw materials until she could open her own business.  Before opening her business, she also worked as a flagger for a construction project on the North-South highway in the north.  The small business she now has is about 75 meters from her house, so she doesn't have any commuting expenses.  Her sister is her only help at work, and they work in the afternoons.
