The eldest son works as a motorcyclist and lives with his life partner.

This woman is quite known where she lives since she takes part in all the activities of the community. She doesn’t have a business of her own, because she has dedicated her life to taking care of her kids. However, she sometimes beaks bread to sell in her community and gets some extra money for the household expenses. Still, this activity, which she learned from her mother, is something she doesn’t do very often. 

With the loan, she intends to buy cement and sand to install a concrete floor in her house. Right now she has this opportunity since she counts with her husband and children’s support to get ahead. Clearly, this will enhance her living conditions.

Her dreams and goals are to finish fixing her house, something that she will achieve little by little as long as she has her health and the help of Credicampo.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to install a concrete floor in her house.

loans.name: Kymbat

texts.ru: Кымбат 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Кымбат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кымбат занимается животноводством, стартовав 24 года назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кымбат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 40 овец. С апреля по октябрь месяц Кымбат и ее супруг уходят на пастбища, где занимаются выпасом скота. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кымбат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кымбат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Kymbat is 41 years old and together with he husband, she is raising four children.  Kymbat has a high-school education.  He main source of income is her livestock business, which she started 24 years ago by purchasing cattle for 3,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Kymbat's hard work, she currently has 3 cows, 2 horses, and 40 sheep.  From April to October, Kymbat and her husband take the cattle to the pastures for grazing.  Her monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS).  In order to expand her business, Kymbat turned to the bank of Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan to purchase additional cattle.  Kymbat is planning to use part of the profit from her business to expand her herd and to save some for repairs of her house.

loans.use: to buy some cows

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
José de 27 años de edad, realizo sus estudios hasta sexto grado debido a las pocas oportunidades que tubo para seguir estudiando. Actualmente él está a acompañado; quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  hace dos meses Dios les dio la oportunidad de ser padres de una niña.

José es soldador ya tiene 4 años de dedicarse a esta labor,  menciona que este trabajo lo aprendió atreves de un curso de soldador que impartirían; desde que sus amigos le comentaron sobre esto, él se entusiasmó mucho y decidió acercarse a la institución donde lo realizarían porque no quería quedarse sin recibir el curso, fue brindado totalmente gratis en el 2009, hasta este momento él se ha dado conocer gracias al buen trabajo que realiza, ya que lo recomiendan mucho sus clientes con otros. 

José también se dedica a la agricultura sembrando 3,500 metros cuadradas de maíz la cual le permite obtener los suficientes granos para su familia. En el trabajo de soldadura su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 am A 4:00 pm. El lugar de trabajo es en su comunidad, así como caseríos y cantones cercanos para trasladarse contrata a un amigo que tiene carro para trasladar los materiales donde realizara el trabajo

Con el préstamo comprara hierro, electrodos y discos materiales que se le habían terminado para realizar un trabajo de soldadura de un nuevo cliente que necesita de sus servicio esto le permitirá cumplir con este nuevo reto y obtener un nuevo cliente más y que este lo recomiende con otro. 

José tiene el sueño de que su negocio se amplié, esto permitirá darle trabajo a otras personas y además darle la seguridad económica a él y su familia. Su idea es capacitar a más jóvenes, para que trabajen con él y poder cubrir más compromisos, su meta es hacer el mejor trabajo para que este hable por si mismo de las capacidades que a adquirido en este negocio.
texts.en: Jose is 27 years old and only went to school as far as the sixth grade, due to the lack of opportunity that he had to continue studying.  He now lives with his partner who works in the home, and two months ago God gave them the opportunity to be the parents of a girl.  Jose is a welder, and has been working at this job for 4 years.  He says that his learned this work through a welding course that he took , after hearing his friends talk about it.  he was very enthusiastic and decided to approach the institution where is was being taught because he didn't want to miss out on the course.  In 2009 the course was provided to him free of charge.  From then until now he has become known for he good work that he does, and his customers often recommend him to others.  Jose also works in agriculture, planting 3,500 square meters of corn, which provides enough grain for his family.  In his welding job he works from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm.  His place of work is in his community, as well as in small towns and regions nearby.  He hires a friend who has a car to transport his materials to where he needs to go for work.  With the loan he will  buy iron, electrodes and discs that he has run out of, in order to complete a welding job for a new customer who needs his services.  This will enable him to overcome this new challenge and have another customer who will recommend him to others.  Jose dreams of expanding his business, which will allow him to provide employment for other people and also provide financial security for him and his family.  His idea is to train more young people, so that they can work with him and he can carry out more commitments.  His goal is to do the best work, so that it will speak for itself about the skills that he has acquired in this business.

loans.use: to buy iron, electrodes and discs to do a welding job.

loans.name: Benjamin Jeremias

texts.es:
Benjamín de 23 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado, esta  acompañado; su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, su hija mayor estudia  sexto grado y el pequeño aun no estudia por su edad. 

     El señor trabaja en la finca desde hace 4 años, realizando podas, aporco, fertilización y corta de café. Sus padres cuando él estaba pequeño lo llevaban al campo y como se acostumbró a ir a la finca decidió dedicarse desde muy joven a esta actividad.  Con el paso del tiempo decidió acompañarse. Por el momento es la única actividad productiva que tiene, siempre a sido jornalero, pero dedicándose a la siembra de granos básicos como frijol, maíz.  El lugar donde trabaja le queda  a 3 km de distancia y para llegar se transporta en bus y por partes a pie. El horario de trabajo es de 6:30 am a 2: pm

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 12 pliegos de lámina,  2 vigas, 150 varas para sostener la teja. Con el crédito mejorara su calidad de vida,  porque ya no penetrara  tan fuerte el sol, el agua en época lluviosa  así evitara que su familia sufra problemas de salud, tendrá un techo más adecuado para su familia.

El sueño de Benjamín es reunir dinero,  para construir formalmente su vivienda, es decir hacerla de ladrillo, adobe o bloque para que su familia viva aún más tranquila y más segura. Lo piensa lograr administrando bien sus ingresos y en cuanto a su familia quiere ayudar hasta donde sea necesario a su hija para que estudie.
texts.en:
Benjamín is 23 years old. He studied up to the 6th grade and he is married. His wife works on the domestic chores. His older daughter is studying the 6th grade and his young son has not yet started school because of his young age.

Benjamín has worked on an estate for 4 years pruning, planting, fertilizing and cutting coffee. When he was young his parents brought him to the fields so he became accustomed to going to these farms and he decided to dedicate himself to this work from a very young age. Over time he decided to go with his parents to work. At the moment this is the only kind of job he has. He has always been a laborer, but before he worked planting basic grains like beans and corn. The place where he works is 3km away and to get there he travels by bus and on foot. His work hours are from 6:30am to 2:00pm.

He is seeking this loan to purchase 12 sheets of metal, 2 beams and 150 rods to support the roof. With this loan he will improve his quality of life because the sun, and the water during the rainy season, will not penetrate his roof as strongly. This way he will avoid having his family suffer from health problems and he will provide a better roof for his family. 

Benjamín's dream is to save up money to formally build his house, namely to make it from bricks, adobe and slabs so that his family will live even more tranquilly and more safely. He thinks he administers his investments well and he wants to help his family with what is necessary for his daughter to attend school.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheets of metal, 2 beams and 150 rods to support the roof.

loans.name: José Natividad

texts.es:
José es una persona de 33 años de edad que se dedica a la agricultura en pequeño, ya que carece de una profesión académica ya que en el tiempo en el cual él era pequeño no había mucho acceso a la educación, por motivos de que su familia es de muy escasos recursos, se creció con sus padres a los cuales ayudaba a realizar los trabajos agrícolas de su hogar, con el tiempo fue adquiriendo experiencia y conocimientos sobre esa actividad, a la cual se dedica en la actualidad. El señor  tiene una familia conformada, por su esposa con quien ya tienen 9 años de casados y son padres de dos hijos que se encuentran cursando sus estudios de educación básica en la escuela de la comunidad.

 José se dedica a la agricultura y tiene una experiencia desde los 15 años realizando esta actividad, la cual aprendió de sus padres ya que cuando era pequeño le ayudaba a trabajar, él es el hermano mayor de su familia quienes se dedicaron a realizar trabajos familiares y ajenos. En la actualidad se dedica a la misma actividad, motivado por los ingresos económicos que  le producía dicha actividad y a la mismo sostiene a toda su familia

El dinero sera utilizado, para la compra de teja de barro, debido a que tiene problema de gotero porque están quebradas la mayoría del techo de su casa, ya que uno de los proyectos que tiene pensado implementar en los últimos días del mes de enero y de esta manera podrá ayudar a su familia a tener una mejor calidad de vida para su esposa y sus hijos a parte de los ingresos que tiene.


Las proyecciones que tiene el cliente a futuro son las de adquirir otro crédito, para  hacer unas habitaciones, para cada uno de sus hijos y apoyar el esfuerzo que cada uno de sus hijos para que en su determinada edad puedan optar para prepararse académica mente y tener una mejor oportunidad  de trabajo.
texts.en:
José, 33, makes a living doing small-scale agriculture. He does not have an academic profession since when he was young there was not much access to education. Because his family had very few resources, he grew up helping his parents do agricultural work at home, and with time he acquired experience and knowledge in this field, in which he currently makes a living. 

He has a family made up of his wife and children. He has been already been married for nine years, and he and his wife are parents to two children, who are pursuing their basic education in a school in the community.

José makes a living in agriculture and he has 15 years of experience doing this. He learned it from his parents, since when he was small he helped them work. He is the oldest sibling in a family that made a living doing family and outside work. Currently, he makes a living doing the same work, motivated by the income that it produces, which allows him to support his whole family.

The money will be utilized to purchase clay tiles to fix a leaking problem, because the majority of his home´s roof tiles are broken. This is one of the projects that he is thinking of implementing in the final days of January and in that way, he will be able to help his wife and children not only with the income he earns, but to have a better quality of life.

His projections for the future are to acquire another loan to build rooms for each one of his children, and to support the efforts of both of his children so that at the appropriate age they can choose to prepare academically and have better work opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase clay tiles to fix a leaking problem, because the majority of his home´s roof tiles are broken

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more maize grains and flour

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Stepanavan with her husband. Their only son is 19 years old and currently serves in the army. 

Together with her husband, Marine has been running a bakery since 1999. They make the Armenian national bread, lavash, which is in high demand among the local people in Stepanavan.

Marine would like to ask for financial support for her bakery by applying for this loan. The loan will help her to purchase tools and materials for making bread and a heater needed for the bakery. 

She will be very thankful to the lenders who will assist her bakery.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for making bread and a heater for the bakery

loans.name: Theophilus

texts.en:
Theophilus is 30 years old and lives in the town of Lira in the Lira region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with four of them currently in school. 

For the past two years, Theophilus has been working hard to manage his retail shop which sells books, soap, cooking oil, juice, and toilet paper. 

To help expand his business, Theophilus has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more books, soap, cooking oil, juice, and toilet paper. The loan will help Theophilus to generate greater profits and increase his capital. 

He hopes that in the future he will be able to earn a higher profit.

loans.use: to buy more books, soap, cooking oil, juice, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en: Bashir is a 40-year-old married man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a hard-working and diligent man. He is also cheerful and kind. He lives comfortably with his family. He started his business with limited capital and he has been selling chickens for 10 years. He considers his business profitable because of the good income it gives him. This is thanks to how well received his business is with his customers. He applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy chickens for his business to continue increasing his income. He is looking forward to opening another chicken shop to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en:
Nazim is 56 years old and married with a son and three daughters. He and other members of his family are refugees and live in an IDP (internally displaced person) settlement. 

He is a farmer and has gained good experience working in this field for 30 years. He raises greens and other sorts of seasonal vegetables and sells them at the local bazaar. His monthly income is 150 AZN. 

People prepare different delicious dishes using fresh vegetables. They also like to cook fried vegetables like pomidor dolmasi and badimcan dolmasi. Nazim’s grocery is very popular because everybody knows that his vegetables are always fresh and were raised without any pesticides. 

Unfortunately, Nazim’s income isn’t enough to cover his family’s cost of living. He needs money to provide for his children's education. He also wants to repair his old house.  

He applied for a 2,000 AZN loan in order to buy new varities of vegetable seeds and increase his harvest. He hopes that the expansion of his small business will provide a good income to cover his family’s financial demands.

loans.use: to buy new varieties of vegetable seeds and increase harvest

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 33 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with none of them currently in school. 

For the past five years, Joel has been working hard to manage his retail shop which sells Lucozade drinks, bread, glasses, snacks, umbrellas, and water. 

To help expand his business, Joel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more Lucozade drinks, bread, glasses, snacks, umbrellas, and water. This loan and will help Joel to generate greater profits and increase his stock. 

Joel hopes that in the future he will be able to own a wholesale gift center.

loans.use: to purchase more Lucozade drinks, bread, glasses, snacks, umbrellas, and water

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS TRIUNFADORAS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Delfina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de tenis, carpintería, venta de carne de cordero, servicio de conducción, venta de ropa de bebe, tejido de busos, confección de chamarras, taller mecánico, venta de zapatos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Delfina es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de polainas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años y lo implemento como fuente de generación de recursos económicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquinas de tejer y lana) que adquirirá de los tiendas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las el área de capacitación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The "LAS TRIUNFADORAS" communal bank is starting its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani focal center.  It is made up of eight members, and is led by an executive committee of which Delfina is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal association operate are varied, among others: selling athletic shoes, carpentry, selling lamb meat, driving, selling baby clothes, weaving, making jackets, a mechanic shop, and selling shoes.  The loan that is being taken will benefit small microbusiness owners such as Delfina.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago, after having been invited by a friend who is a member of the group.  She now has a business weaving and selling leggings.  She says that she learned this business on her own initiative several years ago, as a means of earning income.  The loan will be used to increase her capital (by buying looms and wool) that she will acquire from stores in the city of La Paz and then install in her work space.  This type of work allows her to earn income to help support her family, as she lives in a common-law relationship and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training that is provided by the organization.

loans.use: to buy a loom and some wool.

loans.name: Inti Sol Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INTI SOL” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de abarrotes, venta de comida, venta de lana, costura de overoles, macramé de mantas, tejido de mantas, costura de polleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio y costura de polleras; da a conocer que estos negocios los emprendió por iniciativa propia con un pequeño capital con el que contaba y al observar que estos le ayudaban generar ingresos
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina de coser y abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrecen en la institución.
texts.en: The "INTI SOL" communal association is starting its tenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana focal center.  It is made up of eight members, and is led by an executive committee of which Maria is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal association operate are varied, and include: a grocery store, food sales, wool sales, sewing overalls, making macramé blankets, weaving blankets, and making skirts.  The loan that is being taken will benefit small microbusiness owners such as Maria.  She says that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer, after having been invited by am advisor from the organization who visited her in her home.  She now has a neighborhood store and a business making skirts.  She says that she started these businesses on her own initiative with a small amount of capital that she has, and has seen them help her to increase her income.  The loan will be used to increase her capital (by buying a sewing machine and wholesale groceries) that she will acquire from markets in the city of El Alto and later sell in her store.  This type of work allows her to earn income to help support her family, as she is married and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health care that is provided by the organization.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and wholesale groceries.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman and has four children. She describes herself to be independent. 

She operates a salon where she offers hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are ladies. 

Mary describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock of items used in the salon. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy hair weaves and other beauty products for use in the salon. 

Her business goal is to have a better salon within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock of hair weaves and other beauty products for use in the salon.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves and other beauty products

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman and has two children. She describes herself to be obedient. 

She operates a retail business where she sells hair weaves. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition. Her business goal is to open a beauty salon within five years. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of hair weaves. Amina will use the anticipated profits to open a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 41 years old and lives with her husband and daughter, a student, in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. Anna has a higher education degree in teaching and now works at the local school as an elementary school teacher. 

She is a very clever, educated, and interesting person. Anna manages to organize informative, active, and methodologically-correct lessons. Pupils like her very much because of her kind and tolerant attitude towards them.
  
Anna is asking for a loan of 600,000 AMD in order to buy a projector and a computer so that she can find interesting information useful for her school lessons.

loans.use: to buy a projector and a computer for school lessons.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kinoni in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has one child.

For the past six years, Abdul has been working hard to manage his phone and repair business which sells phone accessories, DVDs, and movies. 

To help expand his business, Abdul has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more DVDs and phone accessories. The loan will help Abdul to generate greater profits and expand the business. 

Abdul hopes that in the future he will be able to achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to buy more DVDs and phone accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her sales by buying more used clothes.

loans.name: Rubis Elmer

texts.es:
Rubis de 39 años de edad, ejerce el oficio de albañil ya que carece de una carrera profesional, debido a que en el tiempo en el cual él era pequeño no había mucho acceso a la educación por motivos de que su familia es de muy escasos recursos,  creció con sus padres a los cuales ayudaba a realizar los trabajos agrícolas de su hogar, con el tiempo fue adquiriendo experiencia y conocimientos sobre esa actividad, a la cual se dedica en la actualidad, ademas de la agricultura participo en un curso de albañileria en construcción y le fue de mucho beneficio porque ahora es su principal fuente de ingreso, ademas tiene una mini tienda  en su casa, la cual es administrada por su esposa.  Son padres de un hijo de 7 años, quien se encuentra estudiando el primer grado en el centro escolar de la comunidad.


 Rubis tiene una experiencia de trabajo en la agricultura de 25 años, ademas ejerce el oficio de albañilería desde hace 5 años, la cual se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, la cual fue el resultado de haber participado en un curso de formación para albañiles en construcción, y decidió continuar esta actividad motivado por las ganancias económicas que esta le da, ademas no tiene que viajar porque trabaja en la zona en la cual vive.
 

El dinero otorgado sera invertido, en surtir y ampliar una minitienda que es administrada por su esposa y esta ubicada en su hogar, de esta manera podrá prestar un mejor servicio a las personas y obtendrá mejores ganancias y mejorara la rentabilidad de su negocio.


Las proyecciones que  tiene para un futuro son las de ampliar su negocio y ver la posibilidad de adquirir otro crédito, para poner una tienda en el pueblo y apoyar en las actividades educativas de su hijo, ya que expresa que tiene el sueño que su hijo sea un profesional en la ingeniería civil.
texts.en:
Rubis, 39, works as a bricklayer because he doesn't have a professional career.  When he was young he didn't have a lot of access to an education because of his family's limited resources.  He grew up with his parents, who helped him learn the farming labor of his household.  In time he acquired experience and knowledge in this job.

Currently Rubis works in agriculture.  Besides that, he did a course of study in bricklaying and construction, which was useful to him because now it's his main source of income.  He also has a mini-store in his house that his wife runs.  They're the parents of a seven-year-old son who's in first grade in the town school.

Rubis has 25 years of experience in agriculture.  For five years he also has worked as a bricklayer, which has become his main source of income.  This was the result of having taken a course of study for bricklayers in construction, and deciding to continue in that line of work for the income.  Also, he doesn't have to travel because he works in the area where he lives. 

Rubis will use the money to stock and expand the mini-store that his wife runs in their home.  This way she'll be able to offer better service, earn more profits, and improve the profitability of her business.

His plans for the future are to expand the business, get another loan to set up a store in the town, and support his son's education, because his dream is for his son to be a professional civil engineer.

loans.use: to stock and expand his wife's mini-market

loans.name: San Pedro De Huatajata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN PEDRO DE HUATAJATA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de carne y queso, venta de pescado, venta de charque.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne y queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus amigos que tenían el mismo negocio, con un poco capital emprendió su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de queso y carne por mayor) que adquirirá de su comunidad y posteriormente lo comercializará en comunidades tropicales donde no existen estos productos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The "SAN PEDRO DE HUATAJATA" communal association is starting its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Copacabana focal center.  It is made up of eight members, and is led by an executive committee of which Lidia is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal association operate are varied, and include: selling vegetables, selling meat and cheese, selling fish, and selling jerky.  The loan that is being taken will benefit small microbusiness owners such as Lidia.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, after having been invited by an organizer from the organization who came to visit her in her home.  She now has a business selling meat and cheese.  She says that she learned this business from her friends who were working in it, and with a bit of capital she started her own business.  The loan will be used to increase her capital (by buying wholesale cheese and meat) that she will acquire in her community and will then sell in tropical communities where such products do not exist.  This type of work allows her to earn income to support her family, as she lives in a common-law relationship and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the loans and the training that the organization provides.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cheese and meat.

loans.name: Villa Esther Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA ESTHER” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Constancia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: panadera, servicio de limpieza, servicio de construcción, costura de sombreros, venta de pan.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Constancia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de pan; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con un poco capital que tenía y al observar que este producto se vendía con gran existo lo adquirió.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de pan por mayor) que adquirirá de las panaderías de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Villa Esther communal bank will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of its Central Focus of Santiago II, which is comprised of eight members and is managed by the board of directors with Constancia as the President. The businesses of the members from the communal bank are moving forward with various activities, including a bread shop, cleaning service, construction service, hat making, and bread sales.

This loan will benefit small micro businesses like member Constancia. She says that she became a member of Pro Mujer three years ago, joining after the invitation of a promoter of the institution who came to her house. She currently has a business selling bread. She says that she started this business with the little capital that she had. She noticed that this product was sold with great success and she bought it.

The loan that she will take out will increase capital (buying bread wholesale), which she will get from the bread shop in the city of El Alto and then sell it in her sales space. This form of work allows her to earn income to support her family since she is married and has four children.

When asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the loans and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale bread.

loans.name: Emin

texts.en:
Emin is 29 years old and lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He has a military higher education and now works at one of the Vanadzor military units as a commander. He has all the features of a soldier such as enterprising, precise, and a great sense of patriotism. He has a great reputation among his soldiers and colleagues. 

Emin lives in a rented house in Vanadzor, but unfortunately he is apart from his family. His wife and his child live in another city, and once a week Emin visits them. He says that it is very hard for him to live far from his family, and he has a great wish to bring his family to Vanadzor.

Emin is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 AMD since he wants to buy a washing machine and a television in order to make his family’s life more comfortable. He also wants to buy a computer since he does military simulations and needs a computer for this work.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine, a television, and a computer.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet  is married with four children, and three of her children go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothing and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothing. She moves door-to-door selling used clothing on both a wholesale and retail basis six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include thieves and rainy season which hinders her movements. She is aspiring to get a permanent business premise and also to sell on wholesale only. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en: Faiza is a 41-year-old widowed woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined to work. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, washing soap, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are permanent customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of washing soap, bread, sugar and other items for resale. Her business goal is to open a wholesale shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of washing soap, bread, sugar and other items for resale.

loans.name: Unión Chua Cayacoto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN CHUA CAYACOTO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sabina es la Presidenta. El negocio que las desarrollan todas las socias es la pesca y posteriormente la venta de este productos, que lo realizan en sus comunidades.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sabina es integrante, ella indica que es la el tercer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de pesca y venta; da a conocer que este negocio lo fue un negocio familiar y aprendió el mismo de sus padres, ya que les ayudo desde niña, posterior a tener su pareja decide emprender un negocio propio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de redes) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de pesca para poder comercializar. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The "UNION CHUA CAYACOTO" is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Achacachi focal center.  It is made up of eight members, and is led by an executive committee of which Sabina is the president.  The business that all of the members of the communal association carry out is catching fish and then selling the products, which they do in their communities.  The loan that is being taken will benefit small microbusiness owners such as Sabina.  She says that this is the third year that she has belonged to Pro Mujer, after having been invited by an organizer from the organization who came to visit her in her home.  She now has a business catching and selling fish.  She says that this was a family business that she learned from her parents, as she helped them since she was a child.  Later, she decided to start her own business with her partner.  The loan will be sued to increase her capital (by buying fishing nets) that she will acquire from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and then install in her fishing business.  This type of work allows her to earn income to support her family, as she lives in a common-law relationship and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training that the organization offers.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Majdeya

texts.en: Because Majdeya is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Majdeya was born in 1960. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa with her six sons and daughter. Her husband is a driver. One of her sons is a college student, and he is in his first year. He is planning to work in his field of study after graduation to help in supporting his family financially because of the financial crisis they are facing. However, Majdeya doesn't have enough money to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Laith

texts.en: Laith is 19 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his four sisters and his parents. Laith is a University student majoring in Business Administration. He is in his second year. He also works at a restaurant. Laith is planning to find a better job in his field of study after graduation in order to support his family financially, but he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a 48-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 17 and 24. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a developed place, and her primary customers are regular consumers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy fabric, thread and more materials for making clothes. Her business goal is to be very successful within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be a successful entrepreneur. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 40,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and more materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Cocuriga Grp 3 Group

texts.en:
Angelique is 46 years old. She is married with four children. She is a group leader, and all group leaders grow rice on a big land.They were all dedicated to improving their lives after getting agriculture loans. She will use the Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production. They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is married with five children, and four of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister's child). She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for seven years. She applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO   to buy more bunches of green bananas. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to own a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to become a wholesaler. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Mayaqui Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAYAQUI SARTASIÑANI” iniciará el décimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Agustina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas, venta de ropa, venta de helado, venta de cosas de plomería, ayudante de electricista, tejido de fajas, taller de electricistas, venta de herramientas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Agustina es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tienda de ferretería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años al contar con un capital pequeño decide implementarlo en la compra de estos productos..
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cemento y fierros) que adquirirá en las empresas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, los ahorros, las capacitaciones y el servicio médico que le ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se encuentra la hija de una señora , ella esta vestida de color rosa.
texts.en:
The communal bank “MAYAQUI SARTASIÑANI” will start its fifteenth lending cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of Centro Focal German Busch.  The communal bank is made up of nine members and overseen by a board of directors, of which señora Agustina is the president.  The members' businesses are varied and include: selling sweaters, clothing sales, ice cream sales, selling plumbing-related items, electrician's assistant, weaving sashes, an electrician's workshop and selling tools. 

The loan the communal bank is taking out will benefit small, micro-entrepreneurs, of which señora Agustina is one.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer six years ago at the invitation of a friend, who was a member of the institution.  Currently, señora Agustina has a hardware store.  She says that she started the business a few years ago.  As she had a small amount of capital, she decided to use it to purchase hardware items. 
 
The loan that señora Agustina is taking out is for increasing her capital (to purchase cement and metal) which she will acquire from the wholesale companies in El Alto and then sell in her shop.  This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family, as she is married and has two children.   

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, señora Agustina says she likes the loans, the savings programs, the trainings and the healthcare offered by the institution. 

In the above photo, the daughter of one of the women is pictured.  She is dressed in pink.

loans.use: to purchase cement and metal.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is widowed with four children and none of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandson). She has a business of selling local gin and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more jerrycans of local gin. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest charged. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin to sell in her liquor store.

loans.name: Las Chijinis Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS CHIJINIS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosmery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, taller de costura, venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosmery es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al iniciar un negocio de venta rápida en las unidades educativas de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente decide emprender su propio espacio de comercialización.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras y abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las el área de capacitación en salud y educación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The "LAS CHIJINIS" communal association is starting its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani focal center.  It is made up of eight members and is led by an executive committee, of which Rosmery is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal association operate are varied, and include: weaving blankets, selling food, a neighborhood store, a sewing business, and selling blankets.  The loan that is being taken will benefit small microbusiness owners such as Rosmery.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, after having been invited by her friend who is a member.  She now has a business selling food.  She says that she learned how to start her business of rapid sales in educational institutions in the city of El Alto, and then decided to start her own business.  The loan will be used to increase her capital (by buying vegetables and groceries wholesale) that she will acquire from markets in the city of La Paz and later use to make products in her business.  This type of work allows her to earn income to help support her family, as she lives in a common-law relationship and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training in health and education that the organization provides.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and groceries wholesale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 30-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be confident. She operates a retail shop where she sells electronics. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an urban area, and her primary customers are small scale. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of electronics. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that she will have a bright future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronics.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly is married with four children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used shoes and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler as well as to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest charged. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 29-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail business where she sells cassava, coconuts, and sweet potatoes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cassava, sweet potatoes, and coconuts. She hopes that she will have a bright future. She will use the anticipated profits to open another business.

loans.use: buy more stock of cassava, sweet potatoes and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her mini market with new food products.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is married with two children and none of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (niece). She has a retail shop and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil. She generates additional income from selling piped water and from rental houses. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a wholesale shop and also to build more rental houses. She resides in the family house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses includes food and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Viloroco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILOROCO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de leche, producción de queso, compra y venta de ganado, tejido de mantas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de lechería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres que tenían el mismo negocio, con un poco capital emprendió su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las comunidades cercanas y posteriormente a la crianza comercializará la leche en la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The "VILOROCO" communal association is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Copacabana focal center.  It is made up of eight members and is led by an executive committee, of which Virginia is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal association operate are varied, and include: milk production, cheese production, buying and selling cattle, weaving blankets, and selling food.  The loan that is being taken will benefit small microbusiness owners such as Virginia.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago, after having been invited by an organizer from the organization who came to visit her in her home.  She now has a milk business.  She says that she learned this business from her parents who did the same work, and then with a bit of capital started her own business. The loan will be used to increase her capital (by buying cows) that she will acquire from neighboring communities later raise in order to sell their milk in the city of El Alto.  This type of work allows her to earn income to help support her family, as she lives in a common-law relationship and has one child.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings that the organization provides.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar is farmer. She keeps livestock (cows, sheep, pigs, piglets and chickens) as well as cultivates wheat, potato, and grass. Gohar lives with her husband and 22-year-old son. Her husband works in the village hall, but his salary is so low that agriculture is the main source of their income. Gohar milks cows, uses it in cheese production and her husband sells produced cheese to local wholesalers. Over years of hard work, Gohar has proved that the cheese she makes is high quality and tasty. As agribusiness is vital for family's living, Gohar would like to improve her farm. She applied for this loan to purchase potato seeds and forage for the livestock. She will be very grateful to all the lenders who will support her with her farm.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and forage for the livestock for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 56-year-old married man. He has two children aged nine years and 16 years. He describes himself to be outgoing. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a secure location that is highly populated and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough storage facilities. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a freezer for meat storage. His business goal is to have a chain of butcheries within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be self dependent. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a van.

loans.use: buy a freezer for meat storage for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en: Raeda was born in 1982. She is a married woman living in a sector in Jordan called Irbid. Her husband works in construction. Raeda has been supporting her husband in improving their living conditions by running her project of selling clothes. She started her project two years ago selling a small quantity of clothes to her friends. Then, she started expanding it gradually. Now, she needs to buy summer clothes for the coming season in order to attract more customers at the beginning of summer. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Perlas Doradas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PERLAS DORADAS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Angélica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, costura de billeteras, venta de verduras, tejido de macramé, venta de ropa, florería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Angélica es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años y lo implemento como fuente de generación de recursos económicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de los tiendas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las el área de capacitación en salud y crédito que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Perlas Doradas Communal Bank will start its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Angélica's the president.  The bank members carry out a variety of jobs, including a neighborhood store, sewing wallets, vegetable sales, macramé, clothing sales, and a florist.

The loan will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Angélica.  She said she has been a member of Pro Mujer for a year, having joined on the invitation of a friend who's a member.  Currently she sells clothes, a business she learned a few years ago on her own and started so she could generate an income. 

Angélica's loan is to increase her capital and buy clothing in stores in the city of La Paz and later sell in her sales stall.  This job allows her to earn income to support her household to the extent possible, because she's married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says the health and loan training they offer.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is a 48-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 12 years to 21 years. She describes herself to be patient and ambitious. She operates a boutique where she sells textiles and shoes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in  a busy area that is less competitive and her primary customers are walk-ins and permanent customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that most people want to buy on credit. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of textile materials to sell. Her business goal is to be a supplier of materials to retailers within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will grow her business to the level of a supplier and take take care of her family. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: buy more stock of textile materials to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is married with six children and two of her children go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She has a beauty salon business and has been in this business for 21 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves, Vaseline and other cosmetics. She generates additional income from selling piped water and from rental houses. She works six days out of every week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever-increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. She aspires to own a fully-stocked beauty salon and also to build more rental rooms. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because they are reliable. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves, Vaseline, and other cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: 2 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “2 DE JULIO” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mary es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas, venta de tele cable, venta de zapatos, venta de pescados, venta de comida, costura de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mary es integrante, ella indica que es el cuarto año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de zapatos; da a conocer que estos negocios los emprendió porque ya conocía la mercadería, ya que desde niña ayudaba a su madre a la venta de zapatos y posterior a tener su primer hijo decide emprender su propio negocio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de zapatos por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la frontera de Perú y Bolivia y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación en salud y crédito que le ofrecen en la institución.
texts.en: The "2 DE JULIO" communal association is starting its eighth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana focal center.  It is made up of eight members and is led by an executive committee, of which Mary is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal association operate are varied, and include: weaving sweaters, selling cable TV, selling shoes, selling fish, selling food, and sewing jackets. The loan that is being taken will benefit small microbusiness owners such as Mary.  She says that this is the fourth year that she has belonged to Pro Mujer, after having been invited to join by an advisor from the organization who came to visit her in her home.  She now has a business selling shoes.  She says that she learned this business because she already knew the merchandise, having helped her mother sell shoes since she was a child.  Later, after having her first child, she decided to start her own business. The loan will be used to increase her capital (by buying shoes wholesale) that she will acquire from markets on he border between Peru and Bolivia and then sell in her business.  This type of work allows her to earn income to help support her family, as she is single and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training in health and the loans that the organization provides.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy onion and potato seeds for planting

loans.name: Margarita De Collpani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARGARITAS DE COLLPANI” iniciará el décimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilaria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de salteñas, taller de costura, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilaria es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió en un trabajo anterior, donde realizaba servicios de atención de comida, al contar con un pequeño capital decide independizarse.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Margaritas de Collpani communal bank will be starting its nineteenth cycle at Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani regional hub.  It is made up of eight members and is run by a board, with Hilaria as president.  The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses, including blanket sales, food sales, general store, selling meat pies, sewing, and knitting blankets.

The loan they take out will benefit small businesswomen, including Hilaria who is one of the members.  Hilaria says that eight years ago she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of her friend who is a member of the institution.  Now Hilaria has a business selling food.  She says that she learned this trade at a previous job, where she worked in food service.  When she had a little capital she decided to start her own business.  

The loan she is going to take out now is for increasing her capital.  She will buy ingredients in bulk at the markets in the city of La Paz and then after the food is prepared she will sell it at her premises.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to keep up her household as well as possible, since she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Hilaria says that she likes the health services the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a 31-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages three and 15 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are ladies and students. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to open a boutique.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Fillor

texts.en: Fillor is back again; he is about to plant onion seeds and he needs your financial help to achieve this seasonal activity.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds for planting.

loans.name: Ardjan

texts.en: Ardjan sells items such as perfumes, toys for children, and also used televisions, refrigerators, stoves and washers; he is requesting this loan to stock up on inventory items. Ardjan is a member of the ethnic minority of Egyptian Albanians and is a 40-year-old married father of one. They live in a village built on the mountain site where a mulberry tree called “mani” in Albanian grows. They make a traditional drink called “Raki” out of this fruit. Other fruit orchards grown in this village are pears, plums and grapes. Most of the villagers keep cows. When it comes to traditional foods, there are cooked dried beans and “fergesa” prepared with cottage cheese, tomatoes and green papers.

loans.use: To stock up on inventory items for hjs retail shop.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 58-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from five years to 30 years. She operates a retail business where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation problems. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy livestock for slaughter to enable her add stocks of meat for sell in her butchery. (She is buying a cow for slaughter as seen in the photo). This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to open other butchery branches.

loans.use: to buy livestock for slaughter to enable her add stock of meat to sell in her butcher shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy stock of wheat flour, cooking oil and other ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Daria

texts.en: Daria is a repeat client aged 40 years, who has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to improve on her plantation. She has a challenge of little business turnover from her banana plantation, so she decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to buy more mulch and hire more labor to prune her banana plantation and mulch it to reduce loss of moisture, this being a dry season. Daria thinks this will improve the output from her plantation and also increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy mulch and hire labor for her farming business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be loyal and generous. He operates a retail shop where he sells maize flour, milk, soap, sugar, and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a marketable place and his primary customers are of all types.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of maize flour, soap, sugar, and other items for resale in his shop. His business goal is to have a supermarket within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will save and have a better life. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of maize flour, soap, sugar, and other items for resale in his shop.

loans.name: Flamur

texts.en: Flamur whose name in English means “flag” is a 39-year-old married Egyptian Albanian who has two children aged 15 and 18. He is photographed in front of his family home that he wants to make basic repairs including installing windows and doors; they live very poorly and your help will make him achieve his goal. Flamur is a painter and he had an accident at work sometimes back when he broke his neck badly and a surgery took place immediately to fix it. His wife sometimes immigrates to neighboring countries for seasonal work. Due to the lack of windows and doors to their place, the rest of his family has moved to his mother-in-law's home until their home is ready.

loans.use: to make basic repairs to their poorly built family home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of pipes, nails, sockets, and other building materials to resell.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be dedicated and devoted. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a suitable area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be taxation rates. She will use the loan to purchase more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to open a wholesale within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: purchase more stock of clothes

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a 23-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant place and her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a stock of ingredients for preparing food to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will build a permanent house for her parents. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of ingredients for preparing food to sell.

loans.name: Belinta

texts.en: Belinta is a 40-year-old widowed woman. She has four children with ages ranging from six years to 18 years. She describes herself to be as a person who never gives up. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a fair place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family life. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 32-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be goal oriented and trustworthy. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk for sale and grows vegetables to sell. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area with high demand for milk and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a bicycle to enable her distribute milk to the market. Her business goal is to buy another cow within five years to enable her to increase milk production. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a motorcycle which she will lease out to enable her to earn more income. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle to enable her to distribute milk to the market.

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CRECER” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesana en macramé, confección de deportivos, venta de lana, costura de chamarras, venta de comida, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio costura de ropa deportiva; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años de los trabajos anteriores, posteriormente a su primer hijo decide emprender su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá en las fábricas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el servicio médico que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "CRECER" will start its first cycle at Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de German Busch. The group has eight members and a management team where Julia is the president. The businesses represented are varied and include: "macramé" (fabric made with knots) craftsmanship, sport shoes' making, sale of wool, jackets' dressmaking, sale of food and sale of clothing. 

The loan will benefit small microentrepreneurs, including Julia. She has been with Pro Mujer for a year after being invited by a consultant that visited her at her home. She currently owns a sports clothing dressmaking business. She started it several years ago when, after the arrival of her first son, she decided to build her own work space. She will use the loan to increase capital (buy fabric in the factories of El Alto) so that she can make the product and sell it in her showroom. This is how she obtains resources for her family. She lives with her partner and two children. 

When asked about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the opportunities and medical services offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
