loans.use: to purchase more slippers and used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 36-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 4 years and 10 years. She describes herself to be jovial, composed, and ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, sweets, bread, and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy shopping center, and her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of wheat flour, sugar, rice, bread, and other items. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of wheat flour, sugar, rice, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of potatoes.

loans.name: Virginio

texts.en:
Virginio is a 39-year-old retiree from the Belize Defense Force. He lives in the village of San Jose, Toledo with his wife Bertha and three children; the eldest is 14 years old and the youngest is three years old. 

He was motivated by his family members to engage in cacao farming as a source of cultivating some of his land. He further envisioned this kind of crop to be profitable and long lasting. He therefore plans to acquire a loan as a medium for getting this job done. He will need cash to pay hired workers to work on his cacao patch so that this will serve as a catalyst for him.

He enjoys working on his land and plans to become knowledgeable with the grafting of cacao plants. His hope for his children and family is that the children get more educated and to extend his farm. He believes this is worth doing and will generate income. 

Virginio is requesting this loan to start his nursery of 2000 grafting seedlings to develop his five acres of land.

loans.use: to start his nursery of 2000 grafting seedlings to develop his five acres of land.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a 46-year-old woman. She has four children, ages ranging from 3 years to 19 years. She describes herself to be trustworthy and ambitious. She operates a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in an area with high demand for the products she sells, and her primary customers are local residents.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of cabbages, tomatoes, bananas, and other fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to expand the business and open a general store within five years. She hopes that in the future, the business will enable her family to build a new house. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cabbages, tomatoes, bananas, and other fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nueva Generación Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA GENERACIÓN DEL FUTURO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Zenovia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de muebles, venta de colchones, servicio de transporte, macramé de mantas, venta de refrescos, costura de chamarras, carpintería, elaboración de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Zenovia es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de muebles y colchones; da a conocer que estos negocios los emprendió hace once años al adquirir muebles a medio uso, los cuales hacia la reparación y los comercializaba, en la actualidad adquiere muebles nuevos. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de esponja por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la frontera de Perú y Bolivia y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las consultas médica y la atención que le ofrecen en la institución.

En la imagen una de las señoras se ubica detras de su compañero por que se ubico mal en la imagen
texts.en:
The communal bank “Nueva Generación Del Futuro” (“The Future’s New Generation”) will begin their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana. It is made up of nine members and has a board of directors, of which Zenovia is president. The businesses belonging to the members of the communal bank are varied, including: selling furniture, selling mattresses, transportation, making macramé blankets, selling soft drinks, sewing coats, carpentry, and shoemaking.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small micro-businesses where Zenovia is a member. She says that this is the first year she has been with Pro Mujer, having joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business which sells furniture and mattresses.  She began this business eleven years ago when she acquired some used furniture, which she repaired and sold. She now buys new furniture.

The loan is for the increase of capital (wholesale purchase of sponge) which she will buy from the fairs on the border of Peru and Bolivia and later sell in her store. This work allows her to generate what income she can for her household, since she is married and has a son.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the medical consultations and the assistance that the institution offers to them.

In the picture one of the women is behind her co-member, because she positioned herself badly in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase sponge wholesale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 54-year-old married man. He has six children, ages ranging from 10 years to 24 years. He operates a retail business where he sells furniture. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a convenient place and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport problem. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of furniture to sell. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more furniture to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to develop 2,000 grafted cacao seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Maysa

texts.en:
Maysa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.
 
Maysa is a 21-year-old married woman from Nablus city. She lives with her husband and one small kid in a small simple house. for the past year, Maysa's husband has been working in his store where he repairs mobile phones and sells their accessories. it is a good business and he earns a good income. 

Maysa and her husband would like to improve the store. She took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband buy more mobiles and accessories for his store to resell. by taking this loan, Maysa and her husband will be able to improve the store conditions and increase its income.

loans.use: to help her husband buy more mobiles and accessories for his store to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes, electronics items, etc for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To develop 2,000 grafted cacao seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cloth, fabric, and other items for his business.

loans.name: Las Iluminadas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ILUMINADAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa de lana, venta de comida, producción de alfombras, venta de CD’s, venta de fruta, artesanías de alasita (feria de la miniatura), pastelería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de fruta; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años al ayudar a su tía en su negocio, posterior a su primer hijo decide emprender su negocio independiente, ya que conocía del mercado a trabajar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frutas) que adquirirá en las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, los ahorros, las capacitaciones y el servicio médico que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank ‘Las Iluminadas’ are starting their first cycle with the organization ‘Pro Mujer’.  They are working with one of the regional offices in the province of German Busch.  The group is made up of eight women and it is managed by a board of directors, of which Maria is the president.  The members do various activities, such as selling woolen clothing, food, CDs and fruit and making rugs, miniatures (for the Alasitas fair) and cakes. 

The loan will benefit the group of small businesswomen.  Maria has been a member of this group for four years.  She joined after being invited to by a friend of hers who was also a member.  Currently, she has a business selling fruit.  She learnt this trade several years ago after helping her aunt.  After having her first child, she decided to start up on her own, using her knowledge of the market.

The loan that she will receive is to buy more fruit which she will buy wholesale in El Alto and then sell on her stall.  This work allows her to generate an income to maintain her family, as she is single and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about ‘Pro Mujer’, she tells us that it is the loans, the savings, the training and the medical service that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Yahia

texts.en:
Yahia is a 24-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. For the past year, Yehia has been working in his store where he repair refrigerators. It is a good business and he earns a good income. Yahia would like to improve his business.
 
Yahia took a USD Murahaba loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a especial gas he uses for repairing refrigerators. By taking this loan, Yahia's productivity and income will increase.
 
Yahia appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy a especial gas he uses for repairing refrigerators.

loans.name: Las Brisas Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito, una de ellas es Ana es una mujer de 37 años de edad, acompañada, su negocio es la venta de tortilla desde hace 15 años consecutivos, tiene 6 meses de ser cliente de la institución, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como quintal de maíz, leña, cal, etc. con el crédito logro mantener en existencia materia prima, Rosa tiene 23 años y su negocio es la venta de sandalias y zapatos, Rebeca tiene 46 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cajeta ambulante.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful businesswomen.  One of the members is Ana, 37, who is married.  She sells tortillas, which she has done for 15 years.  She has been a member of the group for six years.  She will invest the money in buying raw material such as a quintal of corn, firewood, lime powder, etc. in order to keep a steady supply.  

Rosa, 23, sells sandals and shoes; while Rebeca, 46, sells ‘cajeta’, a soft caramel, as a street vendor.

loans.use: to invest in raw material such as corn, firewood , lime powder, etc.

loans.name: Jenan

texts.en:
Jenan is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Jenan is a 49-year-old married woman from Qalqilia city. She is a mother for three sons and three daughters. Her husband is a worker where he gets a low and unstable income. this income barely covers all the family needs. Jenan's sons are student at a local university where they study accounting and business. They would like to finish their study and take the BA degree to find a good job in the future.

Jenan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her pay the university installments for her two sons for this semester. By taking this loan, Jenan and her husband will be able to pay the urgent expenses.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for her two sons for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the hospital expenses and medicines for her son.

loans.name: Bienvenidos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BIENVENIDOS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cecilia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesana en telares, venta de comida, tejido de mantas de vicuña, taller de costura, tienda de barrio, venta de chompas, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cecilia es integrante, ella indica que es el cuarto año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su yerna que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que estos negocios los emprendió hace once años cuando su hijo se casó ella tenía que ayudar a su yerna y ahí aprendió el negocio, con el pasar del tiempo y con un poco capital decide emprender su negocio independiente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las consultas médica y la atención que le ofrecen en la institución.

En la imagen esta presente una de las hijas de la socia, ella esta con una chompa negra.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Bienvenidos” will begin their third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana. It consists of eight members and has a board of directors, of which Cecilia is president. The businesses belonging to the members of the communal bank are varied, including: weaving textiles, selling food, knitting vicuña blankets, a sewing workshop, a neighbourhood store, selling jumpers, and selling vegetables.

The loan will benefit the small micro-businesses where Cecilia is a member. She says that this is the fourth year that she is a member of Pro Mujer, having joined at the invitation of her daughter-in-law, who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business which sells vegetables. She began doing this eleven years ago when her son married and she had to help her daughter-in-law in her business. After some time passed and she had a little capital, she decided to start her own business.

The loan is for an increase in capital (purchasing vegetables wholesale), which she will obtain from fairs in the city of El Alto and later sell in her stall. This work allows her to generate what income she can for her household, since she is single and has two children.

When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she liked the medical consultations and the assistance the institution offers to them.

One of the member’s daughters is in the picture and is wearing a black jumper.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Rostro De Dios Group

texts.es: Tres son las socias que conforman este grupo mujeres emprendedoras de éxito una de ella es Yorleni mujer de 28 años de edad, soltera su negocio es la venta de accesorios de celulares el cual lleva cinco años consecutivos inicio vendiendo recargas electrónicas de saldo aire para celulares ella misma comercializa sus productos en el mercado de su localidad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de accesorios como carcasas, cargadores universales, estuches, cartucheras etc. Paubla es una mujer que tiene 23 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y Lourdes tiene 30 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa.
texts.en: There are three members who make up this group of enterprising and successful women. One of them is Yorleni, a 28-year-old single woman. Her business is selling mobile phone accessories, which she has been doing for five years. She began by selling top-up vouchers for mobile phones.  She sells her products at a market in her area. She will invest the loan in purchasing accessories, such as hard cases, universal chargers, soft cases, and wallet-style cases. Paubla is a 23-year-old woman whose business is selling clothes, and Lourdes is 30 years old and also sells clothes.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories, such as protective cases, universal chargers, and other phone cases

loans.name: La Paz Centro Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro socios emprendedores de éxito una de ella es Anielca  tiene 37 años acompañada su negocio es la hecha y venta de nacatamal, tamal pisques desde hace 5 años, inicio su negocio vendiendo tortillas. El credito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como quintal de maíz, leña, cal, carne de cerdo, hojas de chagüites, mecate, especies, perecederos etc. su meta es mantener activo su negocio y  mejorar su vivienda. Martha tiene 47 años de edad y su negocio es la hecha y venta de tortilla y güirilas, Wilber tiene 31 años y su  negocio es de agricultor siembra maíz, hortalizas y Johana tiene 30 años y su negocio es la venta de tamales.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four business people.  One of the members in Anielca, 37 and married.  Her business is making and selling ‘nactamales’, snacks wrapped in banana leaves; and ‘tamal pisques’, tamales with a bean filling.  She started this business five years ago selling tortillas.

She will invest the money in buying raw materials such as a quintal of corn, firewood, lime powder, pork, banana leaves, cords for tying the snacks, spices and other perishable food.  Her goal is to carry on in this business and improve her home.

The other members of the group are Martha, who is 47; she sells tortillas and ‘güirilas’, thick corn pancakes.  Wilber, 31, who grows corn and vegetables and finally, Johana, 30, who sells tamales.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as a quintal of corn, firewood, lime powder, pork, banana leaves, cords, spices, perishable foods, etc.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a 36-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be God-fearing. She operates a retail shop where she sells maize flour, sugar, wheat flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are of all types. She says her biggest business challenge is price fluctuation. 

She will use the KES (Kenyan Shillings) 20,000 loan to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and soap. Her business goal is to have a supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will save and have a better life. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM (SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited). She will use the anticipated profits to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and soap.

loans.name: Carolina Asuncion

texts.es: Cliente exitosa es Carolina mujer de 22 años soltera su negocio es tener una  pulpería en su domicilio desde hace 12 años, negocio que su mama se lo heredo, de estar en la institución tiene un año, el credito lo  invertirá en la compra de productos de pulpería como jabón de lavar, jabón de baño, bidón de aceite, quintal de arroz, quintal de frijoles, quintal de azúcar, papel higiénico, tollas sanitarias etc. Ella misma atiende su negocio, sus metas es que su negocio llegue a convertirse en una miscelánea.
texts.en: Carolina, a successful single woman of 22 years of age, has had a grocery store at her house for 12 years.  She inherited the business from her mother.  She has been in the group for a year.  She will invest the loan in buying grocery products such as soap, shower gel, oil, quintals of rice, beans and sugar, toilet roll and sanitary towels.  She serves the customers herself and her goal is to develop her business into a fully grown convenience store.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store, such as soaps, oil, rice, frijoles beans, sugar, toilet roll, sanitary towels, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding her livestock.

loans.name: Las Pitayas Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras, una de ellas es Mayra mujer de 69 años de edad, viuda, su negocio es tener una mini pulpería, y destace de cerdo para la comercialización de la carne y sus derivados del cerdo, tiene de tener su negocio 5 años consecutivo e inicio haciendo y vendiendo nacatamales, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos de pulpería como papel higiénico, arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, carne de res, carne de pollo, medicamentos populares etc. Martha tiene 54 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y cosméticos, Mercedes tiene 35 años y su  negocio es la venta de ropa, carne de pollo, queso, huevos etc.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three businesswomen.  One of the members is Mayra, 69, who is a widow.  She has a small grocery store and a small abattoir for slaughtering pigs and selling pork and related products.  She has had this business for five years, which she started by selling ‘nactamales’ snacks.  She will invest the loan in products for her grocery store such as toilet roll, rice, sugar, oil, frijoles beans, pork, lamb, beef and chicken and common medicine.  

The other members are Martha, 54, who sells new clothes and cosmetics; and Mercedes, 35, who sells clothes, cuts of chicken, cheese and eggs.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as toilet roll, rice, sugar, oil, frijoles beans, meat and chicken, common medicine, etc.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en: Ola is 21 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her four siblings and her parents. She is a university student majoring in agriculture engineering in her second year. Ola is planning to find a job that suits her studies after she gets her bachelor's degree, and she is now seeking a loan to pay for her upcoming semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester's fees.

loans.name: 19 De Julio Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres miembros emprendedoras, una de ella es Aracely mujer de 36 años de edad, casada su negocio es tener una pulpería en su domicilio y una fábrica de zapatos desde hace 3 años, anteriormente inicio con su pulpería de las ganancias y préstamo que a hecho diversifico su actividad con la producción de calzado, este crédito lo  invertirá en materia prima como cuero, hilo, galletas, pega blanca, alistadores, montado etc. Angie tiene 30 años su negocio es la hecha y venta de nacatamales y Griselda tiene 33 años y su negocio es la venta de productos escolares.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising members. One of them is Aracely, a 36-year-old woman. She is married and her business is a grocery store which she runs in her home. In addition, she started making shoes three years ago. Before that, she only had the grocery store but with her earnings and with a loan she diversified her activities and started to make shoes. 

She will invest the current loan in the purchase of prime materials like leather, thread, brown leather, glue, lasts, a shoe mount, etc. 

Angie is 30 years old and makes and sells “nacatamales” (tamales wrapped in banana leaf) and Griselda is 33 years old and she sells school supplies.

loans.use: to buy prime materials like leather, thread, brown leather, white glue, lasts, a shoe mount, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seeds and seedlings for the family land

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Dalal is a forty-eight-year-old married woman from a small village near Jenin city. She is the mother of nine sons and five daughters. The family has a small farm where they all work. Dalal's husband works on a truck that transfers waste water from the houses in the city and disposes of it in areas far away from population, in order to preserve the environment. It is a hard job and takes a lot of his time. 

Dalal has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy a new tank for his truck to use in transferring waste water. By taking this loan, Dalal's husband work will be better and his income will grow.

loans.use: to help her husband to buy a new tank for his truck for transferring waste water.

loans.name: Aqeed

texts.en:
Aqeed is a forty-eight-year-old married man from Jenin city. He lives with his wife and five kids, two sons and three daughters, in a small and simple house.

Aqeed works on his land where he plants olive trees. It is a good business and earns a good income but is seasonal. Aqeed would like to improve his business. 

Aqeed has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more olive seedlings for his land. This will increase the crops and his income.

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for his land.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a married man man from a small village called Qabatia near Jenin City. He lives with his wife and seven kids, four sons and three daughters, in a small and simple house. Maher works on his land where he plants olive trees. It is a good business and earns a good income but it is also seasonal. Maher would like to improve his business. 

Maher has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy more olive seedlings for his land, to increase the crops and his income.

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for his land.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a twenty-three-year-old single man from a small village called Qabatia near Jenin City. He lives with his family in a small, simple house.

Mohammad works with his father on their land, where they plant wheat and barley. It is a good business and earns a good income. Mohammad would like to improve the business. 

Mohammad has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more wheat and barley seeds. This will increase the crops and his income.

loans.use: to buy more wheat and barley seeds for his land.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a forty-two-year-old married man from Jenin City. He is the father of four sons. Six years ago, Mohammad opened a small cafe in the city, where he sells soft drinks, coffee and tea. It is a good business and earns a good income but is not enough to cover family expenses.

Mohammad has taken a USD loan from FATEN, to help him buy more chairs and tables for his cafe. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to improve his cafe and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy more chairs and tables for his cafe

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a twenty-five-year-old single man from Gaza City. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. For the past year, Husam has been working in his store selling mobile phones and accessories. It is a good job and earns a good income. He would like to improve his store but he does not have enough money.

Husam has taken a USD loan from FATEN, to help him buy more products to resell in his store. By taking this loan, Husam will be able to increase sales and also his income.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell in his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products to resell in his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools for his construction work.

loans.name: Flor De Ortencia Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres miembros emprendedoras de éxito, una de ella es Gioconda mujer de 51 años de edad soltería y desde hace 11 años se decida a vender comida, inicio su negocio vendiendo enchiladas en su domicilio, ella misma atiende su negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como carne de res, carne de pollo, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, perecederos, plátanos verdes, plátanos maduro, carne de cerdo etc. Anielka tiene 39 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de  pan y repostería y María tiene 54 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising and successful members. One of them is Giaconda, a 51-year-old unmarried woman. 11 years ago she decided to sell food. She started her own business selling enchiladas in her home. She runs the business herself.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of supplies like beef, chicken, rice, sugar, beans, perishable goods, green bananas, ripe bananas, pork, etc.

Anielka is 39 years old and sells bread and pastries, and María is 54 years old and sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy supplies like beef, chicken, rice, sugar, beans, perishable goods, green bananas, ripe bananas, pork, etc.

loans.name: Ushuhuda Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Lubumba est une brave commerçante d’une expérience de 20 ans, secrétaire et membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Ushuhuda » âgée de 45 ans et mère de 9 enfants qui tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale ses marchandises sur la rue du  centre commercial de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle va acheter 10 sacs de farine de manioc et 5 sacs de braises. Elle démarra avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint, c’est un ajusteur soudeur expérimenté de la place. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et assurer les  mieux êtres de ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur donnant de microcrédit sans garantie matérielle et qui sont exclues du système bancaire classique, surtout, dans la période post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The customer, Lubumba, is a good and honest trader with 20 years' experience? She is a member and secretary of the Ushuhuda business association, and she is a 45-year old mother of nine children, all of whom are studying. She sells foodstuffs and displays her goods in the road of the town's commercial center. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She is going to buy ten sacks of cassava flour and five sacks of coal. She began her business with capital from her husband. He is an experienced metal worker and welder who works locally. She would like to increase her capital and also educate her children and ensure their well-being. She is grateful to Hekima for its support to female entrepreneurs, who do not have access to classic banks, by granting them microloans without any collateral, particularly during this post-conflcit period in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of cassava flour and five sacks of coal.

loans.name: Tabita Group

texts.fr: L a Cliente Milama est une brave commerçante, d’une expérience de 17 ans président et membre d’une Association d’Affaires «Tabita », senior entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 43 ans et mère de 6 enfants, qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de divers pièces de rechanges véhicules et sociétaire d’un magasin. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un magasin des périphéries  de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 4 paires d’amortisseurs, 2 paires de rotules 20 filtres a huile, 20 a gasoil, 4 jeux de segments moteur, 4 jeux de coussinets de bielle, 5 filtres a air, 5 segments de frein, etc.  Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari.  son conjoint est un pasteur dans une Eglise locale. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite  accroitre son capital et être grossiste, érige une cloture de sa parcelle, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie vivement Hekima pour son soutien aux hommes et femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment de  post conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The customer, Milama, is a good and honest trader with 17 years of experience. She is president and member of the Tabita busines association and is also an experienced and dynamic entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and mother to six children, all of whom are studying. She sells various car parts and is a member/shareholder of a store. She displays her goods in a store on the outskirts of the town. She is requesting a loan from Hekima so she can expand her business. She is going to buy four pairs of shock absorbers, two pairs of ball joints, 22 oil filters, 20 diesel filters, four sets of engine parts, four sets of bearing shells, five air filters, five brake shoes etc. She began her business with capital from her husband, who is a pastor in a local church. In the future she would like to increase her capital and become a wholesaler, build a fence round her land, and also educate, clothe and feed her children. She is extremely grateful to Hekima for the support it gives to male and female entrepreneurs, who cannot access banks, by granting them loans during this post-conflict period in the eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to buy four pairs of shock absorbers, two pairs of ball joints, 22 oil filters, 20 diesel filters, four sets of engine parts, four sets of bearing shells, five air filters, five brake shoes etc.

loans.name: Nshigikira Group

texts.fr:
Pascasie fait  partie du groupe Nshigikira, et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 48 ans et est mariée à Anas, un commerçant.Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 4 mois à 10 ans dont 2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de bananes depuis 3 ans.

Elle est à son troisième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Pascasie is part of the Nshigikira Group, and lives in Gitega.  She is forty-eight years old, and married to Anas, who is a trader.  Together they have five children who range in age from four months to ten years.  Two of their children currently attend school.

Pascasie has been selling bananas  for three years.  This will be her third loan from the field partner, Turame.  She will use her loan to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of bananas,  she will then resell the bananas and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for resale.

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LAFIA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de SIRIMOU, commune de SIRIMOU, 
préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de savon, d’habillement, de produits cosmétiques, et d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe LAFIA sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente SOURAKA la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite. Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenue sans succès, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiment depuis trois ans .Elle compte acheter avec son argent 20kg d’oignons, 20 paquets de jumbo et 10 kg de grains de néré chez les grossîtes à Fana. La vente s’effectue au marché journalier du village à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 11 000FCFA par mois, qui sera en partie réinjecté dans l’activité et le reste pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Lafia is a group that is made up of married women who are, on average, forty years old and have three children.  The women all live in traditional families in the village and commune of Sirimou, in the Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through family, friendship and neighbourhood ties.  The women sell foodstuffs, soap, clothing, cosmetic products and various other products.

This will be the fifth group loan for this group, and they will use their loans to buy the aforementioned products, for resale.

Souraka (standing second from the left in the photo) did not attend school.  After having unsuccessfully tried several commercial activities, she has been selling basic foodstuffs for three years.  She will use her loan to buy 20kg of onions, 20 packets of Jumbo stock cubes and 10kg of néré (African locust tree) beans.  She buys her merchandise from wholesalers in Fana, and sells it at the daily, village market, to a varied clientele.

Souraka expects to earn 11,000 francs CFA a month, she will use this to reinvest in her business and provide for the day-to-day expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr: Madame ARAME est une femme qui est mariée et mère de famille. Elle habite dans les environs du guichets et est sa 2ème prêt. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des tissus et articles de mercerie. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cette activité et prend en charges les indemnisations de ses employés et aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.Elle sollicite ce prêt d'un montant de 300.000F pour acheter des tissus et articles de merceries qu'elle revend à ses clients. A l'avenir elle voudrait avoir le monopole de la vente de tissus dans le marché de la commune.
texts.en:
Arame is a married woman with children.  She lives locally to the field partner, and this will be her second loan.  Arame sells fabric and haberdashery items, and has more than ten years' experience in this field.  She is responsible for paying her employees, and also helps her husband with the day-to-day expenses of their family.

Arame has requested this loan of 300,000 francs CFA, in order to buy fabric and haberdashery items for resale to her customers. 

In the future, she would like to become the only fabric retailer at the local market.

loans.use: to buy fabric and haberdashery items.

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LAFIA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de KONI, commune de KONI, 
préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de, condiment, de savon, d’habillement, de tasse, de charbon de bois, et du lait. Les femmes du groupe LAFIA sont à leurs sixièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énormes de la clientèle elles font recourt à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente FATOUMATA ZOUMANA, la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises n’a pas été à l’école. Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenue sans succès, elle est actuellement vendeuse de charbons de bois depuis quatre ans .Elle compte acheter avec son argent:15 sacs de charbons avec les paysans. La vente s’effectue à Fana à ses clients venus spécialement de Bamako. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice 10 000Fcfa par mois, qui sera en partie utiliser pour assurer les de scolarités des enfants.
texts.en:
The Lafia Group is made up of married women who are, on average, forty-two years old and have two children.  They all live in traditional families in the village and commune of Koni, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through family, friendship and neighbourhood ties.  The women sell foodstuffs, soap, clothing, containers, charcoal and milk.  

This will be the sixth group loan for the Lafia Group, who work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy the enormous demands of their customers.

Fatoumata Zoumana (sitting second from the left in the photo) did not have the opportunity to attend school.  After unsuccessfully trying several commercial activities, she has been selling charcoal for the last four years.  

She will use her loan to buy 15 sacks of charcoal from local farmers, and she will sell her product to customers in Fana and those that come to her from Bamako.

Fatoumata Zoumana expects to earn 10,000 francs CFA a month, and she will use part of this to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
About four years ago, Guillermo came to the US from his home country of Ecuador. Lacking the language skills to work as an accountant (his profession in Ecuador), Guillermo trained and worked as a truck driver.

For a short period, Guillermo moved back to Ecuador to be with his family. Last May, he moved back to New Jersey and returned with a mission: to start his own trucking business.

With just one truck and no employees, Guillermo is now the owner and operator of a trucking enterprise. His goal is to expand his business even further.

This loan will be used to pay off the balance on Guillermo’s truck and go towards the purchase of an additional vehicle.

loans.use: To pay off the truck's existing balance and to purchase another vehicle for small trucking enterprise.

loans.name: I Putu

texts.en:
I Putu, 25 years old, lives in Sari Kuning village, west Bali, with his wife and one child. I Putu spends 20,000 IDR per day for their daily needs.

He work as a mechanic at his own workshop. He repairs motorcycles and others machines such as tractors. His wife has a small kiosk beside his workshop.

I Putu requested a loan to purchase more supplies for his workshop (oils, tires, etc.) and also to purchase more snacks and other daily needs for his wife's kiosk. This is his first loan and he receives 7,000,000 IDR. 

He hopes he can enlarge his workshop, give the best service to his customers and earn more profit.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for his workshop and also to purchase more snacks and other daily needs for his wife's kiosk.

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en:
Mr. Batchuluun, 35 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He has been raising livestock for profit since 2011.  The main product they sell to locals is milk and almost 40 liters of milk is sold each day. 

The house his family lives in has been deteriorating over the years, so he is requesting a loan of 7000000 MNT to buy building materials such as shingles, planks, bricks and cements.  After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as shingles, planks, bricks and cements

loans.name: Ariunbold

texts.en:
Ariunbold, 43 years old, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been working as machinist at mining company for one year. At the same company, his wife has the position of doctor. She treats workers at the camp. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs urgent renovation. So he is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, planks and shingles. Using those materials, he will renovate his house, thus creating a warm and comfortable place for his family. The renovated house will greatly reduce the consumption of coal and, as a result, fewer pollutants will be released into the air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: José Ismael

texts.es:
José de 47 años de edad, es casado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen cuatro hijos y solo uno vive en casa y se dedica a trabajos de campo.

Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, el padre lo llevaba a trabajar al campo; actualmente vive en la ciudad con su hermana y él le ayuda en la venta de pupusas lo cual lo tiene en casa de 4 p.m a 7 p.m los fines de semana.

El préstamo lo necesita para surtir más la venta y comprar unas mesas y sillas. Su deseo, es que el negocio vaya creciendo para tener  mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
José, 47, is married and his wife is a homemaker.  They have four children, one of whom lives at home and earns a living in farming.

José has worked in agriculture his entire life.  His father used to take him to work in the fields.  Currently José lives in the city with his sister and helps her from 4 to 7 p.m. on the weekends in the pupusa business she has in her home.

He needs the loan to stock the business and to buy some tables and chairs.  He hopes the business will keep on growing and have better economic stability.

loans.use: to stock his business and to buy some tables and chairs

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en:
Bayasgalan, 47 years old, lives with her son in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. 

She has been selling casual clothes by renting a stall at an outdoor market since 2010. Her son studies at technical university and in four months he will graduate his university. 

Using her previous loan, she purchased clothes in large quantity to increase her inventory. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,100,000 MNT to buy more clothes in order to increase her inventory. As a result, she can continue to run her business without worrying about inventory shortage. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kerto Sato Group

texts.en:
After their last 6-month loan, the Kerto Sato group can run their pigs business well. The pigs grew healthy and fat. They gave them nutrious feed and vitamins. The group also earned a high price when they sold the pigs. Most of them were satisfied with the result. 

The Kerto Sato group decided to have a new loan. Still in the pig business, they will use the loan to develop the business and they hope can have enough savings in the end to use it for business capital.

One member, Ni Ketut, who sold her fattened pigs with the support of her husband, is determined to increase the business to support the incomes of her family.  Now,  Ni Ketut, who already has a sow, is using her loan to purchase 3 superior piglets for fattening. She plans to save all the profits and hopes all the pigs grow well. 

One member of the group couldn't attend the meeting because of illness and the group is responsible for recieving her loan.

loans.use: to purchase 3 superior piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the school fee in order to study nursing.

loans.name: Canaana Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kibwana est une brave commerçante et présidente d’une plateforme d’affaires «Canaana», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 50 ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants, qui tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse de la boisson. Elle installe sa marchandise dans une buvette à son domicile dans un Quartier animé, où, elle a su gagner sa clientèle. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un chauffeur de transport en commun (Taximan). Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 25 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 3 caisses Primus et 2 caisses de sucré coca cola. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre le capital, scolariser et nourrir  ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile des conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Kibwana is a courageous woman, she is a trader and the president of the business group 'Canaana'.  She is a dynamic, senior entrepreneur with the group, fifty years old, married and mother to ten children, who all attend school.  Kibwana sells drinks from a small stall in her busy local neighbourhood.  She has been very successful in building up a regular group of customers.

Kibwana started trading with capital that was provided by her husband, who is a taxi driver.  After some time, she began working with the field partner, Hekima.  She has now been trading for twenty-five years.

Kibwana will use her loan to buy three cases of Primus beer and two cases of Coca Cola.  She hopes that this will help increase her working capital, and allow her to feed and educate her children.

Kibwana is very grateful to Hekima for helping small entrepreneurs, who are excluded from the traditional banking system,  become independent.  This is particularly valuable during this time of conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 3 cases of Primus beer and 2 cases of Coca Cola for resale.

loans.name: Bunnat

texts.en:
Bunnat is a young, single man residing in Phnom Penh.  To meet his daily living expenses, he works in a bakery as the main source of income. He has been with this career for one year and it pays about 4 USD per day.  

Bunnat wants to pursue his bachelor's degree majoring in Information Technology.  However, the shortage of financial support to cover the tuition fee for his education is his main challenge, currently.  To overcome this obstacle, he is appling for an education loan as a first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  This loan will be used to cover his tuition fees. 

He hopes that he can get a good job which suits with his specialized skill after graduate

loans.use: To cover his tuition fee

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en: Yan is a rural resident of the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province. She is a 52-year-old mother of four children. Currently, only two children are still under her responsibility and they are too young for schooling. To fight against her family’s hardship, Yan and her husband do paddy rice farming as the main source of income and work for others for a fee during their spare time to supplement their income. The business that she has engaged in for ages has returned her about 36,700 KHR per day. Yan has never been with VisionFund (Kiva partner) before, neither has her co-borrower in the same group of two. Now, she and her joint borrower are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for land preparation for her paddy rice farming. She hopes to earn more income so she can maintain better living conditions for her family via her rice farming

loans.use: to pay for land preparation for her paddy rice farming

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana Patricia mayor de edad madre soltera, originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega ubicado en las zonas costeras del municipio, donde predomina el comercio, turismo, Ana es una microempresaria que se dedica a la compra y venta de mercadería en general como: ropa. zapatos, cosméticos, productos plásticos, al igual que posicles, choco bananos, paletas entre otros, sus compras las realiza al contado en otros departamentos del país y a comerciantes de la zona, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito el cual la mayor parte de su mercadería la mantiene en cuentas por cobrar,sus clientes son en centros de trabajos, escuelas entre otros, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para la compra de mercadería en general como: cuadernos, lapices, mochilas, al igual que productos de consumo como: azúcar, cocos, galletas, cocoa entre otros para la realización de sus deliciosos helados, Ana agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Ana Patricia is a single mother and comes from one of the coastal areas of the district of Chinandega, where the main activities are trade and tourism. Ana, as a small entrepreneur, buys and sells various items, such as clothes, shoes, cosmetics, plastic products, popsicles, chocolate bananas, and iced fruit popsicles. She buys the items cash in other parts of the country or from traders in her area, and sells both cash and on credit, with more customers opting for the latter. Her customers are workers and schoolchildren. She asks for a loan in order to buy merchandise to sell, such as notebooks, pencils, and backpacks, and to buy ingredients such as sugar, coconuts, biscuits, and cocoa in order to make delicous ice-cream. Ana is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they lend to people with low income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna is a villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a married mother blessed with three children. Presently, only two kids rely on her; one is in school and one is too young for schooling. To feed her family, she and her husband grow rice on two hectares of farmland as the main source of income and work as a paid worker to earn additional income. She has been with this business for ages and it has returned her around 30,000 KHR per day. Vanna is in her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has completely paid back her past two loans on time. Now, she is the team leader of two to get a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She is seeking 800,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for 1,400,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to pay her land preparation fee. She hopes to increase her family’s income and keep her kids in school.

loans.use: To pay her land preparation fee

loans.name: Jilma Guillermina

texts.es:
Jilma de 52 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos menores de edad, es originario de  Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera,  y desde muy joven tubo que trabajara para ayudar con los gastos de hogar.
Gracias a  su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, jugos, huevos, cuajadas gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Jilma agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua, para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Jilma, 52, is a single mother and has two children. She comes from León, which is located in the western region of the country. Jilma is a hardworking and responsible woman, who wants to get ahead in life and enjoys spending her free time with her children. Unfortunately, she could not study when she was young due to the lack of resources and she had to work instead to help with household expenses. Thanks to her abilities, her entrepreneurial mindset and will to progress, she opened a 'pulpería' in her house. A 'pulpería' is a small shop where one can find supplies in small quantities, such as rice, broad beans, sugar, milk, bread, cleaning supplies, juice, eggs, cottage cheese, and fizzy drinks. Jilma works twelve hours per day. With the loan, Jilma plans to invest in working capital and stock her business in order to increase her income in the short term. Jilma appreciates the help that Kiva lenders give people with few resources from poor countries like Nicaragua, which allows them to have a decent job.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Lesbia Maria

texts.es:
Lesbia de 61 años de edad, madre soltera con hijos mayores de edad, es originaria de Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente en su juventud no pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad sigue luchando para poder sobrevivir con todas los obstáculos  económicas que se le van presentado en el camino, para poder superarla día a día 
Gracias a su  esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, jabón, fósforos, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestible para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Lesbia, age 61, is a single mother with grown-up children.  She comes from Nagarote, a place located in the western part of the country.  She is known for being hardworking and responsible, with a desire to improve herself.  Unfortunately, as a child she wasn’t able to study due to a lack of financial resources.  These days she keeps fighting to be able to survive.  With many economic obstacles that come to block her path, she struggles to be able to overcome them day by day.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, she runs a small “pulpería”--a small store that sells groceries in small amounts, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, soap, matches, juice, and soda.  She works some twelve hours a day in her business, offering her products so that in the not-so-distant future she can earn a better income.  The goal of her loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling groceries so that in the not-so-distant future she can have a better income.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, soap, matches, juice, and soda.

loans.name: José Ferman

texts.es:
José de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato es casado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene una hija que vive con ellos.

El cliente es empleado en un comedor ubicado en la ciudad, el cual lleva 3 años trabajando y lo aprendió porque su esposa trabaja en el comedor, se traslada en bus durante unos 40 metros y su horario es de 7 de la mañana a 3 de la tarde.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para abrir un negocio de ventas de tortillas, comprara la plancha e insumos necesarios para la realización del rubro.

Espera que el negocio funcione de la mejor manera, para tener mejor estabilidad económica e invertir en la educación de su hija en el futuro.
texts.en:
José is 27 years old. He has finished high school and is married. His wife takes care of the household chores and they have a daughter who lives with them.

José works in a small restaurant located in the city. He has worked there for three years and he learnt this activity because his wife works in the restaurant, too. He goes there by bus which takes roughly 40 minutes and he works from 7 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon.

He is asking for a loan to be able to start his own business selling tortillas. He wants to buy a griddle and the supplies necessary to make tortillas.

He hopes that this business will work out well, so that he can increase his economic stability and invest in the education of his daughter in the future.

loans.use: to start a business selling tortillas: to buy a griddle and the necessary supplies to make tortillas.

loans.name: Timinandia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIMINANDIA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, commune de Guégnéka, 
préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréale, d’habillement, et de tubercule. Les femmes du groupe TIMINANDIA sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énormes de la clientèle, elles font recourt à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente AMI  la personne assise au milieu est analphabète. Elle est actuellement restauratrice depuis trois ans, chose qu’elle a hérité de sa tante. Elle compte acheter avec 2 sacs de riz ,20 litres d’huiles, un sac de farine de blé, 1 sac de sucre, et des condiments chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente s’effectue dans son mini restaurant sis à Fana, route de Dioïla à une clientèle mixte composée essentiellement des travailleurs de l’usine. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de77 500FCFAqui sera en partie réinjecté dans l’activité et le reste pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Timinandia group is made up of married women who average 46 years of age with six children each. They all live in traditional families in the town of Fana, in Guégnéka commune, which lies in the prefecture of Dioila in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region).

They got to know each other either as relatives, neighbors or friends and they practise restauration activities and trade in cereals, clothing and tubers. The women of the Timinandia group are on their tenth group loan. With a view to satisfying their huge customer demand, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

The customer, Ami, who is sitting in the middle of the photo, is illiterate. She has been exercising a restauration activity for the past three years, having inherited it from her aunt. With her money, she is planning to buy from wholesalers in Fana: two sacks of rice, 20 liters of oils, a sack of wheat flour, a sack of sugar and condiments. She sells her products in her mini-restaurant in Fana, on the road to Dioila, to a mixed customer base, made up mainly of factory workers. She expects to make a monthly profit of 77,500FCFA which will be partly reinvested into her business, with the rest being used to cover the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for restauration activity.

loans.name: Odelia Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Aurora mujer de 44 años de edad, acompañada, su negocio es la venta de comida como sopas los fines de semanas, frijoles cocidos, vigoron etc. desde hace un año, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como yuca, chicharrón, sal, frijoles crudos, ella misma atiende su negocio. Yessenia tiene 33 años su negocio es la hecha y venta de tortilla y fritanga los fines de semanas, Luisa tiene 28 años de edad su negocio es la mercadería en general como ropa de adulto, ropa de niño, cosméticos etc.
texts.en: This group is comprised of three women entrepreneurs. One of them is Aurora, who is 44 years old, and married. She has been selling food such as soup on week-ends, cooked broad beans, and traditional dish 'vigorón' for the past year. She runs her own business. She will use the loan to buy the ingredients she needs, such as yuca, pork rinds, salt, broad beans, etc. The other two members are Yessenia, 33, who sells tortillas and fried food, and Luisa, 28, who sells clothes for adults and children, cosmetics, etc.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 29 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de KONI, commune de KONI, 
préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiment, d’habillement, de savon, et de produits cosmétiques. Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leurs, sixième, prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énormes de la clientèle, elles font recourt à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente MAMOU  la personne au milieu dans le rang debout n’a pas été à l’école. Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenue sans succès, elle est actuellement vendeuse de tissus et pagnes depuis deux ans. Elle compte acheter avec son argent des pagnes wax chez les grossistes à Fana, et les revend sans transformation. La vente s’effectue au marché du village et chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 20 000Fcfa par mois qui seront en partie réinjecté dans l’activité et le reste pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group is made up of married women who average 29 years of age with five children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Koni, in Koni commune, which lies in the prefecture of Dioila in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region).

They got to know each other either as relatives, neighbors or friends and they practise restauration activities and trade in condiments, clothing, soaps and cosmetics. The women of the Sabougnouma group are on their sixth group loan. With a view to satisfying their huge customer demand, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

The customer, Mamou, who is standing in the middle of the photo, did not go to school. Having unsuccessfully attempted several income-generating activities, she has been selling fabrics and "pagnes" (brightly colored pieces of fabric) for the past two years. With her money, she is planning to buy highly decorative "pagnes wax" from wholesalers in Fana and sell them without any transformation. She sells her products in the village market and at home to a mixed customer base. She expects to make a monthly profit of 20,000FCFA which will be partly reinvested into her business, with the rest being used to cover the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes".

loans.name: Lucia Ramona

texts.es:
Lucia de 53 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria de  Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar, ya que la condiciones en la que Vivian no le permitía pagar sus estudios. En la actualidad ella lucha día a día para brindarle a su hijo las mejores condiciones de vida, que ella no pudo tener, y sus sueños más grandes es poder formar a su hijo en un profesional.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de distribución de gaseosas. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas  ocho horas diarias, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, porque ha sido su forma de vida y la de su familia. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Lucia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno
texts.en: Lucia is 53 years old, married, and has a son. She comes from Leon, a place located in the western part of the country. She is hard-working, responsible, and wants to do her best. Unfortunately, because her family had no money, she was not able to study. She fights hard every day to give her son the best possible life, the one she could not have. Her greatest dream is to see her son learn a profession. Thanks to her efforts and dedication, she is doing quite well selling fizzy drinks wholesale. She stores them at her house. She works eight hours a day without complaint, because her business supports her and her family. She will use the loan to increase her working capital and buy more stock so as to increase her income in the short term. Lucia thanks Kiva lenders for the help they grant to people with low income from poor countries such as Nicaragua, a help which enables them to earn a living with dignity.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and to buy more stock.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en: Sary is a 59-year-old mother of ten children and she is a resident of Battambang province. Now, two sons and two daughters still rely on her. To tackle her family’s difficult condition, she grows rice on four hectares are and grows sesame on two and half hectares of farmland. She has been engaged in this business for 17 years. This is the third loan for her and one of her co-borrowers, and the fourth loan for the remaining borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); all of them including Sary are in a group consisting of three borrowers. The positive impact of her past loan has helped her to improve her lifestyle better than before. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy sesame seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy sesame seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for her crop

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: Fatima del Rosario 53 años de edad casada con un hijo bajo su responsabilidad originaria del municipio de Chinandega, zona ubicada en el occidente del país, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos destazados, los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de deliciosos nacatamales, pepena, charrasca, frito, y diferentes cortes de cerdo, al igual que vende frutas y verduras los días de semana por medio de un carretón el cual sale desde muy temprano por las calles a ofrecer sus productos, Fatima es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora con muchos deseos de superación personal, ha logrado mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia, su jornada diaria empieza desde muy temprano a recorrer por los alrededores de varias comarcas de este municipio donde ofrece sus deliciosas frutas y verduras. el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de cerdos en pie para la realización de sus deliciosos nacatamales, frito, pepena, charrasca, y sus riquísimas frutas. Fatima agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Fatima del Rosario is 53, married, and has a dependant child. She comes from the district of Chinandega, located in the west of the country. She is a small entrepreneur who buys and sells pigs. On weekends, she sells various traditional dishes, fried food, and pork. During the week, she sells fruits and vegetables as a street vendor. She leaves home very early to make her rounds. Fatima is full of enterprising spirit and never gives up. She wants to do her best and this has enabled her to improve her standard of living as well as her family's. Her typical day as a street vendor starts very early and takes her through all the neighbouring villages, where she sells her produce. She will use the loan to increase her working capital and buy pigs in order to make delicious dishes later on. She will also buy fruits and vegetables to sell. Fatima is very grateful to Kiva lenders and thanks them for helping people who live with a low income.

loans.use: to buy pigs, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Enkhtur

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhtur, 42 years old, lives with his wife and son in Darkhan, second largest city in Mongolia. He has been working as a serviceman at a power plant since 2007. His wife has position of auditor at a social insurance department. Their son goes to high school. 

Enkhtur is requesting a loan of MNT 2,000,000 to buy a television and closet. As a result, his family will watch TV programs comfortably after coming home from work.

loans.use: to buy a television and closet.

loans.name: Marcia Mercedes

texts.es:
Marcia de 45 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo menor de edad, el cual está estudiando y  bajo su responsabilidad total. Es originaria de  Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Nagarote se caracteriza por su comida típica como el “quesillos”. Esta joven  mujer en lamentablemente no pudo estudiar sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos, en la actualidad lucha día  a día para brindarles a su hijos mejores condiciones de vida, y cumplir su sueño como es formarlo en un profesional.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosmetics como perfumes,lapiz labial, rubor, crema hidratantes, crema antiarrugas, lapiz de labios, lapiz de ojos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cosmeticos  y aprovechar la temporada que se acerca de semana santa y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Marcia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Marcia, 45, is the single mother of a minor child who attends school and is her complete responsibility.  She's from Nagarote, located in the western part of the country and known for it traditional dishes, such as quesillo, a soft cheese.  Unfortunately, this young woman wasn't able to go to school because she lacked the financial resources.  Currently she strives every day to give her child better living conditions and realize her dream that he become a professional.

Thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead, Marcia works selling cosmetics such as perfume, lip pencil, rouge, hydrating lotion, anti-wrinkle cream, lipstick, and eyeliner.  She spends about 10 hours a day selling her products.

The goal of Marcia's loan is to stock her cosmetics business and make the most of the coming Holy Week season so she can earn more income in the near future.

Marcia's grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they have the means to a decent job.

loans.use: to buy rouge, lip pencil, eyeliner, anti-wrinkle cream, make-up remover, and perfume

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
Sina is a resident from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married and blessed with two daughters, one of whom is in school, while the remaining one is too young for attending school. To provide sufficient food for her family, she and her husband grow rainy season rice on 5 hectares of farmland, and she supplements her income via running a small business. She has been with this business for seven years. 

This is the second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for her. The past loan, which she has repaid back completely, enabled her to keep improving her lifestyle better than before. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan from VisionFund again. Sina, who is the group leader, will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the land-smoothing fee. She hopes that she can prepare her farmland timely to be ready for the replanting season. She hopes her rice will gain a good crop yield for her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for the land-smoothing fee

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda, 45, is originally from Battambang province and is also a mother of five children. Nowadays, she needs to support only three kids who are still in school. The main sources of her family’s income are from her occupation as a school teacher and her businesses of rice cropping and chicken raising. Those are the businesses that she has had for ages. 

Chenda is a new borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She decided to take the first loan in order to cover the tuition fee for her son, who is pursing a bachelor degree, majoring in medical science. Additionally, she will spend some portion of her loan to buy school materials for her son. She hopes that this financial support will fulfill her son's dream of getting a job in the medical field.

loans.use: To cover the tuition fee and school materials for her son

loans.name: Ratna Sari Group

texts.en:
The Ratna Sari Group successfully paid off all the loan and, after a number of loans, six of the members resigned because they have enough capital to run their businesses by themselves. They are really grateful and thankful to Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK), Kiva, and the lenders for supporting their businesses. Now, they can be an example to other members to run their businesses.

Ni Putu, a common housewife, runs a pig business to improve the income of her family. With the last loan, she purchased two superior piglets and successfully sold them to the big buyers. With the profit she earned, she can support her husband's income to fulfill the daily needs and save for their future.

With only nine members left, the Ratna Sari Group continues to borrow loans to increase their businesses. They were motivated by their friends that already succeeded to run their businesses by themselves.

Ni Putu will use her loan to purchase piglets and feed. With motivation from her friend, she manages the business better than before and hopes for a satisfactory profit. Ni Putu's goal is to have enough capital to run the business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEGNA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de TIENCELA commune de BENKO préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de condiments, et de savon. Les femmes du groupe BADEGNA sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énormes de la clientèle elles font recourt a SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente MAH la personne au milieu dans le rang debout n’a pas été à l’école. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de savon. Elle compte acheter 130 pièce de savons chez les grossistes à Fana La vente se fait en détaille chez elle à clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 9.500Cfa. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour assurer les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
