Badegna is a group made up of married women, who are on average 37 years old with four children. They all live in traditional families in Tiencela in Benko commune, in the Dioila prefecture, which is in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali)
They came to know each other through ties of family, neighbourhood and friendship. They work in catering and sell cereals, condiments and soap. This is the third loan for the women of the Badenga group. Hoping to satisfy the huge demands of their clientele, they have recourse to Soro Yiriwaso.
Mah, who is standing in the middle of the row did not go to school. At present, she sells soap. She hopes to buy 130 bars of soap from the wholesalers in Fana. She sells the soap retail from her home to a mixed clientele. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 9.500Cfa. She will use this to cover her family's living costs.

loans.use: to buy bars of soap.

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
Thea is 50 years old and a citizen from Mongkol Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is a widowed mother of six children. Currently, only four of them are relying on her, one of whom is still in school. To sustain her family’s income, she grows rice on a 2.5-hectare area and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. After ages involved in the current business, she is able to earn up to 35,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

Thea has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past five loan cycles with successful repayment, and it has enabled her to timely support her lifestyle and improve her lifestyle better than before. She is forming a group of four to get a new loan. The total amount of her entire loan request is 4,400,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for reaping and plowing her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her cash-crop so that she is able to expand her farmland and improve her living via income from her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for reaping and plowing her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADENYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de DJAMBOUGOU, commune de MARKA COUNGO, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de céréale, de savon et du lait. Les femmes du groupe BADENYA sont à leurs quatrièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recourt à SORO YIRIWASO. Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente ATOUMATA  la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout est analphabète Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenue sans succès, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiment depuis deux ans. Elle compte acheter avec son argent 30 kg d’arachides, 20 kg d’oignon séché, 6 paquets de jumbo à MARKA COUNGO. La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte au marché du village et chez elle. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 16 000Fcfa qui seront en partie réinjecté dans l’activité et le reste pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Badenya group is made up of married women who are on average 37 years old with three children. They all live in traditional families in Djambougou village in the Marka Coungo commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali)
They met through their families, friends and living in the same neighbourhood. They sell condiments, cereals, soap and milk. This is their fourth solidarity loan. Hoping to satisfy the great demand of their customers, they collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They will use the loans to buy the aforementioned merchandise.
Atoumata, who is second from the right in the row of people standing, is illiterate. Having tried various money-making activities without success, at present she sells condiments. She has been doing this for two years. With her loan she plans to buy 30 kilograms of groundnuts, 20 kilograms of dried onions, and six packets of gumbo from the market at Marka Coungo. She sells her merchandise to a mixed clientele at the village market or from home. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 16 000Fcfa. She will reinvest some in her business and she will use the remainder to cover the daily family expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEGNA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de GONIDO, Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe BADEGNA sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recourt à SORO YIRIWASO. Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FATOUMATA  la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenue sans succès, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’article divers. Elle compte acheter avec son argent, des boucles d’oreilles, des colliers, et des bagues chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait chez elle à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 18 000Fcfa par mois, qui seront réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Badegna group is composed of married women averaging 38 years of age, with four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Gonido, Fanada, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell condiments amd miscellaneous items. The members of the Badegna group are on their sixth solidarity loan. With the goal of meeting the huge customer demand, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso. The loans will be used to buy merchandise as mentioned above.

Our client Fatoumata, the first person standing from the right in the photo, did not receive an education. After trying several lines of business without success, she started selling miscellaneous items. She plans to use her cash to buy earrings, necklaces and rings from wholesalers in Bamako. She sells out of her home, mainly to female customers. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 18,000 Western Union francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous articles.

loans.name: Dulce Amistad Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxitos una de ella es Sulma tiene 25 años de edad, es acompañada, tiene desde hace 5 años de hacer y vender nacatamales, enchiladas y productos varios de pulperías ella misma atiende su negocio, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos varios de pulpería como jabones de lavar ropa, jabón de baño, ace, cloro, arroz, huevo, sopa maggi, salsa de tomate etc. Manuela es otra socia emprendedoras su negocio es la venta de repostería, tiene 25 años, Ericka tiene 33 años de edad y  su negocio es la venta de verduras.
texts.en: This group is made up of three members seeking success.  One of them is Sulma; she is 25 years old and she is in a relationship.  For five years she has had a business making and selling nacatamales, enchiladas, and various grocery products.  She runs her business herself.  She will invest this loan in grocery products, such as laundry soap, bath soap, detergent, bleach, rice, eggs, Maggi-brand soup, tomato sauce, etc.  Manuela is another enterprising member; her business is selling pastries and she is 25 years old.  Ericka is 33 years old and her business is selling vegetables.

loans.use: to buy various grocery products, such as laundry soap, bath soap, detergent, bleach, eggs, Maggi-brand soup, tomato soup, etc.

loans.name: Cielo Azul Group

texts.es: Grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores de éxitos una de ellas es Yokasta mujer empresaria de 20 años, soltera, su negocio es la venta de zapatos, desde hace 3 años, de ser cliente de la institución desde hace 2 años, ella inicia su negocio vendiendo bolsos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de zapatos escolares de dama y de varon  por la temporadas escolar, Humberto tiene 33 años y su negocio es la venta de mercadería en general, Carla tiene 31 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de miel mesada.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising and successful members. One of them is Yokasta, an enterprising 20-year-old unmarried woman. 

Yokasta has sold shoes for three years and has been a client of this institution for 2 years. She started her business selling handbags. She will invest the credit in the purchase of school shoes for girls and boys for the start of the next school year.

Humberto is 33 years old and he sells general merchandise. Carla is 31 years old and she sells “miel me sabe” (a Nicaraguan dessert made of milk and unrefined cane sugar).

loans.use: to buy school shoes for girls and boys for the next school year.

loans.name: Darling Elicia

texts.es: Darling Elicia, mayor de edad casada con tres hijos menores de edad aun bajo su responsabilidad originaria del municipio de Chinandega zona donde se comercializa el comercio, turismo, Darling es una microempresaria que se dedica a la compra y venta de mercadería en general como: ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, productos plásticos, muebles de madera, artesanías y platería, el cual distribuye de forma ambulante recorriendo varios sectores de este municipios y sus comarcar aledañas, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honrada y responsable en sus responsabilidades a cumplir realiza sus compras en otros municipios del país, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito los cuales recupera semanal y quincenal, el objetivo de este crédito es para reforzar su capital de trabajo en la compra de mercadería en general como: juguetes de madera, variedades estilos de ropa, hamacas, sillas perezosas, cosméticos entre otros  y de esa manera lograr cubrir varios pedidos que tiene de sus clientes. Darling agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Darling Elicia is a married woman with three young children who are still her dependents.  She is from the municipality of Chinandega, which is a commercial and touristic area.  Darling is a small businesswoman who buys and sells general merchandise, such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, plastic products, wood furniture, craftwork, and silver, which she sells on foot, covering several areas in her municipality and its surrounding neighborhoods.  She is known for being a hardworking, honest, and responsible woman regarding her obligations.  She does her buying in other municipalities in the country; she does her sales in cash and credit, which she collects weekly and biweekly.  Her goal for this loan is to supplement her working capital to buy general merchandise, such as wooden toys, different styles of clothing, hammocks, recliners, and cosmetics, among other things, to fill several orders from her customers.  Darling is very thankful for the help Kiva's lenders offer to people with few financial resources.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as different styles of clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and typical Nicaraguan products

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: María Leticia es una empresaria de éxito, tiene 46 años de edad, casada, desde hace 10 años vende comida y pan, es casada  y tiene dos hijos a su cargo, inicio vendiendo pan, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra en materia prima como harina,  levadura, leña, manteca, mantequilla, etc.
texts.en: María Leticia is a successful businesswoman.  She is 46 years old, married, she has been selling prepared food and bread for 10 years, and she has two children she cares for.  She started out selling bread.  She will invest this loan in raw material, such as flour, yeast, firewood, lard, butter, etc.

loans.use: to buy raw material, such as flour, yeast, firewood, lard, butter, etc.

loans.name: Jonathan Joel

texts.es:
Jonathan de 21 años de edad, soltero con un hijo menor de edad, es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles, en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, huevos, fósforos, aceite. El dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias, ofreciendo sus productos. el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Jonathan agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jonathan is 21 years old.  He is single and has a young son.  He is a native of Leon, a place located in the western part of the country.  He is known to be hardworking and responsible, with a desire for self-improvement.  Unfortunately, he was not able to attend college due to a lack of financial resources, and had to work from an early age.  

Currently, he fights day-to-day to provide a better future for his son.  Thanks to his efforts and his desire to get ahead, he has a small general store where he sells food products in small quantities such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, eggs, matches, and oil.  He spends about 12 hours a day working in his store and selling his products.  

The goal for this loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business of buying and selling edible products, so that in the near-future, he can improve his income.  Jonathan is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders have given people of few means in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have dignified jobs.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock his retail business with food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, eggs, matches and oil.

loans.name: G.s Bendicion De Dios Group

texts.es:
El g.s. Bendición de Dios está conformado por tres integrantes dos mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres de familia con ocho hijos menores bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos son originarios de Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Nagarote se caracteriza por su comida como el “quesillo”  elaborado a base de tortillas de maíz y queso de crema, cebolla picada. Estas personas de caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Veronica y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, azúcar,  pan, leche, cuajada, frijoles, detergente, jabón, aceite. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  El g.s Bendición de Dios agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Bendición de Dios" lending group is made up of three members, two women and a man.  They are mothers and fathers with a combined eight children under their care.  They are natives of Nagarote, a place that is located in the western region of the country.  Nagarote is known for its food, like "quesillo", a dish with a base of corn tortillas topped with cream cheese and diced onions.  Nagarote's people are known for being hardworking and responsible, with a desire for self-improvement.  They fight day-to-day to provide their children with better futures.  

Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, the coordinator, Veronica, has a small general store where she sells food products in small quantities such as: rice, sugar, bread, milk, curd, beans, detergent, soap and oil.  She works about 12 hours a day selling her products.

The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her store so that in the near-future, she can improve her earnings.  The "Bendición de Dios" lending group is thankful for the help that the Kiva lenders have given people of few means in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they may have a dignified source of income.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock their business of buying and selling edible products such as: rice, sugar, bread, milk, curd, beans, detergent, soap, and oil.

loans.name: Romduol's Group

texts.en:
Romduol is a resident of Bantey Meanchey province. She is 22 years old and a young mother of two daughters. Both of her children are still under her care. 

To feed her entire family, Romduol sells desserts and she works as a paid worker as the main sources of income. Romduol is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past six loans wisely and they enabled her to uplift her lifestyle as well as to support her business on-time. 

For this cycle, Romduol teams up in a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy ingredients for making desserts to sell. She hopes that she can gain a good income from her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making desserts to sell.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Mariluz Del Rosario

texts.es:
Mariluz de 29 años de edad, madre soltera con tres hijos menores de edad dos de ellos están es la escuela primaria.  Es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Esta joven mujer se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar sus estudios. Y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad. En la actualidad lucha día a día  para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica un quiosko donde vende productos comestibles como jugos, gaseosas, repostería, frescos naturales, meneítos, dulces, jugos, papel higiénico, jabón de baño, ella está ubicada frente a un hospital de la localidad. Y es un punto muy estratégico para su venta. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce  horas diarias desde las siete de la mañana hasta las siete de la noche, con su hija pequeña todo el día con ella. Ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de productos comestible, para que en un futuro no  muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Mariluz agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mariluz is 29 years old; she is a single mother with three young children, two of whom are in primary school.  She is from Leon, a place located in the western region of the country.  This young woman is known for being hardworking, responsible, and driven to better herself.  Unfortunately, she was not able to go to school because of a lack of financial resources and she had to start working at a young age.  She currently struggles day after day to offer her children a better future.  

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, she has a kiosk business where she sells food products, such as juices, soda water, pastries, natural sodas, shakes, candies, juices, toilet paper,  and bath soap.  She is located in front of a local hospital and it is a very strategic location for sales.  She spends around 12 hours a day at her business, from seven in the morning until seven at night, with her young daughter spending the whole day with her as she sells her products.  Her goal for this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business by purchasing food products so that in the near future she will make more profits.  Mariluz is thankful for the help Kiva's lenders offer to people with few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can do honest work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her kiosk with products such as juices, soda water, pastries, natural sodas, shakes, candies, juices, toilet paper, and bath soap.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de KONI, commune de KONI, 
préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiment, de céréale, et du lait. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leurs septièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énormes de la clientèle, elles font recourt à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente DJENEBA la troisième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout est analphabète. Elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter avec son argent: 25kg de riz ,8 litres d’huiles, 10 kg, d’oignons et des condiments chez les grossistes à Fana. La vente s’effectue dans son petit restaurant sis à Koni à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 19 000Fcfa par mois. Ce bénéfice est en partie réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of married women who are on average 46 years old with six children. They all live in traditional families in Koni village, Koni commune, in the Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They came to know each other through family, friendship and neighbourhood ties. They work in catering, and the condiments, cereals and milk trade. This is their seventh solidarity loan. Hoping to satisfy the great demand of their customers, they have joined Soro Yiriwaso.
Djeneba is the third person from the right standing, and she is illiterate. At present, she runs a cafeteria. With her money she plans to buy 25 kilograms of rice, eight litres of oil, 10 kilograms of onions, and some condiments from the wholesalers in Fana. She sells her food in a small restaurant in Koni to a mixed clientele. She hopes to make a profit of 19 000Fcfa per month. She will reinvest some of this money in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for catering.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana de 61 años de edad, casada con tres nietos  menores de edad bajo su responsabilidad. Es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no curso sus estudios. En la actualidad sigue luchando para sacar adelante a sus pequeños nietos, ya que depende de ella. 
Gracias a  su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica el servicio de costura en su casa de habitación, que consiste en elaborar prendas de vestir como faldas, vestidos, pantalones, short. Ropa de cama. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de prenda de vestir como retazos, telas, hilos, agujas, carrete, botones, zíper. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Juana agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juana is 61 years old.  She is married and has three young grandchildren that she is responsible for.  She is a native of Leon, a place that is located in the western region of the country.  She is known for being hardworking and responsible with a desire for self-improvement.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, she was not able to attend school.  She fights day-to-day to get her young grandchildren ahead since they depend on her.

Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, she has a sewing business in her home where she makes clothing like skirts, dresses, pants, shorts, and bedding.  She spends about eight hours a day working in her business.

The goal of this loan is to invest in the purchase of raw material to make clothing such as: patches, fabrics, thread, needles, spools, buttons, and zippers, so that in the near-future, she can improve her earnings.  Juana is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders have given to people of few means in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a dignified job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to purchase raw material to make clothing such as: patches, fabrics, thread, needles, spools, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Cliente exitosa es Sonia mujer emprendedora, exitosa, tiene 23 años, casada, con un hijo menor, tiene en su domicilio una pulpería desde hace 7 años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos de pulpería como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite por bidón, sopas maggi, gaseosas variadas, café toro, papel higiénico, jabón de baño, jabón para lavar ropa etc.
texts.en: The successful client is Sonia.  She is an enterprising and successful 23-year-old.  She is married and has a young son.  In her home, she has had a small grocery store for the past seven years.  She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of grocery store items such as: rice, beans, sugar, drums of oil, Maggi soups, sodas, Toro coffee, toilet paper, bathroom soap, laundry detergent, etc...

loans.use: purchase grocery store items like: rice, beans, sugar, drums of oil, Maggi soups, sodas, Toro coffee, toilet paper, bathroom soap, laundry detergent, etc...

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Maria Jose mayor de edad acompañada con tres hijos mayores de edad originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país, maría Jose se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honrada, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es propietaria de una mini-librería donde ofrece artículos como: cuadernos, lapices, borradores, resmas de papel bonds, folderes, carpetas, papelillos, mochilas, pegas, borradores, lapices de colores, bolsos, cartulinas entre otros, sus compras las realiza al contado en otros departamento del país, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales. el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo en la adquisición de artículos escolares como: mochilas, lapices, cuadernos, colores, reglas, estuches geométricos entre otros. Maria agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Maria Jose is in a relationship with three grown children.  She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, which is an area in the western part of the country.  Maria Jose is known for being a hardworking, honest, responsible woman with a great drive to better herself.  She is the owner of a mini stationery shop where she sells items such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, reams of paper, bonds, folders, file folders, loose paper, backpacks, glue, erasers, color pencils, bags, and poster board, among other things.  She does her buying in cash in other areas of the country.  She has steady and occasional customers.  Her goal for this loan is to use it as working capital to get school items, such as backpacks, pencils, notebooks, color pencils, rulers, and pencil cases, among others.  Maria is very thankful for the help Kiva's lenders offer to people with few financial resources.

loans.use: to buy school items, such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, and backpacks, among others

loans.name: Ingris Tatiana

texts.es: Ingris es una mujer empresaria, de 22 años de edad, soltera con un hijo menor de edad, su negocio es la compra y venta de cosechas de tamarindo, mangos, papaya, naranjas etc. esta actividad la viene realizando desde 3 años. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosechas de tamarindo que está en temporada alta.
texts.en: Ingris is a 22-year-old businesswoman.  She is single and has a young son.  Her business is buying and selling tamarind, mango, papaya, orange, and other crops.  She has worked in this industry for the past three years.  This loan with be used to purchase tamarind crops as they are currently in season.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of tamarind, mango, papaya, orange, and other crops.

loans.name: Trokuon's Group

texts.en:
Trokuon, 51, is a villager from Mongkol Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is married and blessed with three children, one of whom is studying in a local university.  She strives to earn the daily cost of living via rice farming on five hectares' area. To earn more income, she spends her spare time working for others for a fee. She has been with this business for 31 years and she can earn about ten dollars per day to support her family. 

Trokuon has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past three loans with successful repayment. It has helped her  to improve her lifestyle. This is the fourth loan for Trokuon and she is leading her group of two to ask for a new loan. She is requesting 1,000,000 KHR and her co-borrower is applying for 1,100,000 KHR. Trokuon will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the leasing fee of a rice-harvesting machine. She hopes to increase her income to enable her to buy a motorbike for her household.

loans.use: To pay for the leasing fee of a rice-harvesting machine

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sari Indah Group

texts.en:
Six months ago, the Sari Indah  group planned to use their loans for farming and raising pigs. With persistence, they run both businesses well. The husbands farm and the wives raise the pigs.  They got satisfactory results due to the good weather and proper care.


Ni Ayu managed to sell the pigs at a satisfactory price. She can fulfill her dream to improve her kitchen. Ni Ayu thanks for the help she received. She and Sari Indah group plan to continue the loans to improve their businesses.

Ni Ayu and group members of Sari Indah want to increase the number of pigs and their quality. The group helps to make coordination, training and loan repayment easier.

Ni Ayu will  use the loan to buy piglets to raise. She’s very happy because the group helps to get business capital. She is hoping to get the maximum results in order to save money and have her own capital to continue to raise pigs.
 
Ni Ayu is shown in the front line, first from the left.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en:
Phoeurn is a citizen of Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province. She is 46 years old and has six children. Currently, only two children count on her; one is in school and the remaining one is working in a factory. To feed her family, she raises cows as her main source of income. Her husband also helps to earn more income via working at a construction site.

This is the second loan for Phoeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She fully repaid her past loan with success and it helped her to improve her lifestyle. For this cycle, she is taking out a new loan in order to buy a decent motorbike for commuting. She hopes that she can reduce relevant transportation costs so that she can use that money to support her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike for commuting

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her five children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family and runs his own scrap business. One of her sons has operated a mobile phone shop for the past 3 years. 

Fareeda's son wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for business purposes, but due to insufficient finances, he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore Fareeda has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she'll enable her son to purchase relevant items for his business and earn more profitable income to manage his business and house hold needs.

Fareeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy mobile accessories  for her son's business.

loans.name: Gladys Esperanza

texts.es:
Gladys de 51 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad, el cual está estudiando en la universidad. Es  originaria  Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal.  En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su familia. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor  a su hijo. Y cumplir su sueño como es verlo formado en un profesional.
Gracias a sus ganas de Salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosmeticos como rubor, sombra de ojos, lapiz de labios, delineador, marbellines, perfumes, crema de cuerpo, body. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su mercadería. El negocio lo desempeña de forma ambulante y por encargo, ella todos los días recorre las calles con un peso de unos  20 kg todos los días. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, porque ha sido su forma de vida y la de su familia. Gladys agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es  Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Gladys is 51 years old. She is married with a young son who is studying at University. She is originally from Leon, a place that is located in the eastern zone of the country. She is characterized by being hardworking, responsible, and her desire for self improvement. In her free moments she likes to enjoy the company of her family. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources, she was not able to pursue a career. She currently struggles day to day to provide her son a better future and to fulfill her dream of seeing him become a professional.
Thanks to her desire to move forward in life, she sells cosmetics for a living such as blush, eyeshadow, lipstick, eyeliner, nail polish, perfumes, and body lotion. She works at this business some ten hours a day, offering her merchandise. She conducts her business as a street vendor and by request. Every day she walk the streets with the weight of 20 kilograms. She likes her job because it has been her way of life and that of her family. Gladys appreciates the help that the Kiva investors provide to people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua for having a means of decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business in the purchase and sale of cosmetics like blush, eye shadow, lipstick, eyeliner, moisturizing cream, and perfume.

loans.name: I Nengah

texts.en:
As head of the family, I Nengah is responsible for fulfilling his family's needs. Daily, I Nengah works as a truck driver. He transports sand or cement from one city to other. He lives with his wife and school-age children. I Nengah has a side job as a brick maker. After he finishes transporting materials with his truck, he makes bricks with his wife at home. He makes bricks the traditional way and that’s why they only produce little bricks.
I Nengah needs a loan to purchase a brick machine and materials such as cement and sand. The machine can produce lots of bricks everyday and fast. He hopes he can service his customers to fullfill their orders on time with any amount of bricks they need.

loans.use: to purchase a brick machine and materials such as cement and sand

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is a hard-working mother who is engages in buying and selling fruits and vegetables within her community. She is 58 years old and has five adult-aged children. Due to financial difficulty, she aims to continue and improve the business in order to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

location.town: Brgy.San Antonio South, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Phalla is 41 years old and a resident of Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She is also a mother of three kids. Currently, only her son relies on her and he is in school. The main sources of her income are from rice farming and her husband's occupation as a construction worker. Engaged in her current business for 23 years, she is able to earn around 25,000 KHR per day.

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is leading a group of three who are in their first loan cycle to get a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. She will use her loan portion to pay for her plowing fee. She hopes to grow her crop in a timely manner with good income in return.

loans.use: To pay for her plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 30 years old and has two children, ages 1 and 8. He describes himself as creative. He operates a business where he transports customers using his bicycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for his bicycle. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his bicycle

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 61-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 10 years to 25 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a café where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are regular customers. 

Florence describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of wheat flour, cooking oil and other ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a big hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a five-star hotel. She will use the anticipated profits to open a new business. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 80,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, cooking oil and other ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and other ingredients for preparing food to sell.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara is a 41-year-old married woman with four children whose ages range from 3 years to 15 years. She describes herself as determined to work. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are reliable. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fish price fluctuations. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more fish for resale. She hopes that in the future, she will own a hotel. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Sambo is a widowed mother and has two children. She is 48 years old and lives in the small home with her youngest child in a village of Kanhchriech district, Prey Veng, while her older son works abroad as a paid laborer. Sambo has been a farmer for more than 25 years, primarily growing rice to sell. She receives support from her child to accomplish these activities each year.

Sambo has never been with local state banks for any loans before. She would like to acquire a loan which will be used to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members as she has not had a proper one before. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by HKL, Sambo is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family.

loans.name: Chanzo

texts.en: Chanzo is a 38-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be God fearing and committed. She operates a retail business where she sells maize flour, soap, wheat flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a highly populated and secure place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more maize flour, soap, sugar, wheat flour and other items. Her business goal is to have a supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will save for a better life. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour, soap, sugar, wheat flour and other items

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de TIENCELA commune de BENKO préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiment, et d’habillement. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énormes de la clientèle elles font recourt a SORO YIRIWASO, Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées. 
La cliente BAH  la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout n’a pas été à l’école. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments, chose qu’elle a hérite de sa mère. Elle compte acheter 30 kg de sel, 1 panier de tomate, et 1 sac d’arachide non décortique à Fana. La vente se fait en détail chez elle à clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 18 000Fcfa. Ce bénéfice sera en partie injecté dans l’élevage de petits animaux.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of married women who average 39 years of age and three children each. They live in traditional families in Tiencela, a village in the commune of Benko, prefecture of Dioïla (Koulikoro region, 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another as neighbors and friends, and through ties of kinship. They sell condiments and clothing, and they provide restaurant services. 
To meet their massive customer demand, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, and this is their 3rd group loan cycle. The funds will be used to stock up on merchandise to sell. 

Bah, standing first from the right, never went to school. She is currently a reseller of condiments, a trade learned from her mother. She plans to use her loan to buy 30 kg of salt, one basket of tomatoes, and one sack of unshelled groundnuts in Fana. She retails her stock from her home to a diverse clientele. 

Bah expects to earn a monthly profit of 18,000 FCFA. She plans to use part of this profit to start raising small livestock.

loans.use: to stock up on condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 31 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with one child. 

For their means of living, Esterlita is engaged in a sari-sari store, retailing, and a barbecue-vending business. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Esterlita has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail, and meats for her barbecue business, as well. 

Esterlita has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for three years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail, and meats for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Xiomara Carina

texts.es: Xiomara Carina, madre soltera de dos niños menores de edad aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable en su forma de pago y con muchos deseos de superación personal, En su ratos libres le gusta preparar riquísimos platos típico de la región como : Indio Viejo, vigoron entre otros, Xiomara lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos, el darle mejores condiciones de vida. es propietaria de un negocio de ventas y compras de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa, zapatos, productos plásticos, cosméticos de varias marcas reconocidas, sus compras las realiza en otros departamentos del país, las cuales son al contado, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo y el de surtir su negocio en la compra de variedades estilos de ropa, cosméticos entre otros y de esa manera lograr aprovechar la entrada de clases, para que un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mayores ingresos. Xiomara agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Xiomara Carina is a single mother of two young children who she is responsible for. She is a native of Chinandega  municipality in the west of the country.  She is a hard-working woman and responsible in her payments. She has a lot of desire to get ahead. In her spare time she likes to make the delicious traditional foods of her area like Indio Viejo (a stew), vigoron (fast food make with yucca, meat, cabbage), etc.

Xiomara struggles each day to provide a better future for her children, to give them better living conditions. She is the owner of a business buying and selling general merchandise like: a variety of styles of clothing, shoes, plastic products and various brand-name cosmetics. She makes her purchases in other departments of the country in cash. She has regular and casual clients. The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with a variety of clothing, cosmetics, etc. Then she can take advantage of the start of the school year and in the near future generate more income. Xiomara is grateful to the lenders at Kiva who support people of low economic resources.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like clothing, shoes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Farah Delaphe

texts.en:
Farah Delaphe is 34 years old and lives in San isidro, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with one child. 

For her means of living, Farah Delaphe has earned money from a hog-raising activity for ten years already. She is earning approximately PHP 2,500 each month, doing this type of work. 

Farah Delaphe has requested a loan to be used to purchase four sacks of feed and vitamins for the pigs. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for three years.  

In the future, Farah Delaphe hopes to engage in other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Electina

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 52 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad y es muy conocida en la comunidad como “Tina” pues es una persona con buenos principios que se gana el cariño de los demás, lastimosamente no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por la pobreza que vivía, el ser analfabeta le ha dificultado muchas cosas en su vida, como firmar por ejemplo, pero una persona de buenas intenciones le enseñó a firmar y ella se siente muy agradecida. 

Al no tener una preparación académica, a Rosa le ha tocado trabajar muy duro desde pequeña, ahora se dedica al destazo de animales, la idea de este negocio surgió hace 20 años cuando cuidaba un cerdo, lo destazó para venderlo y vio que era un buen negocio.

La señora necesita el crédito, para comprar 2 ó 3 cerdos, para criarlos y no detener su trabajo de destazo, pues es así como se gana la vida. Ella espera que su hijo aprenda más oficios para que tenga sus propios ingresos y pueda salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa is 52 years old. She has 3 adult children. She is known in her community as "Tina" as she is a person of high principles who has earned the love of others. Unfortunately she did not have the opportunity to study as she was poor. Not being literate has made things difficult in her life, not being able to sign her name for something as an example. But a well-intentioned person taught her to sign her name and she is grateful for this. 

Not having an education Rosa had to work from a young age. Today she works butchering animals. The idea for this business came to her 20 years ago when she was taking care of a pig. She butchered it and sold the meat and realized that it was a good business. Rosa needs a loan to buy 2 or 3 pigs which she will raise and butcher so she can continue this work which how she makes her living. She hopes that her son learns a few trades so that he can generate his own revenue and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy 2 or 3 pigs to raise and butcher.

loans.name: Luz Enid

texts.es:
Luz es una joven de 20 años de edad, emprendedora, carismática y activa, madre de un hijo de 6 años de edad por el que lucha incansablemente para sacarlo adelante.
Durante su vida productiva se ha desempeñado como vendedora de mercancía y, hace algunos meses comenzó a trabajar con su esposo en una chaza que se encuentra ubicada a las afueras de un centro comercial; allí ofrece mecato, galletería, dulces y otros productos, de esta forma genera ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares.
Con el apoyo del crédito que solicita, comprará mercancía al por mayor (ropa, accesorios, y surtido para la chaza), así tendrá más variedad de artículos para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diversos gustos, dando como resultado, un incremento en las ventas y por ende, en los ingresos que percibe.
Luz, con su espíritu de superación y motivada por el inmenso amor a su familia, lucha cada día con el firme propósito de cumplir sus sueños, especialmente desea adquirir un terreno para construir una vivienda y arrendarla para así complementar los ingresos familiares y, garantizar a su hijo una educación de calidad para que tenga un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Luz is a young, 20-year-old woman. She is entrepreneurial, charismatic, and active. She has a 6 year old child for whom she fights tirelessly to get ahead. 

Throughout her working life, she has sold merchandise. A few months ago, she began working with her husband in a small store located outside of a shopping mall. There, they offer pastries, sweets, and other products. This is how they earn money to pay for household expenses.

With the support of the loan that they are requesting, they will purchase merchandise in bulk (clothing, accessories, and stock for the store). This way, they will have a greater variety of goods to offer to their customers to satisfy their diverse tastes. This will increase their sales and, as a result, will increase the income that they earn.

Luz, with her desire to move ahead and the motivation that she draws from her immense love for her family, fights every day with the goal of achieving her dreams. She would especially like to acquire land to build a home and rent it out to earn additional income. She would also like to provide her son with a quality education so that he will have a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk (clothing, accessories, and stock for the store).

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 39-year-old, married woman. She has two children, ages four years and six years. She describes herself as being determined. 

Jane operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are mostly ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be different tastes and preferences. 

Jane will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to open a boutique within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to economically sustain her business. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was successfully repaid. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mayram

texts.ru:
Майрам  57  лет. Она замужем, имеет детей и замечательных внуков. Майрам очень добросовестная и ответственная женщина. Она по молодости не смогла учится из-за финансовых проблем семьи. Ее семья все жизнь занималась животноводством и с самого  детства Майрам помогала своим родителям откармливать скот. Майрам очень жалеет, что в молодости не училась и не получила образование и ей приходится заниматься только скотоводством, поэтому она мечтает чтобы ее внуки учились и в будущем работали по профессии. Майрам трудится день и ночь чтобы достичь своей цели.
 Скотоводство является единственным источником дохода семьи. Также  Майрам каждый день доит корову по 10литров молока и производит кисломолочные продукты. Ее соседи покупают у нее молоко,кефир и кисломолочные шарики. Ее муж занимается купле продажей скота, он каждый месяц выводит скотов на скотный базар и перепродает. Таким образом они живут и копят деньги на образование внуков.  Майрам на протяжении нескольких лет является активным клиентом «Арванд» и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Она благодарна что «Арванд» приходит на помощь  ее семье и при необходимости предоставляет займы.  Это сотрудничество помогает ее семье жить создавать хорошие жизненные условия для детей и внуков. Майрам в очередной раз обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять  кредит и купить скот и увеличить поголовье скота. Майрам очень надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Mayram is 57 years old. She is married with children and with wonderful grandchildren. Mayram is a very conscientious and responsible woman. When she was young, she was unable to study because of her family's financial problems. Her family works in animal husbandry and and she has spent her entire life fattening cattle; she helped her parents when she was a child. Mayram is very sorry that she was unable to get an education and had to work cattle, so her dream is that her grandchildren will be able to learn a profession. Mayram works day and night to achieve this goal. 

Raising animals is the family's only source of income. Also Mayram's milk cow produces ten liters of milk every day, and she makes dairy products. Her neighbors buy her milk, yogurt and curds. Her husband buys and sells cattle. He goes to the cattle market every month to buy and sell. Thus they live and save money for educating their grandchildren. Mayram has been an active client of Arvand for several years and has a good credit history. She is grateful that Arvand comes to help her family and, if necessary, offers them loans. This cooperation helps her family live and provide decent living conditions for their children and grandchildren. Mayram once again approached Arvand and wants to take out a loan to buy cattle and increase their herd. Mayram has high hopes for financial support.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Nelson Adalberto

texts.es:
Nelson tiene 23 años de edad, estudió hasta  bachillerato, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, con él viven su esposa.

Nelson trabaja como empleado para una empresa desde hace 2 años, su horario diario de trabajo es de 7:00 AM a 6:00 PM, para llegar al lugar de trabajo, debe hacer uso del transporte público todos los días.

El crédito que está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para mejorar su casa, ya que está en muy malas condiciones pues no tiene piso y está  sin techo, por lo tanto comprará ladrillo de piso; lámina, polines, etc de esta forma logrará tener una mejor vivienda.

Nelson sueña con tener un hogar en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Nelson is 23 years old. He has a high school education. He is married, has 2 children, ages 5 and 3, and lives with his wife.

Nelson has worked as an employee for a business for the past 2 years. His daily work schedule is from 7:00 am until 6:00 pm and he takes public transportation to work every day.

He is requesting a loan from CrediCampo, which he will use to improve his home since it is in very poor condition. It does not have a floor or a roof, so he will purchase floor tiles, laminate, lumber, etc. so that he will be able to have a better home.

Nelson dreams of having a home in a better condition.

loans.use: to purchase floor tiles, laminate, and lumber.

loans.name: Turgunoy

texts.ru: Тургуной жизнерадостная и добродушная женщина. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей. Вместе со своей семьёй Тургуной живёт в сельской деревне. Тургуной, начиная с  2012 года сотрудничает с Арванд. Муж Тургуной работает  разнорабочим в городе. Чтобы полностью  обеспечивать свою  семью одного заработка мужа недостаточно.  Поэтому сама Тургуной решила заняться своим бизнесом, и начала выращивать скот.  Занимаясь этим видом деятельности, Тургуной получает хороший доход. Но сейчас Тургуной имеет несколько голов скота, которых уже скоро будут продавать. И поэтому Тургуной хочет закупить ещё несколько голов скота для дальнейшего откармливания и продажи. Но сейчас у неё нет необходимой суммы для покупки скота. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Тургуной очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, которая помогает улучшить качество своей жизни.
texts.en: Turgunoy is a cheerful and good-natured woman. She is married and has four children. Turgunoy lives in a rural village with her family. Turgunoy has been working with Arvand since 2012. Turgunoy's husband works as a laborer in the city. Her husband's salary is not enough to support the family. So Turgunoy decided to start her own business, and began raising cattle. Turgunoy makes a decent income doing this. Currently, Turgunoy has several head of cattle which will soon be sold. Therefore, Turgunoy wants to buy a few head of cattle to fatten and sell. However, she does not now have enough money to buy cattle. She went to Arvand to get a loan to buy cattle. Turgunoy is hoping that this will turn out well and thanks Arvand in advance for its support, which helps her to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is widowed with 2 children. She is 52 years old and lives in Pagadian City.

She sells sari-sari retail (an assortment of basic foodstuffs, beverages, and everyday commodities) to earn a living and has had this business for 7 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 50,000 to restock the store with basic commodities.

Mercy has been a member of PMPC for 8 months. In the future, she hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to restock the store with basic commodities

location.town: PAgadian - Dao, Pagadian City Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Geralyn is from Canlambo, Larena, Siquijor. She is 32 years old and is married with 2 kids. 

In 2011, Geralyn applied for membership with PMPC.  She heard of all the benefits of membership and never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Geralyn asked for financial assistance of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional feed and piglets. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her pig farming business.  She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and piglets.

loans.name: Delmy

texts.es:
Delmy es una mujer trabajadora de 57 años de edad, no fue a la escuela, actualmente está soltera y tiene 2 hijos que trabajan y viven en casa, apoyándola en lo que está a su alcance

Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta en el mercado, tiene 25 años de trabajar en este negocio, su familia le inculcó este trabajo y así fue como lo aprendió, viaja todos los días en transporte público hacia la ciudad y tarda 1 hora para llegar al mercado.

Delmy está solicitando este préstamo a CrediCampo, para comprar más frutas, de esta manera podrá  comercializar mucho más, y además mejorará su vida ya que tendrá más ingresos económicos que le permitan sacar a delante a su familia. 

Ella tiene muchas metas a futuro, espera que su negocio crezca para tener más ganancias y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Delmy is a hardworking, 57-year-old woman. She did not attend school. She is currently single and has two children who work and live at home, supporting her to the extent that they are able.

She makes a living by selling fruit in the market. She has been working in this business for more than 25 years. Her family taught her the business, and that is how she learned. She takes public transportation to the city each day, and it takes one hour to get to the market.

Delmy is requesting this loan from CrediCampo to purchase more fruit. This way, she will be able to sell much more and also improve her life since she will have more income that will allow her to move her family forward.

She has many goals for the future. She hopes that her business will grow so that she can earn more money and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 13 years. He describes himself to be disciplined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

His business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are pedestrians. He describes his biggest business challenge to be climatic changes, especially the rainy season, which affects business. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy another bicycle. His business goal is to own a motorcycle within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a permanent house. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: buy another bicycle

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 28-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be disciplined. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks and eggs. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. 

Her business is located in a vibrant place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks to sell. Her business goal is to open a wholesale shop within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of drinks to sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 25 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single and has no dependents. 

To make a living, Michelle earns a salary as a college instructor of graduate courses at one of the universities in Ozamiz City. She is earning approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for house renovation.
 
Michelle has been a member of PMPC for two years.  Michelle continues her support for the cooperative by means of promoting our product and services to all the people she knows.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru:
Гулноза добродушная и ответственная девушка. Она замужем и имеет одного ребёнка. Гулноза после окончания средней школы сразу вышла замуж. И сейчас она занимается домашними заботами, воспитывает ребёнка. Муж Гулнозы очень любит её и хорошо к ней относится. Чтобы не сидеть без дела Гульноза занимается вышивкой национальной женской одежды. Этим делом она зарабатывает  на проживание. За свою деятельность она успела изучить все тонкости своего дела и воспитать ряд учеников. Гулноза  с самого начала своей деятельности привыкла выполнять заказы на высшем  уроне. Поэтому она имеет очень много клиентов.

Но сейчас в её семье возникла нужда, муж Гульнозы хочет поехать на заработки в Россию, чтобы устроиться на хорошую работу и получать высокую зарплату, чтобы присылать домой своей жене. Всё необходимое для поездки муж Гульнозы уже приготовил, осталось только купить авиабилет. Но у них нет достаточной суммы для этого. Поэтому Гульноза обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку авиабилета. Гульноза заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и верит в положительный результат.
texts.en:
Gulnoza is a good-natured and responsible girl. She is married and has one child. Gulnoza married soon after graduating from high school. And now she  is a housewife raising a child. Gulnoza's husband loves her very much treats her well. To keep busy, Gulnoza works sewing traditional women's clothing. She can make a living at this. Because of her effort, she managed to learn all about the business and teach a number of students. Since her business started, Gulnoza has been able to fulfill all her orders, so she has a lot of customers. 

But now her family is in need. Gulnoza's husband wants to go to Russia to work, to get a good job with a high enough salary to send money home to his wife. Gulniza has prepared everything for the trip, they just need a ticket. However, they do not have enough money to buy one. Therefore, Gulnoza approached Arvand and wants to get a loan to buy tickets. Gulnoza thanks Arvand in advance for their support and is hoping for a positive outcome,

loans.use: buy a ticket

loans.name: Roxana Yancy

texts.es:
Roxana de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta 2º año de bachillerato general, es casada y el esposo se dedica a la agricultura y cultiva maíz y tiene dos hijos de 7 y 6 años de edad el primero estudia tercer grado y el segundo estudia primer grado los dos dependen de ella.

Ella no tiene ningún tipo de negocio, pero ella tiene tres vacas y vende de vez en cuando productos derivados de las semovientes, como Leche, cuajada, queso o crema y también tiene aves de corral (gallinas)	

Ella necesita el préstamo, para cancelar una deuda en otro banco y ella necesita salir de la deuda con esa institución, por los intereses muy altos manifiesta la cliente.

Su sueño es sacar a sus hijos adelante, dándole el estudio y que puedan tener una profesión cuando sean grandes
texts.en:
Roxana is 30 years old and completed her education through the second year of high school. She is married and her husband is a farmer who grows corn. They have two children, ages 7 and 6. The first child is in the third grade and the second one is in first grade. Both of them are dependent on her.

Roxana does not have a business, but she has three cows. Occasionally she sells the milk they produce and other derivative products such as curds, cheese, and cream. She also raises hens.

Roxana needs this loan so that she can repay a debt with another bank. She says that she needs to repay the debt with this institution because the interest rate is very high.

Her dream is to see her children get ahead, so she will provide them with the education they need so that they can pursue a profession when they are grown.

loans.use: to repay a debt at another bank.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 30-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages 5 years and 13 years. She describes herself to be understanding. She operates a retail business where she sells skirts. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant place, and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. 

She will use the 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of skirts. Her business goal is to open a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a motor vehicle for her business. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of skirts

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 59 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children who are now adults. 

To make a living, Leonora earns from her fish vending activity. She is earning an approximate amount of PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used for the allowance of her son’s On-the-Job Training as a marine student. 

Leonora has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  In the future, Leonora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay an allowance for her son’s On-the-Job Training

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 8 years. She describes herself to be honest and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells curtains. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are honest and trustworthy customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock of curtains. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of curtains. Her business goal is to expand and be able to sell clothes within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to open a boutique. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest back into the business and pay the loan.

loans.use: buy more stock of curtains

loans.name: Igualdad Group

texts.es: Erica, quien está sentada de las segundas de izquierda a derecha, de melena y chasquilla y de manos cruzadas, pertenece al Banco Comunal Igualdad de Cañete. En este Banco Comunal los socios tiene variados negocios tales como sastrería, venta de ropa usada y nueva, venta de perfumes, ropa de niños y maquillaje, venta ambulante, venta de verduras. Erica tiene un negocio de abarrotes en donde tiene a la venta, papas fritas, bebidas, verduras, papel higiénico, lácteos, cecinas, confites. El  negocio que ahora tiene lo tiene hace un año pero ella ha sido comerciante todas su vida, lamentablemente debió cerrar por falta de dinero su negocio anterior y es por esto que tuvo que trabajar en lo que pudiera, tal es el caso en que tuvo que trabajar como auxiliar de bus, con lo que gano ahorraba gran parte y así pudo nuevamente posicionarse y abrir su negocio, que ha ido de a poco agregando más cosas a la venta, y para eso ocupará el préstamo que está solicitando para poder comprar más cosas para su negocio de abarrotes y así poder tener más cosas para su barrio. Ella está muy contenta y sabe que le irá muy bien en su negocio, teniendo el dinero para poder comprar lo que le falta empezará a ahorrar más para cualquier caso de emergencia que tenga. Erica comenta que poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza ha sido una experiencia muy enriquecedora. Además de poder ayudarla económicamente, ha aprendido a valorarse como persona y como mujer, y eso la ha convertido en una mujer muy feliz.
texts.en:
Erica, who is seated second from left to right, hair with bangs and crossed hands, belongs to the Igualdad de Cañete community bank. In this community bank, the members have various businesses such as tailoring, selling used and new clothing, selling perfumes, children's clothing, makeup, selling on foot, selling vegetables.

Erica has a grocery business where she has for sale fries, drinks, vegetables, toilet paper, dairy products, smoked meats, candies. The business that she now has she's had for a year but she has been a vendor all her life. Unfortunately, due to lack of money, she had to close her last business and thus she had to work where she could. Such is the case that she had to work as a bus assistant with which she saved a great amount and was again able to position herself and open her business which has been gradually adding more things to sell. For this, she will take the loan she is requesting to be able to buy more items for her grocery store and thus be able to have more things for her neighborhood.

She is very happy and knows that her business will go well having the money to be able to buy what she lacks. She will begin to save more for whatever emergency that arises. Erica comments that to be able to work alongside Fondo Esperanza has been a very enriching experience. Besides helping her economically, she has learned to value herself as a person and as a woman and this has made her a very happy woman.

loans.use: to buy smoked meat, toilet paper, candy, vegetables, drinks for her grocery store.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en: Pius is a 32-year-old Ugandan married male, and he is a resident of Kagadi. He deals in the buying and selling of produce, mainly maize, to enable him to earn a living. He also does farming as a source of side income. He hopes to educate his children, though he is challenged by poor roads that make transportation of his merchandise to the main town difficult. He is requesting a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: María Ilduara

texts.es:
María es una mujer pujante y trabajadora de 69 años de edad, 25 de ellos dedicados a trabajar en el campo de la confección, actividad que aprendió en diversos cursos de capacitación y que fue perfeccionando con la práctica; ofrece los servicios de confección directa, el taller se encuentra ubicado en su vivienda, donde trabaja sola todos los días; sobrepasando las dificultades que se le han presentado por una enfermedad que no le permite realizar su labor de manera efectiva; sin embargo, saca fuerzas para cumplir con los pedidos pendientes.
El crédito que solicita será destinado para la compra de una máquina fileteadora y materia prima al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones), esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes, logrando mejorar las ventas e ingresos.
María manifiesta que su avanzada edad no le impide luchar para cumplir sus sueños, especialmente el de tener un taller más amplio y generar oportunidades de empleo, mejorando así tanto su calidad de vida, como la de aquellas personas que influyan en su labor.
texts.en: María is a thriving and hard working woman of 69 years, 25 of those dedicated to work in the field of sewing. She learned the activity in diverse training courses and perfected them with practice. She offers sewing services directly to clients, and the workshop is located in her house where she works alone every day. Overcoming difficulties that have presented themselves through an illness that does not allow her to perform her work effectifvely, she nevertheless gathers the strength to complete the pending requests. The loan that she requests will be destined to purchase an overlocking maching and wholesale raw material (fabrics, thread, buttons). This will allow her to have available more variety to offer her clients, managing to improve sales and income. María shows that her advanced age does not impede her fighting to accomplish her dreams, especially that of having a larger workshop, creating employment opportunities, improving her quality of life, and that of the people who influence her work.

loans.use: to buy an overlocking machine and wholesale raw material (fabrics, thread, buttons)

loans.name: Deogratius

texts.en: Deogratius is a 47 year old teacher living in Kagadi Uganda. He owns a produce store that he started using savings from his job as a teacher. He started this business to be able to earn an extra income as his salary is so low to enable him meet his essential needs. He dreams of educating his seven children and building a house in the future. Deogratius wants a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn flour and different flavored sodas.

loans.name: Amor Group

texts.es: Este grupo lo forman cuatro socios microempresarios uno de ellos es la señora Dominga quien se dedica a la compra y venta de cosechas de cítricos desde hace 18 años, ella comercializa sus productos en el mercado oriental de Managua. Tiene un hijo que todavía depende de ella. Es cliente de la institución desde hace 6 años, Nuevamente solicita un crédito más para la compra de cosechas de limón, naranja agria, grosea, plátano. La otra integrante es Tania tiene 24 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas y comida, Adela tiene 23 años su negocio es la venta de ropa, Wilber tiene la edad de 30 años su negocio es la crianza de pollo y trabaja en una caponera también.
texts.en:
This group consists of four members who are micro-entrepreneurs. One of them is Sra. Dominga, who has been buying and selling citrus fruits for the past 18 years. She sells her products at the eastern market in Managua. Dominga has one child who is dependent on her. She has been a client of ADIM for six years. Dominga is requesting another loan so that she can buy harvested fruits such as lemons, sour oranges, grosella, and bananas.

The other members are as follows:
• Tania is 24 years old and sells tortillas and food.
• Adela is 23 years old and has a business in which she sells clothes.
• Wilber is 30 years old and has a business in which he raises chickens. He also works at a poultry farm.

loans.use: to buy harvested fruits such as lemons, sour oranges, grosella, and bananas.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 35 year old married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as committed and ambitious. He operates a restaurant where he cooks food and tea to sell. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an area with no competition and his primary customers are loyal customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy milk, wheat flour, cooking oil and other ingredients for preparing food.
