His business goal is to open another branch within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will get good returns from the business and be able to pay school fees for his children.. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy milk, wheat flour, cooking oil and other ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a 32-year-old married woman. She has one child who is three years old. She describes herself to be determined and committed to work. She operates a tailoring business where she makes dresses and sweaters for sale. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in an area with lots of customers and her primary customers are loyal customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy threads, fabric and other tailoring materials. Her business goal is to increase operations and open another branch within five years. She hopes that in the future, the business will give her good returns. This is her first loan with SMEP-DTM.

loans.use: to buy threads, fabric and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a 60-year-old widow looking after her three children. She owns a retail shop and restaurant in Kagadi, Uganda, a business she has done for five years. She started this business after the death of her husband to be able to pay fees for her children and also meet their basic needs. She dreams of owning a wholesale shop and also educating her children to university. Patricia intends to use the loan to buy a fridge for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for her restaurant.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 41 years old and lives in Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with no children.
 
For her means of living, Rosie earns from the salary she receives as a house helper and sales attendant at her sister’s store. Her sister recently became a widow. She is also engaged in a hog-raising activity. She is earning an approximate amount of PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase construction materials to repair her house. Rosie has been a member of PMPC for almost four years.  In the future, Rosie hopes to focus on her hog-raising activity.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a 29-year-old Ugandan that lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He is married with 2 children who all attend school. He deals in produce selling to earn a daily income and also earns income from farming. He has a passion for agriculture and dreams of buying a car to help in the transportation of his stock to the city and also to educate his children. Gerald has asked for a loan to buy coffee and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee and beans to sell.

loans.name: Rahbar

texts.ru:
Рахбар жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина со средним образованием.  Она замужем и имеет двоих детей.  Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке.  После окончания средней школы Рахбар вышла замуж.  И так она стала домохозяйкой.  Но Рахбар вместе со своим мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.  И поэтому они много работают.  Муж Рахбар занимается земледелием, а сама Рахбар шьёт на дому. И от этого дела они получают доход в семью, что помогает им проживать.

Но для того, чтобы иметь достаточный  постоянный доход на пропитание, Рахбар вместе со своим мужем начали ещё один бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством.  Рахбар выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса они также получают хороший доход.  Но пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды.  В данный момент Рахбар с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота.  Рахбар очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Rahbar is a cheerful and hardworking woman with a secondary education. She is married and has two children. She lives in a small rural village. After graduating from high school, Rahbar married. She became a housewife. But Rahbar and her husband try to do everything possible to support their children. So they work long hours. Rahbar's husband farms and she sews at home. This is how they support the family. 

In order to have enough steady income to buy food, Rahbar and her husband started another business. They are working in animal husbandry. Rahbar raises cattle and then sells the meat and milk. They also get a decent income from the business. But while they have enough money to cover all of their needs, Rahbar and her husband want to buy a few head of cattle for fattening. So she went to Arvand and wants to take out a loan to buy cattle. Rahbar is hoping that everything will turn out well, and she thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en:
Beatrace is a fifty one-year-old hard working married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Her main business is cattle fattening alongside agriculture where she earns a living. She started this business to look after her family and educate her children.  She has hardships of inadequate capital to buy more cows for fattening and other equipment like medicine for the cattle. However, her vision is to own a modernized farm in her area.
 
She is requesting for a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tires to resell.

loans.name: Abeteraine Farmers Association Group

texts.en:
Adolf is a 32-year-old Ugandan married male living in Kagadi, Uganda. He deals in produce, buying and selling mainly maize and cassava to enable him to look after his family and afford a fairly comfortable life. He also does farming to earn side income. He hopes to educate his four children though challenged by poor roads that make transportation of his merchandise to the main town difficult. He wants a loan to buy maize to sell.

Adolf is a member of a group that came together to be able to access loans for their household developments. In this group, each member guarantees the others to access a loan

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Troice

texts.en:
Trocie, a 64-year-old woman, is married to Samuel, a 68-year-old retiree. They have been blessed with eight children: Caroline, 41, a civil servant; Paulus, 40, an entrepreneur; Ruth, 38, a consultant; Yabsoni, 36, an entrepreneur; Robin, 34, a doctor; Farida, 31, an entrepreneur; Jordy, 24, a worker; and Priskila, 14, a junior high school student.
 
Trocie has been running a kiosk business for three years. She sells daily needs such as rice, corn, beans, sugar, instant noodles, eggs, soap, snacks, fruits, etc. Her income from the business is about IDR 100.000 each day. At the moment, Trocie plans to buy a cooler box as demanded by her customers for cold drinks. Therefore, she requested an individual loan of IDR 3.000.000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on a cooler box and more stock for her kiosk.

loans.use: to buy a cooler box and restock her kiosk

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 25-year-old married man. He has one child who is two years old. He describes himself as being passionate and goal-oriented. He operates a retail business where he sells music, DVDs, and compact disks. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are the youth. He describes his biggest business challenge as being lack of funds. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of music, DVDs, and compact disks. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of music, DVDs, and compact disks

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a 34-year-old woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be ambitious and trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. 

Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes. Her business goal is to expand business and open a general shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, her business will grow. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Arnoldo Santana

texts.es:
Arnoldo es un joven de 23 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo año de bachillerato en la nocturna, está acompañado y su compañera de vida se dedica al trabajo doméstico, tienen un hijo como fruto de esta relación el cual ya está estudiando primer grado. Por lo tanto, solo su esposa y su hijo dependen de él.
 
Arnoldo trabaja como panificador en una panadería muy fuerte de su ciudad, este oficio lo hace desde que tenía 14 años de edad,  lo aprendió gracias a su prima, pues ella tenía una panadería y le enseñó a Arnoldo el proceso para hacer pan, luego él se fue a vivir a otro lugar y cuando se acompañó buscó trabajo como panadero, él tiene buenas recomendaciones de trabajo,  han llegado a tenerle mucho aprecio por ser un joven trabajador que hasta le han dado una pequeña casa donde vivir. El trabajo le queda a 5 minutos a pie, él se levanta a las tres de la mañana a hornear el pan y termina sus actividades a las 12 del mediodía. 

Este préstamo le servirá de mucho a este joven, pues le ayudará a comprar poste, poliducto, alambre de electricidad y pagará la instalación de energía eléctrica, ya que por el momento una vecina está compartiendo electricidad con él, pero les está cobrando muy caro, es por ello que él necesita tenerla propia para que le salga más cómodo y además no tendrá inconveniente con los vecinos cuando él esté ocupando energía al madrugar a trabajar.

Entre sus propósitos están, tener alumbrado eléctrico en su casa ya que por el tiempo de la delincuencia no es bueno que el hijo esté en un lugar oscuro, además con la ganancia de la panadería desea ahorrar para hacer una casa más agradable y digna, y finalmente brindarle los estudios a su hijo para que sea un profesional.
texts.en:
Arnoldo is a young 23 year old man. He studied until the second year of high school at night. He is married and his spouse is dedicated to domestic work. She has a son from this relationship who is in first grade. So only his wife and his son depend on him.

Arnoldo works as a baker in a popular bakery in her city. He has performed this job since he was 14 years old. He learned it from his cousin since she had a bakery and taught Arnoldo the process to make bread. Then he went to live in another place and when he went he searched for work as a baker. He has good working references. He has come to have a lot of appreciation for being a young worker and has been given a small house to live in. His work is 5 minutes away on foot. He gets up at 3AM to bake the bread and finishes his work at noon.

This loan will help this young man a lot since it will help him buy a pole, pipeline, electrical wire and to pay for the installation of electricity since, at the moment, a neighbor is sharing electricity with him. But it is becoming very expensive. For this he needs to have his own to be more comfortable and also have no inconvenience with neighbors when he is using electricity to get up early for work.

Among his goals are having electric light in his house since, due to crime, it is not good for his son to be in a dark place. Also, with his income from the bakery, he wishes to save to build a nicer, dignified house and finally to provide education to his son so he can become a professional.

loans.use: to buy a pole, pipeline, electrical wire and to pay for the installation of electricity.

loans.name: Taguhi

texts.en:
Taguhi is from Gyulagarak village of Lori region. She lives there with her husband and 30-year-old son. The family is engaged in agriculture. They rent a plot of land where wheat, potato, and grass is cultivated. Unfortunately because of financial difficulties, Taguhi and her family aren't able to purchase and have their own land. They gather the harvest, sell it in nearby markets and get money which is the only source of their income. Taguhi has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase more seeds and fertilizer. This will enable her to increase agricultural turnover and she will be able to save a little money for purchasing land.

As this is Taguhi's first loan it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn't have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. Please help Taguhi and her family to increase their agribusiness and make their dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for cultivation

loans.name: Nu'mon

texts.ru: Нуъмону 59 лет. Он живет в городе Конибодом с женой, сыном и невесткой. Нуъмон начинает новый бизнес в сфере животноводства. Ему будет помогать сын. Он будет перевозить на своем личном транспорте корм для скота. Нуъмон до сегодняшнего дня занимался растениеводством. У него имеется 0,96 га участка земли, где кроме сельскохозяйственных культур, там также выращивается люцерна - корм для скота. Нуъмон уже запасся достаточным количеством корма. За счет кредита, он хочет купить пару голов крупнорогатого скота. Семья будет поддерживать Нуъмона в ведении нового бизнеса. Этот кредит даст ему шанс начать прибыльный бизнес животноводство.
texts.en: Nu'mon is 59 years old. He lives in Konibodom with his wife, son, and daughter. Nu'mon is starting a new business in animal husbandry. His son will help him. He will haul feed in his own truck. Up until now, Nu'mon has farmed. He has a 0.96 hectare plot of land, where he grows food and also alfalfa. Nu'mon has enough feed stocked up. He wants to use his loan to buy a pair of head of cattle. Nu'mon's family will help him run the new business. This loan will give him a chance to start a profitable business breeding livestock.

loans.use: Для купли пару голов крупнорогатого скота, чтобы начать новый бизнес

loans.name: Fabiano

texts.en:
Fabiano is a 58-year-old hardworking married man with 17 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is cattle grazing and fattening along with farming where he earns a living. He started this business to look after his family and educate his children. He has hardships of inadequate capital to expand his business and seasonal changes, especially drought.
Fabiano is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is 45 years old and widowed. She lives in a rural community with her three school-aged children. Luzviminda is engaged in the buying and selling  of fish and smoked fish to earn a living.  Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she needs to increase her income in order to support her children's education. To further improve her business, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more fresh fish and smoked fish to sell. Having patience and a strong determination, she believes that she will improve her business someday.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish and smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a 44-year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be time conscious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using a motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are local customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and fuel for his motorcycle. His business goal is to improve within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to create employment. 

This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and fuel for his motorcycle

loans.name: Heidi Lissett

texts.es:
Heidi tiene 26 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado en la escuela, actualmente está acompañada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura sembrando granos básicos, así como jornalero trabajando en los cañales y huertas frutales,  tienen dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad.

El trabajo de Heidi es la siembra de hortalizas, lo aprendió gracias a unas capacitaciones que recibió de una institución, les enseñó a hacer el bocachi (abono orgánico) donde produce verduras saludables, desde hace dos años es la actividad de la cual obtiene ingresos, el cultivo lo realiza cerca de su casa, y su esposo se involucra ayudándole por las tardes en el riego de las plantas. 

Ella solicita el préstamo a CrediCampo, pues necesita invertir en la compra de semillas para sembrar más verduras, así como preparar el terreno y desinfestarlo para que esté listo cuando siembre, es así que realizando esta actividad se sentirá satisfecha.

En un futuro ella sueña con tener cultivado por lo menos una media hectárea de hortalizas y ser ella quien provea las verduras a los habitantes de su comunidad, ya que ella está segura que produce verduras saludables y cree que lo logrará si CrediCampo le da el apoyo financiero que necesita.
texts.en:
Heidi is 26 years old. She has a ninth grade education and currently lives with her partner, who works as a farmer growing basic grains as well as a laborer in the sugar cane plantations and fruit tree orchards. They have two children, who are ages four and two.

Heidi works growing vegetables, which she learned from the training offered by an organization that taught about making bocachi (organic fertilizer) in order to produce healthy vegetables. She has been doing this for two years, and she obtains her income from this business. She grows her plants near her home and her husband is also involved by helping her water them in the evenings. 

She is requesting this loan from CrediCampo because she needs to invest in purchasing seeds in order to plant more vegetables. She also has to prepare the land and rid it of any pests so that it is ready to be planted. This will allow her to carry on with her business and feel satisfied.

In the future she would like to have at least one and a quarter acres of vegetables and become the main provider in her community, because she knows she is growing healthy produce. She believes she will be able to achieve this if CrediCampo gives her the financial support she needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant more vegetables.

loans.name: Lidia Mariana

texts.es: Lidia Mariana mayor de edad, soltera, con dos hijos mayor de edad, originaria de unos de los municipios de Chinandega, en el occidente del país, donde predomina el turismo, y el comercio; ella es una microempresaria la cual posee en su casa de habitación una pulpería donde vende todo tipo de productos pulperos tales como: granos básicos, detergente, productos congelados, entre otros, así como productos de marcas conocias, también se dedica a la crianza, engorde, compra y venta  de cerdos. Las compras las realiza al contado en camiones distribuidores y mercados de este municipio, los cerdos los compra a personas de  comarcas aledañas. Las ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales, las recupera semanal los quince y treinta de cada mes, tiene tres años de experiencia. El objetivo de este préstamo es para invertirlo en su negocio para la compra de granos básicos, aceite, productos congelados, jabones, papel sanico, perfumes, entre otros productos. Lidia Mariana agradece a los inversionistas kiva por la ayuda que les brindad a personas de escasos recursos y a países pobres como Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en: Lidia Mariana is a single adult with two adult children. She is a native of one of the Chinandega towns in the western part of the country where tourism and commerce dominate. She is a small business woman who owns a store in her house where she sells all types of grocery products such as basic grains, detergents, frozen products, among others as well as products from known brands. She is also dedicated to raising, fattening, buying and selling pigs. Purchases are made in cash at truck distributors and markets in the town. She buys the pigs from people from surrounding counties. Sales are done in cash and on credit to established and prospective customers. She recoups sales weekly on the 15th and 30th of each month. She has three years experience. The objective of this loan is to invest it in her business to buy basic grains, oil, frozen products, soaps, toilet paper, perfumes, among other products. Lidia Mariana is thankful to the Kiva investors for the help provided to people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua to have sources of work.

loans.use: to buy various products like soaps, cosmetics, frozen products, detergents, basic grains, among others.

loans.name: Adan De Jesus

texts.es: Adán de Jesús, es mayor de edad, casado, con dos hijos menores aún bajo su responsabilidad, originario de unos de los municipios de Chinandega, donde predomina el turismo, y el comercio; Él es un micro empresario, el cual se dedica al transporte. Para esto cuenta con dos unidades como: un camión de rutero y un  vehículo taxi con los que él desde muy temprano sale de su casa a ofrecer sus servicios a las personas  de este municipio. El objetivo de este préstamo es para darle mantenimiento al vehículo taxi y así poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros. Adán de Jesús agradece a los inversionistas kiva por la ayuda que les brindan a personas de escasos recursos, para tener fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Adán de Jesús is married and still has two children under his charge. He is from a town in Chinandega, where there is a lot of tourism and trade. He is a microentrepreneur and works in transportation. He owns two vehicles, a truck and a taxi cab, which he uses to provide transportation services to the people in his town, starting in the early morning. 

The purpose of this loan is to maintain his taxi cab so that he can give his passengers better service. He will use it to replace the flooring, paint the vehicle, upholster the seats, etc. 

Adán de Jesús is grateful to Kiva lenders for the help they give to people with limited resources in order to find means to work.

loans.use: to maintain his transportation vehicle.

loans.name: Lozi

texts.en: Lozi is a 30-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be determined to work. She operates a food stall where she cooks food for sale.  She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are reliable customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that her business is located in an open air place. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy materials to construct a food cafe. Her business goal is to open a big hotel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a five star hotel. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.  A previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a food cafe

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 33-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more stock like water, biscuits and sugar to sell. He has personal goals of educating his children and owning a wholesale shop. His still faces a main hardship of inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands. 

Robert is requesting a loan to buy soap, crates of sodas, and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, crates of sodas, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 12 years. She describes herself to be time conscious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local consumers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a good life. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Tulgon

texts.ru:
Тулгон добродушная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 55 лет. Она замужем имеет пятерых детей.  Все её дети уже обрели свои семьи и живут отдельно в своим домах. Тулгон живёт со своим мужем в маленькой деревушке. Они очень любят своих детей и внуков и рады приглашать всех к себе в гости. Сама Тулгон работает официанткой  в местной столовой. На этой работе она получает маленькую заработную плату, но так как в её возрасте очень трудно найти другую работу, она вынуждена работать там. Муж и сын Тулгон находятся на заработках в России и каждый месяц по возможности присылают денежные средства Тулгон.

Сейчас из-за сильного холода Тулгон очень сильно заболела, и ей необходимы денежные средства на лечение. И чтобы не ждать заработной платы, она обратилась в Арванд, чтобы скорее получить кредит на покупку необходимых медикаментов для своего лечения. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Tulgon is a good-natured and hardworking 55-year-old woman. She is married and has five children. All of her children already have their own families and live in their own homes. Tulgon lives with her husband in a small village. They love their children and grandchildren and are happy to invite all to come and visit. Tulgon works as a waitress in a local diner. She earns a small salary, but at her age it is very difficult to find another job, so she is forced to work there. Tulgon's husband and son are working in Russia, and when it's possible they send cash to Tulgon every month. 

Now, because of the intense cold, Tulgon is very ill and she needs money for treatment. She can't wait to earn the money, so she went to Arvand get a loan to buy essential medicines for her treatment. She is hoping for a positive outcome, and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: buy medicine

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en: Mary Joy is a 20-year-old college undergraduate living in a rural village in Bago City. She is a single mother and the eldest of 2 siblings. She and her 1-year-old daughter stay with her mother, who is separated from her father. Her mom earns a monthly income of Php 5,000.00($114) by selling processed meat products in their community. Mary Joy has long wanted to help her mother but didn't have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program of BagoSphere that could lead to a call center job. Now that she has passed BagoSphere’s selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Once Mary Joy starts earning, she can help provide for her family’s basic needs and save some money for her daughter’s education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, fumigation products and pay the balance of a loan with a higher interest rate.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a 26-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be confident. She operates a farm where she grows tea for sale.  She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a favorable place and her primary customers are tea companies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be tea pests and diseases. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more tea leaves for resale. 

Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: buy more tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is married and has five children, four of whom are attending school. She is a resident from Khnach Romeas village, Boeng Khnar, Bakan, Pursat province. Chantha is a business-minded woman who always seeks for ways of developing her household income. Now she is in the business of selling assorted goods to add to her husband’s income. She has been doing this for almost four years and is able to earn a good income of 15.00 USD per day.

Chantha, besides her hardships of living, also wants to focus on improving sanitation practices for her entire household. That’s why she has applied for a loan to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members and build a water storage. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Chantha is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members and build a water storage

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es:
Juana de 48 años de edad, casada, con un hijo menor de edad, y estudia en la universidad. Es originaria de  Jinotepe, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la familia. Lamentablemente y por razones económica no pudo estudiar, en la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle mejores oportunidades a su hijo, y cumplir con su sueño mas anhelado como es verlo formado en un profesional.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa usada como: pantalones, short, faldas, blusas, camisetas, ropa de cama, ropa interior, vestidos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en compra pacas de ropa de segunda mano el cual se la está ofreciendo  a buen precio y de buena calidad. Juana agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juana is 48 years old and married with an underage son who is studying at the university. She is from Jinotepe, which is located in the northern part of the region. She is known for being hard-working and responsible, with the desire to overcome personal obstacles. In her free time she enjoys spending time with her family. Unfortunately she wasn't able to study for financial reasons; she currently strives day after day to provide her son with better opportunities and to fulfill the dream she most longs for, to see him trained as a professional.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead, she has a business selling used clothing like pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, shirts, bed linens, underwear and dresses. She dedicates eight hours a day to her business, offering her product. The objective of the loan is to invest in buying packs of good-quality second-hand clothing, which she is offering at a good price. Juana thanks the Kiva investors for the help they provide people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital, buying and selling packs of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Amtal Hafiz

texts.en:
Amtal Hafiz is taking a loan to buy cosmetics such as facial creams, face powder, lipsticks, nail polish, etc.  

She is a 30-year-old married woman, living with her husband and four children. Her husband is doing an ordinary job and earns very low income. Through her beauty salon she is taking an active part to increase the monthly income for her family. She is fully professional in her arts; she provides makeover services to her clients at home. She is known for bridal makeovers; most of the ladies come from other towns for a bridal makeover. With the passage of time her beauty products will be finished and this time she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon. 

Therefore, Amtal Hafiz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she would be able to buy new cosmetics products such as facial creams, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotions etc.

Amtal Hafiz wants to establish a parlor in a nearby town because she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She feels proud when someone appreciates her arts and devotion for her family. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for makeover services

loans.name: Naisan's Group

texts.en:
Naisan, 64, is from a rural village located in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. She is widowed with nine children and earns a living through working for others for a fee. Engaging in this business for 44 years, she is able to earn about 28,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

This is the first microloan for Naisan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Naisan will use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business to improve her family's living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik lives in Salvard village of Syuniq region. She lives together with her husband and son. Her husband works at the village hall and Hasmik herself is involved in agriculture. The farm that she runs includes livestock of 4 sheep, 2 cows, 3 calves, 20 chickens. She also cultivates wheat and grass for feeding the livestock. 

Now, this hardworking woman asks for a loan to be able to enlarge her farm by 6 sheep, a calf and forage for feeding the livestock. 

This will be a big support for the farm that Hasmik runs and will increase her agricultural income. 

Hasmik hopes that Kiva lenders will assist her.

loans.use: to pay for 6 sheep, a calf and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a 46-year-old married female and mother of four children living in Kagadi,Uganda. She operates a bar and lodge business she started in 2002 and feels the business is easy for her to manage. She hopes to buy a vehicle for personal use and educate her children up to a higher education.  

Justine describes herself as a hardworking lady but her challenge is insufficient capital for expansion. Justine has asked for a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Taalaykan

texts.ru: Талайкан 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 сыновей. Все дети находятся на заработках в России, ежемесячно высылают часть своей зарплаты родителям в Кыргызстан. У Талайкан - средне-специальное образование, по специальности-фармацевт, работает в аптеке при поликлинике, муж-таксист, занимается частым извозом пассажиров. Талайкан и ее супруг в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимаются животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Талайкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 18 овец, 1 коза, 6 кобыл, 7 бычков, а также 1,45 ГА земельного надела, на котором выращивают клевер и кукурузу для реализации. Хозяйство очень хорошее. Корма все заготовлены.  Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Талайкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Талайкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового помещения для скота.
texts.en: Taalaykan is 50 years old, married and together with her husband, is raising three sons. All of her children are working abroad in Russia. Every month, they send a portion of their salaries to their parents in Kyrgyzstan. Taalaykan has a secondary-specialized education with a degree in pharmacology. She work in a pharmacy affiliated with an outpatient clinic. Her husband is a taxi driver and frequently drives passengers to their destinations. As an additional source of income for their family, Taalaykan and her husband practice livestock breeding and crop farming. They started this business 19 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Taalaykan's hard work, she currently has 5 dairy cows, 18 sheep, 1 goat,  6 mares and 7 calves on her farm, as well as a 1.45 hectare plot of land on which she grows clover and corn for sale. The farming is very well done. The feed for the animals has already been procured. Their monthly earnings are 12,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her farm, Taalaykan turned to Microcredit Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan to buy calves to increase the size of her herd. Taalaykan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to build a new barn for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: María Patricia

texts.es:
María, a sus 51 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, pues desde hace 8 años se dedica a vender artículos en lana que ella misma teje a mano como bufandas, guantes, pasamontañas y otros productos; el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y poco a poco ha ido perfeccionando su técnica y la calidad de los productos, adicionalmente le brinda clases a sus clientes, lo que para ella significa un complemento para sus ingresos.
Con el ánimo de darle continuidad a su labor, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar materia prima al por mayor (lana y agujas para tejer), así podrá ofrecer nuevos diseños de productos y satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes, logrando aumentar las ventas.
María manifiesta que su mayor motivación para levantarse y luchar cada día es poder adquirir una casa propia y montar un almacén que le garantice una estabilidad económica para disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
María is 51 years old and works as a self-employed vendor. For the past 8 years she has been selling wool articles that she knits herself, such as scarves, gloves, ski masks and other products. She leaned this trade through trial and error, and she gradually refined her technique and improved the quality of her products. In addition, she offers lessons to her customers, which for her represents an addition to her income.
With the drive to continue doing her work, she requests the help of this loan so that she can purchase supplies on wholesale (wool and needles for sewing). That way she'll be able to offer new product designs and satisfy her customers' tastes, thus increasing her sales.
María reports that her biggest motivation for getting up and working hard everyday is being able to acquire her own house. She also aims to set up a grocery store that ensures her financial stability so she can enjoy better living conditions and improve her well-being.

loans.use: to purchase supplies on wholesale (wool and needles for sewing).

loans.name: Savan's Group

texts.en:
Savan is 37-years-old and married. She lives with her husband and four children in a rural area located in the Koh Sotin district, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer and has been in this business for 19 years and her husband also produces sugar which he makes from the sugar palm. The current business earns her family about 50,000 KHR per day to feed the family but she manages to save about 30,000 KHR each day.

Savan’s group consists of five members and Savan is in her first microloan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Savan will use her portion to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Rositas De Pantini Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSITAS DE PANTINI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Angélica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: El negocio que tienen las integrantes de la asociación comunal es la venta de leche, así mismo unas se apoyan con la costura de ropa y servicio de albañilería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Angélica es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre y con un pequeño capital que ella tenía.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de leche) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ROSITAS DE PANTINI” credit group is in its first cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Copacabana center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Angélica is the president. The businesses that the members of the credit group have are varied. Among them are selling milk, sewing clothes and bricklaying. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, Angélica. She says that this is the first time that she has been a a part of Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a consultant from the institution who went to visit her at her house. Right ow, she has a business selling cheese. She says that she learned this business from her mother and with what little capital she had.
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying milk. She will acquire it in the nearby communities and later she will sell it in her sales space. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the loans and the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy milk for her cheese business

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en su propia casa en el distrito de Oyotun, una comunidad ubicada en la zona sierra de la Provincia de Chiclayo, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El tiene una panadería donde ofrece panes, tortas y galletitas, es un padre que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos como sacos de harina, azúcar, levadura entre otros y de esta manera poder ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 50, lives with his wife in his own house in the district of Oyotun, a village located in the mountains of Chiclayo Province. The local population works in agriculture, trade, and livestock. The village is located two hours away from the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

He has a bakery where he sells bread, cakes and cookies. He is a father who puts in effort to his work. He has applied for a loan of 1500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy ingredients such as sacks of flour, sugar, and yeast, among others. He will then be able to offer a variety of products to his clients.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make goods for his bakery.

loans.name: Seneida Del Pilar

texts.es:
Senaida del Pilar tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su suegra en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad que se dedicada a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, esta ciudad es conocida como La Capital del “Tondero”, baile típico de la zona norte del Perú, donde se demuestra la galantería de las parejas para conquistarse, ubicada en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerdos desde hace cinco años, por lo que es conocida por el negocio que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecer una buena producción a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Senaida del Pilar, age 34, lives with her mother-in-law in the Morropon district.  The community devotes itself to agriculture, commerce, and livestock.  This city is known as the capital of the “Tondero”, a typical dance of the northern area of Peru where couples use courtesy to win each other over.  The city is located in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

She has been selling pigs for five years.  Therefore, she is known for the business that she does.  She has requested a loan for 2,000 soles to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals.  This way she will offer a good production to her customers.  She will generate greater income in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора животновод, проживающая в городе Худжанд. Ей 44 года. Она мать двоих сыновей. Ее старший сын женат и живет с женой у родителей. Младший сын еще школьник. Муж Гулноры работает в местной гостинице. Сама Гулнора более 8 лет занимается разведением коров. Она занимается данным делом при дворе своего дома. Ей помогает сын и невестка. Гулнора любит животных и ей нравится ухаживать за ними. Она получает удовольствие от времени, проведенное с ними. Сейчас Гулнора хочет увеличить поголовье скота в своем скотном дворе. С такой целью она просит кредит для закупа пару голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Gulnora is a livestock farmer who lives in the city of Khujand. She is 44 years old. She is a mother to two sons. Her eldest son is married and lives with his wife at his parent's house. Her younger son is still in elementary school. Gulnora's husband works in a local hotel. Gulnora has practiced cattle breeding for more than 8 years.  She does this business in the yard outside her house.  Her son and daughter-in-law help her with this. Gulnora loves animals and she likes looking after them. She enjoys the time she spends with them. Now Gulnora wants to increase the amount of cattle that she has in her barnyard. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy a pair of cows.

loans.use: to buy a pair of cows to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Nils Orlando

texts.es:
Nils Orlando tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos desde hace más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Nils Orlando is 31 years old and lives with his children in the district of Nueva Arica. Its population makes a living through agriculture, business and ranching. Nueva Arica is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. 

He makes a living through the raising and selling of small animals: ducks, roosters, hens and chickens. Nils Orlando has more than 10 years of experience in the business. He has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles in order to buy animal feed to fatten the animals and in this way generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: Compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales.

loans.name: Marcia Cristina

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Marcia, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  19 y 13 años que estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo trabaja en una universidad local.
Doña Marcia es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante y ganar lo suyo para sentirse independiente, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, pero además en sociedad con dos hermanas tienen una farmacia en la cual se ganan muy buenos ingresos que comparten en partes iguales, así mismo las tres invierten de la misma forma y es por eso que ella realiza los créditos para con una parte surtir su tienda y la otra para invertir en la farmacia. Ella está muy agradecida con Fundación Espoir ya que le han permitido crecer en sus negocios a través de los créditos y todo esto para beneficio de su familia. Tiene 9 años con la tienda y 4 con la farmacia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para su tienda y medicinas para la farmacia. Está en el Grupo De Crédito 9 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos cada vez aumenta sus negocios. Sus sueños darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Community Bank Mujeres Unidas [Women United] meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as the sultan of coffee because of the extensive coffee crops which have an unparalleled taste, its cuisine, and for the warmth of its people.

In this place lives Marcia, who is 44 years old. She is married and from this marriage, she has two children, 19 and 13 years old, who study in university and school. Her husband works at a local university.

Marcia is a woman who likes to get ahead and earn her own keep in order to feel independent. She has a convenience store in her house. In addition to this, she and two sisters have a pharmacy from which they get very good earnings, which they share equally. They also invest in the same way, and that is why she takes out loans -- on the one hand to stock her store, and on the other to invest in the pharmacy.

She is very grateful to the Fundación Espoir because they have allowed her to grow her businesses through the loans, and all for the benefit of her family. She has had the store for 9 years and the pharmacy for 4 years.

She is going to use this loan to buy provisions for her store and medicines for the pharmacy. She has been in the Community Bank for 9 years, and she likes it because thanks to the loans, her business increases every time.

Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy medicines and provisions.

loans.name: Nelson David

texts.es:
Nelson es una persona de 37 años de edad es casado y tiene 2 hijitos menores de 18 años, pero por cosas lamentables de la vida se separó de su esposa, esa pérdida fue muy dolorosa para el sin embargo no dejo que la vida termine con sus ganas de salir adelante sino más bien día tras día lucha para que el tiempo sane su corazón y pueda nuevamente volver a ser feliz, al haberse separado de su esposa fueron sus familiares quienes le extendieron una mano y actualmente vive con ellos. Nelson es nativo de la parroquia de Zumbahua del cantón Pujili provincia de Cotopaxi, desde muy pequeño ha tenido el alma de un luchador, terminó sus estudios primarios, por falta de recursos económicos no llego a obtener una profesión sin embargo el vio que la sociedad exigía que las personas se preparen así que siguió varios cursos y es ahora chofer profesional, ese fue su gran sueño. 
El lugar donde vive actualmente Nelson es una zona donde la agricultura es la principal fuente de ingreso y donde el clima y la tierra favorecen a todos los habitantes, Nelson es agricultor esa maravillosa y muy sacrificada actividad lo aprendió de sus familiares quien vieron en el a la persona más adecuada para enseñar todos estos conocimientos.
El crédito que ahora Nelson requiere y nos pide es para la compra de semillas y abono y aumentar su producción, debido a que en estos últimos años se ha venido dando cuenta de que la demanda de cebolla ha aumentado esto se ha dado porque la mayor parte de agricultores se han trasladado a la ciudad y son muy pocos los que van quedando. Muy humildemente Nelson quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Nelson is 37 years, old, married and has two children under the age of 18 years old. Unfortunately Nelson is separated from his wife. This was a painful loss but it did not stop his desire to get ahead. Instead, every day Nelson fights so that time can heal his wounds and he can be happy again. Following his separation, Nelson's family opened their arms to him and he now lives with them. Nelson is from the Zumbahua parish in the Pujili canton of Cotopaxi province. From a young age, Nelson has been a fighter. He completed only primary school and, due to a lack of money, he was unable to enter a profession. Nevertheless, Nelson realised that society demands that people be educated and he completed various courses. He has now achieved his great dream of being a professional driver.

Nelson lives in an area where agriculture is the main source of income. The climate and lands are good for all its inhabitants. Nelson is a farmer. He learned this marvellous and demanding trade from his relatives, who saw that Nelson was the right person to whom to pass on this knowledge.

This loan that Nelson needs and has applied for is to buy seeds and manure to increase production. In the last few years Nelson has realised that demand for onions has increased as many farmers have moved to the city, with only a few remaining in the country. Nelson wishes to extend his humble and sincere thanks, and congratulate, "Fundación Alternativa" in Ecuador and Kiva for making growth in his professional and personal lives possible.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for his plantation.

loans.name: Cristian Mauricio

texts.es:
Cristian Mauricio es un joven de 20 años de edad, vive en Latacunga es soltero, gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación de sus padres logró terminar la escuela primaria pero lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos lo llevó aprender desde muy pequeño todo lo que hacían sus padres para poder mejorar un poco más el nivel de vida. Es un joven apasionado por el deporte esto le ayuda a mantenerse sano y con muchas energías para seguir trabajando todos los días. 
Cristian Mauricio lleva ya dos años liderando el negocio de compra y venta de chatarra, dedica a esta actividad desde 8 a 10 horas cada día conjuntamente  con las actividades del hogar que incluyen ayudar a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar, y gracias a la ayudada de Dios, de sus padres y las ganas de superarse  le  ha ido muy bien, él está muy agradecido con la vida porque le ha dado todo lo que se merece y lo que no le ha dado, dice él, es porque no le hace falta.
Cristian Mauricio con la experiencia que ha adquirido a través de los años y experimentando el crecimiento que ha tenido su negocio en los últimos meses, se siente preparado para dar un paso de crecimiento para lo cual solicita un crédito que lo utilizará para la compra de un triciclo que harán que sus ventas aumenten para que  pueda mejorar su estilo de vida y el de toda su familia. 
El no tener como trasladarse más rápidamente ha sido un problema que Mauricio ha detectado en los últimos meses y sabe que con la ayuda de un crédito podrá solventarlo.
Cristian Mauricio agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Cristian Mauricio is a 20-year-old young man. He lives in Latacunga and is single. Thanks to the effort and determination of his parents, he finished primary school but, unfortunately, he had to drop out due to a lack of financial resources. From a young age, he learned everything that his parents did so that he could improve his life a little bit. He is very passionate about sports, which helps him to stay healthy and have a lot of energy to continue working every day.

Cristian Mauricio has a business purchasing and selling scrap and has been leading the business for two years. He works 8 to 10 hours every day, along with activities in his home, which include helping his mother with household chores. Thanks to the help of God, his parents, and his desire to improve, everything has gone well for him.

He is very thankful for his life because it has given him everything that he deserves. The things that it has not given him, he says, are things that he does not need. Cristian Mauricio has acquired much experience throughout the years. 

His business has experienced growth in the past few months, so he is prepared to take the next step towards growing his business more. To do this, he is requesting a loan that he will use to purchase a tricycle, which will increase his sales so that he can improve his life and his family's life. He does not have a quick way to travel, which is a problem that he has noticed in the past few months. He knows that with the help of a loan, he will solve this problem.

Cristian Mauricio Santo thanks Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making the growth in his work life and personal life possible.

loans.use: to purchase a tricycle so that he can be mobile.

loans.name: Valentino

texts.en:
Valentino is a 57-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop business where he earns a living. He started this business to look after his family. He has hardships of inadequate capital to meet high demand, while his dream is to diversify his business into new markets.
Valentino will use the loan to buy more soap, sugar, salt, beers, and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, salt, beers, and sodas  to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more piglets to rear.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is 34years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.  She is a very hard-working and honest lady. She has to do a lot of hard work to run her household expenses. Her husband owns a small shop in which he sells beauty products. He contributes his full income for household expenses. He always tries to establish his businesses through offering the latest cosmetic products. Nowadays, he wants to buy the latest cosmetic products introduced in the market, which are in demand and expensive.
Najma has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partne,r BRAC Pakistan.  She will give the full amount to her husband so he can buy the latest cosmetic products, such as facial cream, hair colors, makeover kit, lipstick, nail polish, etc.  She hopes that this amount will enhance the businesses. 
Najma is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To buy the latest cosmetics products for resale in the shop.

loans.name: Noern's Group

texts.en:
Noern is a 38-year-old mother of two children living in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been growing rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 18 years, she and her husband can earn about 25,00KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 
Noern has been with VisionFund for seven cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family with enough food. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Noern is going to use her portion to buy farming supplies and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from current business.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He describes himself to be honest, innovative and faithful. He is a mechanic and he repairs motor vehicles and motorcycles. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy stock of maize flour, sugar,cooking oil, wheat flour and other items to enable him open a retail shop to sell these items. This will enable him increase his income. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a car.

loans.use: buy stock of maize flour, sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour and other items to enable him open a retail shop to sell these items

loans.name: Djidia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIDIA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de NIANINA, commune de MARKA COUNGO, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de l’habillement du pain, du dah et de gâteau. Les femmes du groupe DJIDIA sont à leurs septièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recourt à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente FOUNE  la troisième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenue sans succès, elle est actuellement vendeuse de pain. Elle compte acheter avec 10 sacs de pain avec son argent à MARKA COUNGO. La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte chez elle et parfois ambulante. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 28 000Fcfa par mois, qui seront injecté dans élevage de chèvres
texts.en:
Group Djidia is composed of married women, who are on average 37 years old with two children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Nianina, Marka Coungo Township, Dioila prefecture of the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through family relations, neighbors, and friends. They trade in condiments, clot,hes bread, dabissap, and cake. The women of group Djidia are on their seventh solidarity loan. To meet huge demand from their clients, they turn to Soro Yiriwaso.

Foune, the third customer from the right in the standing row, has no education. After unsuccessfully starting several businesses, she currently sells bread. With her money, she is planning on purchasing ten bags of bread in Marka Coungo. She sells from home, and occasionally itinerantly, to a mixed-gender clientele. She is planning on a 28,000 XOF monthly profit, which will be invested in raising goats.

loans.use: to buy bread.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de NIANINA, commune de MARKA COUNGO, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de céréale, du pain, du lait et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leurs septièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recourt à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente DAMA la troisième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang assis n’est pas instruite Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenue sans succès, elle est actuellement vendeuse de lait. Elle compte acheter 20 litres de lait avec les éleveurs du village. La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte au marché journalière de Marka Coungo.  Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 12. 000Fcfa par mois, qui seront réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Group Djefako is composed of married women, who are on average 42 years old with two children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Nianina, Marka Coungo township, Dioila prefecture of the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through family relations, neighbors, and friends. They trade in condiments, cereals, bread, milk, and various articles. The women of group Djefako are on their seventh solidarity loan. To meet huge demand from their clients, they turn to Soro Yiriwaso.

Dama, the third customer from the right in the sitting row, has no education. After unsuccessfully starting several businesses, she currently sells milk. She is planning on purchasing twenty liters of milk from the village’s farmers. She sells at the daily market in Marka Coungo to a mixed-gender clientele. She is counting on a 12,000 XOF monthly profit, which will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy milk.
